loan.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria luisa iniciÃ³ el negocio por el deseo de trabajar y salir adelante, de ser una persona independiente con deseos de superaciÃ³n y asÃ­ poder obtener su propio ingreso para poder ofrecerles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. ComenzÃ³ el negocio en junio de 2008. Antes se dedicaba a la venta de joyerÃ­a pero una vecina la invitÃ³ a trabajar con ella en la venta de comida y ahÃ­ se dio cuenta de que era buena ganancia por lo que decidiÃ³ independizarse con ayuda de su mamÃ¡. Poco a poco se han ido incrementando sus ventas entre sus vecinos y conocidos y personas que tambiÃ©n van por recomendaciÃ³n a comprar comida a su casa.
Ella necesita un prÃ©stamo por MXN $3000 que pagara en 8 catorcenas para comprar mercancÃ­a y algunos activos principalmente utensilios de cocina que le hacen falta como ollas, sartenes, cucharas, platos, etc. y tambiÃ©n compra de materia prima como aceite, verduras, frÃ­jol, arroz, etc. para poder brindar una mejor atenciÃ³n a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa started her business because of her desire to work and get ahead. She wanted to be an independent person with a desire to achieve and in that way have her own income to offer a better future for her children. She started the business in June 2008. Beforehand, she used to sell jewelry but a neighbor invited her to work with her selling food and realized there were good earnings in it. She became independent with her mother's help. Slowly, sales have incremented among her neighbors and people that come to buy food at her home by recommendation.

She needs a $225 loan ($3000 MXN) to buy merchandise and some cooking utensils that she needs like: pots, pans, spoons, plates, etc. Also, raw materials like: oil, produce, beans, rice, etc. in order to provide a better service for her customers.

loan.name: Romel GonzÃ¡lez Group

texts.es: G/s ABORIGEN de la comarca san francisco de la comunidad de Nindiri, compuesto por personas de bajos recursos econÃ³micos y que lo Ãºnico que necesitan es un financiamiento de adim para hacer crecer sus negocios, ellos su crÃ©ditos lo utilizan en capital de trabajo compran en el mercado municipal de Masaya por mayor y venden al detalle en su casa de habitaciÃ³n, quieren fortalecer sus negocios por que dicen que tenerlo en sus casas le permite cuidar de sus hijos y de su hogar. Don Maylorc vende tarjetas de celulares de movistar y claro , el comenzÃ³ su negocio con un pequeÃ±o capital que le obsequiaron sus padres, por ser una persona bien trabajadoras y honesta con los prestamos de adim logro que la empresa claro le diera la oportunidad de tener un telÃ©fono mÃ³vil en su casa y hoy presta este otro servicio. DoÃ±a Elisa tiene la oportunidad de contar con la ayuda de su esposo, los cuales entre los dos preparan los nacatamales y los comercializan en el mercado de Masaya. Su mayor sueÃ±o es de llegar a tener un negocio en el mercado municipal de Masaya, pues ellos tienen experiencia en la comercializaciÃ³n de frutas.
texts.en:
The â€œAborigenâ€ group from the San Francisco area of Nindiri is made up of people with few economic resources who need funding from Kiva's partner ADIM to help their businesses grow. They will use the money as working capital to buy wholesale merchandise at the Masaya municipal market. They will then sell the merchandise at retail prices from their homes, which allows them to work while taking care of their children and homes.

Maylorc sells Movistar and Claro brand prepaid cellular phone cards. His parents gave him a small amount of capital to start his business. Since he is a very hardworking and has been responsible with previous loans from ADIM, the Claro company gave him the opportunity to have a mobile phone at his home. He has now expanded his business to include the sale of prepaid cards.

Elisa works with her husband making pork tamales steamed in banana leaves and selling them at the Masaya market. Her dream is to have her own stand in the market, since she and her husband have experience selling fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital to invest in more and better products

loan.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
VÃ­ctor Hugo iniciÃ³ el negocio porque necesitaba un ingreso que le permitiera apoyar a su casa con los gastos, ya que vive con sus padres y junto con su hermano iniciaron el negocio, en un lote donde originalmente solo estaba el auto lavado. Ahora ya es una plaza donde los dueÃ±o son familiares, y acondicionaron el local acorde a los negocios dentro de la Plaza. ComenzÃ³ el negocio en mayo del 1994 por iniciativa de su hermano montaron el auto lavado donde son socios., ya que por la falta de estudio no les era posible colocarse en un empleo un poco mejor redituado. Desde que iniciamos les ha ido muy bien ya que a parte de que estÃ¡n en una plaza Comercial, los mismos clientes la han ido recomendando gracias al excelente trabajo que realizan, ya que el auto lavado tiene mas afluencia de clientes
El necesita un prÃ©stamo por MXN $3,000 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una aspiradora para hacer un mejor trabajo, ya que ese es uno de sus servicios distintivos, porque desmontan el interior para hacer el aspirado a profundidad.
texts.en:
Victor Hugo started the business because he needed and income to support his household with the expenses since he lives with his parents. Together with his brother, they started the business at a lot where originally only the car wash was built. Now it is a square where his relatives are owners and they conditioned the lot according to the existing businessess inside the square. He started the business in May of 1994. At his brother's initiative, they established a car wash where they are partners and due to their lack of education it was impossible for them to get better compensated jobs.

Since they started, it has been going very good since besides that they are located at a commercial square, the same clients have been recommended them thanks to the excellent work that they do. The car wash has a good flow of clients.

He needs a $ 225 loan ($3,000 MXN) that he will pay back in 6 months. He will use the money to buy a vaccum cleaner to do a better job. This is one of their distinctive services because they unmount the interior to do a deeper vaccum.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying a vaccum cleaner

Tiene 45 aÃ±os de edad, es conviviente y madre de 4 hijos mayores. Con el primer prÃ©stamo de S/ 500 comprÃ³ artÃ­culos de segundo uso y ferreterÃ­a para vender en su puesto de trabajo. With this loan of 1000 Soles, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy a greater quantity of second-hand articles and hardware to increase her income. loan.name: Virgen

texts.es:
Virgen iniciÃ³ el negocio porquÃ© al llegar a la colonia donde vive actualmente su esposo batallaba para encontrar trabajo y habÃ­a gastos de sus hijos y de ellos que tenÃ­an que cubrir y ella querÃ­a apoyar a su esposo. ComenzÃ³ en el mes de Mayo de 2002 ayudando a su esposo a vender pescado y chorizo, despuÃ©s el encontrÃ³ un trabajo estable pero ella decidiÃ³ seguir con el negocio de venta de pescados y mariscos. En la actualidad, aparte de elaborar y vender tamales los fines de semana, tambiÃ©n le ayuda a una vecina a elaborar comidas para los alumnos y maestros de una escuela secundaria y eso le permite tener una entrada mÃ¡s para mejorar las condiciones de vida de mi familia.
Ella necesita un prÃ©stamo por MXN $5,000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas para poder comprar pescados y mariscos y materia prima para elaborar tamales, sobre todo en esta Ã©poca de frÃ­o y de fiestas navideÃ±as que es cuando mas se vende.
texts.en:
Virgen started her business because when she arrived to her husband's neighborhood, she struggled to find work and there was the kids' expenses and theirs that needed to be covered and she wanted to support her husband. Virgen started on May of 2002 helping her husband to sell fish and chorizo. later, he found a stable job but she decided to continue the business of selling fish and seafood. Presently, besides elaborating and selling tamales during the weekends, she also helps her neighbor with the preparation of meals for the students and teachers of the secondary school and that allows her to have an extra income to improve the quality of life for her family.

She needs a $375 loan ($5000 MXN) to be able to buy more fish and seafood and raw materials to elaborate the tamales, during this cold and holiday season when they sell the most.

loan.name: Martina

SeÃ±ora Myriam is a member of the communal bank, "WiÃ±ay" in the district, province, and department of Puno. She is 43, is married, and has 4 children. loan.name: Elena Pascuala

texts.es:
Elena H. ChÃ¡vez forma parte del Banco Comunal â€œManuela Ramos de Tincoâ€ de la provincia de Carhuaz.
Elena tiene 37 aÃ±os y 04 hijos con su conviviente, ella menciona que no ha tenido problemas difÃ­ciles que enfrentar y que en la actualidad ella apoya a su conviviente que es agricultor, con su trabajo, que requiere de mucho esfuerzo, Elena se dedica a la comercializaciÃ³n de Hierbas aromÃ¡ticas y medicinales que compra por terreno en bruto y se encarga de cosechar para luego venderlos en paquetes en la feria de la ciudad de Huaraz, Zenaida comenta que cuando empezÃ³ hace cuatro aÃ±os, ella vendÃ­a solo lo que producÃ­a en su casa y en la actualidad ha crecido regularmente el negocio porque compra por lotes las hierbas para cosecharlas, aunque cuando abundan en su temporada, ella tiene que desechar la hierba porque es perecible y no sabe de quÃ© manera venderlas, por tal motivo Zenaida ha optado tambiÃ©n, por diversificar su negocio vendiendo frutas que compra en el distrito de Tinco que los vende junto a las hierbas en la ciudad de Huaraz.
Con el prÃ©stamo de s/.1800.00 que recibiÃ³ por parte del movimiento Manuela Ramos por medio de su Banco Comunal, que pagarÃ¡ en ocho cuotas invertirÃ¡ en la compra de tunas (fruto de la regiÃ³n) y frutos para venderlos en la feria de Huaraz los dÃ­as lunes y Jueves.
Elena piensa que es importante aprender para mejorar en todos los aspectos.
texts.en:
Elena H. ChÃ¡vez is a member of the Community Bank â€œManuela Ramos de Tincoâ€ in the province of Carhuaz. Elena is 37 years old and has 4 children with her partner. She hasnâ€™t really had hard problems in the past, but she would like to help her partner, who is a farmer, with his work, as it requires hard work and dedication. Elena sells herbal essence and medicinal herbs that she buys in lots of land to later on grow them and sell them in packages at the fair of the city of Huaraz. Elena tells us that when she started four years ago she used to sell only what she produced at home, but as the business expanded, she decided to buy herbs in lots of land to grow them, although during high seasons of production she needs to dispose some herbs as they are non-durable and she doesnâ€™t know how to sell her over stock. For that reason, she also decided to diversify her business and start selling fruit that she buys in the district of Tinco to later on sell them together with her herb in the city of Huaraz. With this $600 loan she requested from the Manuela Ramos moment via the Community Bank, which will be paid back in 8 months, she will purchase tunas (local fruit) and other fruit to sell at the fair of the city of Huaraz on Monday and Thursday. Elena believes it is important to learn to improve you business in every possible aspect.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase tunas (local fruit) and other fruit

loan.name: Pamela

texts.es: La seÃ±orita Pamela es socia del Banco Comunal â€œWiÃ±ayâ€ del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 18 aÃ±os de edad, es soltera, sin hijos y tiene 4 hermanos menores a los que apoya econÃ³micamente. Pamela nos cuenta que este es su primer prÃ©stamo y que estudiÃ³ para ser chef. Tiene casi medio aÃ±o trabajando con el banco comunal. Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 300, el cual serÃ¡ cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprarÃ¡ insumos para preparar pavos rellenos en navidad. Pamela desea continuar trabajando para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Miss Pamela is a member of the â€œWiÃ±ayâ€ microfinance institute in the district, province and department of Puno. She is 18 years old, single, and has no children. However, she has 4 underage siblings whom she supports financially.

Pamela states that this is her first loan, and that she studied to become a chef. She has been working with the microfinance institute for almost six months.

With this 300.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase the ingredients necessary to prepare stuffed turkeys for Christmas.

Pamela wishes to continue working in order to help support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase ingredients to make stuffed turkey

loan.name: Petrona

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Petrona es socia del Banco Comunal â€œMujeres D. Villa del Lago IIâ€ del distrito, provincia y departamento D. Puno. Tiene 68 aÃ±os D. edad, es viuda y madre D. 5 hijos mayores y vive con una hija y dos nietos. Con el primer prÃ©stamo D. S/ 300, comprÃ³ ajo, choclo y rocoto para vender en el mercado D. Yunguyo. Tiene casi 5 aÃ±os trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que ha trabajado siempre en el mercado D. Yunguyo y posteriormente se mudÃ³ a Puno para acompaÃ±ar a su hija y a sus nietos quienes estudian en esta ciudad. Con este prÃ©stamo D. S/. 1,200, el cual serÃ¡ cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprarÃ¡ mayor cantidad D. ajo, choclo y rocoto para seguir vendiendo en el mercado. Francisca desea continuar trabajando para aumentar sus ganancias para dejar herencia a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Ms. Petrona R. is a member of the â€œMujeres D. Villa del Lago IIâ€ microfinance institute in the district, province and department of Puno. She is a 68-year-old widowed mother with 5 grown up children. She lives with one of her daughters and two grandchildren.

With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased garlic, corn and hot peppers to sell at the market in Yunguyo. She has been working with the microfinance institute for almost 5 years, and she states that she has always worked at the Yunguyo market. She later moved to Puno to join her daughter and grandchildren, who study in this city.

With this 1,200.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase a greater quantity of garlic, corn and hot peppers to keep selling at the market. Francisca wishes to continue working in order to increase her earnings and leave an inheritance for her grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase garlic, corn and hot peppers

loan.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina H. D. C. forma parte del Banco Comunal â€œmujeres del futuroâ€ D. la provincia D. Huaraz.
Alejandrina tiene 61 aÃ±os y cuatro hijos con su esposo, ella comenta que no ha tenido muchos problemas en su vida personal siempre las ha podido enfrentar, aunque ya no tiene a ninguno D. sus hijos junto a ella se siente acompaÃ±ada cuando sus hijos D. tiempo en tiempo llegan a visitarla, Alejandrina se dedica a la venta D. verduras en un puesto ambulatorio en el pasaje San CristÃ³bal D. la ciudad D. Huaraz, ella comenta que ha crecido regularmente porque recuerda que empezÃ³ en este negocio con menos D. 10.00 y en la actualidad ella invierte diariamente mÃ¡s D. 40.00, en los productos que compra D. los vendedores mayoristas que traen desD. la zona costa y desD. el callejÃ³n D. Huaylas, alejandrina comenta que se siente tranquila y que las utilidades que obtiene son suficientes para ella y para el apoyo a su esposo.
Con este prÃ©stamo D. s/.500.00, que pagarÃ¡ en cuatro cuotas invertirÃ¡ en la compra D. cebollas, tomates y zanahorias.
Alejandrina desea recibir capacitaciones para mejorar su negocio y su vida personal.
texts.en:
Alejandrina H. D. C. is a member of the â€œMujeres del Futuroâ€ (Women of the Future) microfinance institute in the Huaraz province.

Alejandrina is 61 years old and has 4 children with her husband. She states that she has not had many problems in her personal life because she has always been able to face them. Even though none of her children live with her, she does not feel alone because they visit her from time to time. Alejandrina sells vegetables in a cart on San CristÃ³bal road in the city of Huaraz. She states that her business has steadily grown. She remembers that she stated the business with less than 10.00 PEN and she now invests 40.00 PEN a day purchasing products from the wholesalers who bring their goods from the coastal area and from the Huaylas alley. Alejandrina says that she feels at ease and that the profits she earns are enough for her and to help out her husband.

With this 500.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in four monthly installments, she will purchase onions, tomatoes and carrots.

Alejandrina wishes to receive training to improve both her business and personal life.


Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase vegetables (onions, tomatoes, etc.)

loan.name: Rocio Marleni

texts.es: La seÃ±ora RocÃ­o es socia del Banco Comunal â€œMujeres de Villa del Lago IIâ€ del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 20 aÃ±os de edad y es soltera sin hijos. Con el primer prÃ©stamo de S/ 500 comprÃ³ ajo para vender en su triciclo de manera ambulatoria en la calle. Tiene casi un aÃ±o trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que actualmente estÃ¡ estudiando computaciÃ³n e informÃ¡tica. Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 1,200, el cual serÃ¡ cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprarÃ¡ mayor cantidad de ajo para seguir vendiendo en su triciclo. RocÃ­o desea continuar trabajando para seguir estudiando y llegar a ser profesional, ademÃ¡s poner una tienda.
texts.en:
Miss RocÃ­o is a member of the â€œMujeres de Villa del Lago IIâ€ microfinance institute in the district, province and department of Puno. She is 20 years old, single and has no children.

With her first 500.00 PEN loan, she purchased garlic in order to sell it on her urban delivery tricycle as a street vendor. She has been working with the microfinance institute for almost a year, and she states that she is currently studying information technology.

With this 1,200.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase a greater quantity of garlic in order to continue selling it on her work vehicle.

RocÃ­o wishes to continue working so that she can keep studying and one day become a professional. Furthermore, she hopes to set up her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase garlic

loan.name: Abelina Santa

texts.es:
Abelina J. D. M. forma parte del Banco Comunal â€œNiÃ±o Manuelito IIâ€ D. la provincia D. Huaraz.
Abelina tiene 59 aÃ±os, es casada y tiene 06 hijos, Abelina comenta que no ha tenido problemas difÃ­ciles que enfrentar, y su negocio ha sido su mayor logro porque D. esta manera apoya a su esposo que es albaÃ±il, ella se dedica a la elaboraciÃ³n D. tejidos con lana sintÃ©tica D. prendas D. vestir, como chompas, chalinas, medias, guantes, etc, que los venD. a pedido a las mujeres mayoristas desD. hace 20 aÃ±os aproximadamente, este trabajo lo alterna con la compra y venta D. animales menores que compra D. las zonas rurales D. Huaraz y los venD. en la feria D. Huaraz los dÃ­as lunes y jueves, ella comenta que el tejido no le brinda muchas utilidades porque produce en pocas cantidades pero siempre la saca D. dificultades, razÃ³n por la cual tambiÃ©n realiza la venta D. animales menores.
Con este prÃ©stamo D. s/.1500.00, que pagarÃ¡ en ocho cuotas invertirÃ¡ en la compra D. lana sintÃ©tica y asÃ­ mismo cuyes y gallinas para las fiestas naviD.Ã±as.
Abelina afirma que le gustarÃ­a capacitarse para mejorar en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Abelina J. D. M. is a member of the â€œNiÃ±o Manuelito IIâ€ microfinance institute in the province of Huaraz.

Abelina is a 59-year-old married mother with 6 children. She states that she has not had to face difficulties, and that her business has been her biggest achievement because with it, she can support her husband, who is a bricklayer. She weaves knitwear out of synthetic wool for a living, making garments like sweaters, scarves, socks, gloves, etc. that she has been selling to women wholsalers by custom order for approximately 20 years. She also buys and sells small animals for a living. She buys the animals in the rural areas of Huaraz, then sells them at the local market on Mondays and Thursdays. She states that knitting does not bring in too many profits because she only makes a small amount of knitwork, but it always helps her out a bit. For that same reason, she also sells small animals.

With this 1,500.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in eight monthly installments, she will purchase synthetic wool, as well as guinea pigs and chickens for the Christmas festivities.

Abelina states that she would like to receive training in order to improve her business.


Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase synthetic wool, guinea pigs and chickens

loan.name: Gladis Adriana

texts.es:
Gladis P. F. forma parte del Banco Comunal â€œManuela Ramos de Tincoâ€ de la provincia de Carhuaz.
Gladis tiene 31 aÃ±os, y dos hijos con su conviviente, ella comenta que desde que falleciÃ³ su mamÃ¡ se ha sentido sola, siendo este hecho la mayor dificultad que ha tenido que enfrentar, Gladis afirma que ha crecido mucho en su negocio, considerando dicho crecimiento como su mayor logro. Ella comercializa animales mayores y menores, carne vacuna que lo vende en la feria de Carhuaz hace ya 04 aÃ±os, comenta que empezÃ³ con s/300.00 comprando animales menores y vendiÃ©ndolos en la feria de Carhuaz como cuyes y gallinas y que en la actualidad tiene invertido en todo su negocio un aproximado de s/15 000.00 en animales vacunos, carneros, gallinas y cuyes que compra de las zonas rurales y los vende en carne o vivos, en la feria de Carhuaz, ella tiene que enfrentar los peligros que significa trasladar a los animales en camionetas, comenta que incluso una vez sufriÃ³ un accidente cuando se dirigÃ­a a su lugar de venta.
Con este prÃ©stamo de s/.3000.00, que pagarÃ¡ en ocho cuotas invertirÃ¡ en la compra de ganado ovino.
Gladis comenta que el crecimiento que ha tenido es debido al esfuerzo individual y familiar.
texts.en:
Gladis P. F. is a member of the community bank â€œManuela Ramos de Tincoâ€ in the province of Carhuaz. Gladis is 31 years old and has 2 children with her partner. She says that since her mother's death she has felt alone. This has been the most difficult situation that she has ever faced. Gladis says that she has expanded her business a lot and that she considers this her greatest accomplishment. She sells both large and small animals. She has sold beef at the Carhuaz market for the past 4 years. She started with 300 soles, buying small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens and selling them at the Carhuaz market. She currently has a total of 15,000.00 soles invested in her business, in the form of cattle, sheep, chickens, and guinea pigs which she buys in rural areas and then sells live or butchered at the Carhuaz market. She bears the risks of transporting the animals in vans, saying that she once had an accident on her way to market. With this 3,000.00 soles loan which she will repay in 8 months, she will buy sheep. Gladis says that the growth of her business is due to her efforts and the support of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy sheep.

loan.name: Rosa Luz

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal â€œWiÃ±ayâ€ del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 46 aÃ±os de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos menores de edad. Con su primer prÃ©stamo de S/. 300 comprÃ³ productos de belleza, chocolates y lÃ¡cteos. Tiene casi 3 aÃ±os trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que el banco le permitiÃ³ cambiar de rubro a su negocio en diferentes oportunidades para ahora dedicarse a servicio de turismo. Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 3,000, el cual serÃ¡ cancelado en 4 cuotas, continuarÃ¡ capacitÃ¡ndose para mejorar su negocio. Rosa desea continuar trabajando para capitalizarse y ser independiente de prÃ©stamos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the â€œWiÃ±ayâ€ community bank in the district, province and department of Puno. She is 46 years old, married, and has 3 minor children. With her first loan of 300 soles, she purchased beauty products, chocolates, and cheeses. She has been working with the community bank for almost 3 years and tells us that the bank has allowed her to change her line of business to seize opportunities such as currently to dedicate herself to tourism services. With this 3,000.00 soles loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will receive training to improve her business. Rosa wants to continue working to make more money and become debt-free.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To receive training to improve her business.

loan.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida P. G. forma parte del Banco Comunal â€œManuela Ramos de Tincoâ€ de la provincia de Carhuaz.
Zenaida tiene 44 aÃ±os, tiene cuatro hijos con su conviviente, Zenaida comenta que ha tenido problemas difÃ­ciles que no desea recordar, menciona que su mas grande logro ha sido superarse, apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y mejorar su casa, ella se dedica a la comercializaciÃ³n de animales menores y productos de temporada que compra en las zonas rurales del distrito de Tinco y los vende en la feria de Carhuaz actividad que realiza desde hace 10 aÃ±os, ella comenta que ha crecido su negocio tal es asÃ­ que ahora ya no compra solo cuyes y gallinas tambiÃ©n compra cerdos.
Con este prÃ©stamo de s/.1000.00, que pagarÃ¡ en seis cuotas invertirÃ¡ en la compra de cerdos para crianza.
Zenaida desea recibir talleres de capacitaciÃ³n para mejorar su negocio y su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Zenaida P. G. is part of the â€œManuela Ramos de Tincoâ€ community bank in the province of Carhuaz. Zenaida is 44 years old and has 4 children with her partner. Zenaida says that she has had difficult problems which she does not wish to remember and mentions that her greatest accomplishments have been to improve her life, support her children in their studies and make improvements to her home. She sells small animals and seasonal products which she buys in rural areas of Tinco and then sells in the Carhuaz market. She has been active in this business for the past 10 years. She tells us that she has been able to build her business to a point where she can now buy not only guinea pigs and chickens, but pigs as well. With this 1,000.00 soles loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy pigs to raise. Zenaida wishes to receive training workshops to improve her business as well as her home life.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy pigs to raise.

loan.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel iniciÃ³ el negocio para obtener un ingreso que le permitiera vivir de una manera digna ya que necesitaba dinero para vivir y cubrir sus necesidades ademas de ayudar con los gastos y servicios de la casa en donde vivÃ­a. ComenzÃ³ en Febrero de 2005, vendiendo primero entre sus vecinos y amistades, despuÃ©s lo empezÃ² a hacer casa por casa. Ahora con el apoyo de crÃ©ditos ha podido crecer mas en su negocio y tener mas clientes, lo que le permitirÃ¡ tambiÃ©n invertir en juguetes para la Ã©poca navideÃ±a que se acerca
El necesita un prÃ©stamo por MXN $5000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas para comprar juguetes que le permita tener un mejor surtido que ofrecer a sus clientes en esta temporada de fiestas navideÃ±as que todos quieren estrenar ropa y regalar juguetes.
texts.en:
Miguel started his business to be able to generate an income that will allow him to live in a dignified way. He needed money to live and cover his primary needs and also help with the expenses and services of the house where he lived. He started in February 2005, selling first among his neighbors and friends and later from household to household. Now with the credit support, he has been able to grow his business more and increase his customers. It has allowed him also to invest in toys for the Christmas season that is coming up.

He needs a $375 loan ($5000 MXN) to buy toys and to allow him to have a better assortment for his customers during this holiday season when everyone wants to show new clothes and give toys as gifts.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying merchandise

loan.name: Juana Roxana

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Roxana es socia del Banco Comunal â€œDante Navaâ€ del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 40 aÃ±os de edad, es soltera y madre de 3 hijos. Con su primer prÃ©stamo de S/. 300 comprÃ³ abarrotes y cerveza para vender en su puesto de trabajo. Tiene casi 3 aÃ±os trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que su negocio ha mejorado. Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 2,000, el cual serÃ¡ cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprarÃ¡ mayor cantidad abarrotes. Juana desea continuar trabajando para tener una bodega.
texts.en:
Roxana is a member of the "Dante Nava" community bank in the district, province, and department of Puno. She is 40 years old, single, and the mother of 3 children. With her first loan of 300 soles, she purchased groceries and beer to sell. She has been working with the community bank for almost 3 years and tells us that her business has improvement. With this loan of 2,000 soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy larger quantities of groceries. Juana wishes to continue working in order to have a proper store.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy groceries for resale.

loan.name: Olga Maria

texts.es:
Olga P. I. forma parte del Banco Comunal â€œManuela Ramos de Tincoâ€de la provincia de Carhuaz.
Olga tiene 47 aÃ±os es casada con 05 hijos, aunque tuvo que superar el accidente de su esposo en el trabajo, Olga comenta que su mas grande logro ha sido tener a sus hijos y verlos profesionales, por ello recibe la ayuda constante de ellos, Olga se dedica a la producciÃ³n y comercializaciÃ³n de melocotones, que siembra en los terrenos que heredÃ³ de su padre y asÃ­ mismo los comercializa en la feria de Carhuaz, hace 15 aÃ±os. Las 500 matas melocotoneros son cuidadas por sus hijos y su esposo. Ella menciona que desea seguir mejorando su producciÃ³n porque hasta ahora le ha ido muy bien con su trabajo, por ello tambiÃ©n ha logrado educar a sus hijos y seguir creciendo.
Con este prÃ©stamo de s/.3000.00, que pagarÃ¡ en ocho cuotas invertirÃ¡ en la compra de abono y fertilizantes.
Olga durante sus 07 aÃ±os como socia en su Banco Comunal desea seguir creciendo con sus prÃ©stamos y asÃ­ mismo capacitarse para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Olga Pena I. forms part of the Community Bank "Manuela Ramos de Tinco" from the province of Carhuaz. Olga is 41 and is married with 5 children, even though she had to overcome her husband's accident at work, Olga has said that her biggest achievement has been having her children and watching them as professionals, because of this she receives their constant help. Olga is dedicated to the production and sale of peaches, which she grows on the land that she inherited from her father and she sells them in the Carhuaz fair for 15 years. The 500 peach trees are cared for by her children and her husband. She mentions that she hopes to continue improving her production because until now it has gone very well with her work, because of it she has been able to educate her children and keep growing. With this loan of s/. 3,000 which will be paid in eight payments, she will invest in the purchase of compost and fertilizers. During her seven years as a member of her communal bank, Olga has hoped to continue growing with her loans and herself to be able to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying compost and fertilizers

loan.name: Olga SofÃ­a

texts.es: La seÃ±ora SofÃ­a es socia del Banco Comunal â€œDante Navaâ€ del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 31 aÃ±os de edad, es separada y madre de 2 hijos. Con su primer prÃ©stamo de S/. 500 comprÃ³ combustibles para venderlos en su puesto de trabajo. Tiene casi un aÃ±o trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que tambiÃ©n se dedica a la venta de cigarrillos al por mayor y hace tejidos para vender. Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 1,500, el cual serÃ¡ cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprarÃ¡ mayor cantidad de cigarrillos para vender en las fiestas de navidad y aÃ±o nuevo. Ella desea continuar trabajando para llegar a tener su tienda propia.
texts.en:
Ms. SofÃ­a C. is a member of the â€œDante Navaâ€ microfinance institute in the district, province and department of Puno. She is 31 years old, separated and has 2 children.

With her first 500.00 PEN loan, she purchased fuel to sell at her stand. She has been working with the microfinance institute for almost a year now, and she states that she is also a cigarette wholesaler and sells handwoven knitwear.

With this 1,500.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase a greater quantity of cigarettes to sell during the Christmas and year-end festivities.

Ms. C. wishes to continue working so that she can one day open up her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase cigarettes

loan.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia RamÃ­rez SÃ¡enz forma parte del Banco Comunal â€œMujeres Yungainas al Progresoâ€ D. la provincia D. Yungay.
Julia es casada, tiene 43 aÃ±os y dos hijos, Julia comenta que todo le ha ido bien, que todos sus problemas han sido sencillos D. superar y que siempre ah contado con el apoyo D. su esposo y D. sus pequeÃ±os, siendo esto su mas granD. logro, tener una familia constituida y ya mÃ¡s D. 10 aÃ±os D. casada, es asÃ­ que Julia colabora con su esposo en el negocio, que es la venta D. carne en el mercado D. Yungay en el puesto nÂ°10 , carne que compran del camal para luego venderlo directamente, ella menciona que ha bajado el negocio D. la carne, porque con el alza D. los precios ya los clientes ya no compran mucho este producto, pero D. todas maneras, ella afirma que seguirÃ¡ aÃºn con este negocio por ser un negocio que tiene junto a su esposo mÃ¡s D. 10 aÃ±os.
Con este prÃ©stamo D. s/.800.00, que pagarÃ¡ en seis cuotas lo invertirÃ¡ en la promociÃ³n D. su hijo.
Julia comenta que necesita saber sobre otros tipos u otras alternativas D. negocio para poder seguir trabajando y creciendo.
texts.en:
Julia RamÃ­rez SÃ¡enz is a member of the community bank â€œMujeres Yungainas al Progresoâ€ in the province of Yungay. Julia is married, 43 years old, and has 2 children. Julia says that everything has gone well, that she has overcome all her problems and that she has always been able to count on her husband's and children's support. She feels that having a tight-knit family is her greatest achievement, after 10 years of marriage. Julia works together with her husband in their business, which is the sale of meat in the Yungay market in stall # 10. They buy the meat to sell direct. She tells us that meat sales have slowed because of higher prices and customer no longer buy as much. Regardless, she tells us that she will continue in this business, which she has been doing for more than 10 years together with her husband. She will use the 800 soles loan for her son's graduation. Julia says that one needs to know about other businesses or other alternatives in order to continue working and growing.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: For personal use: to pay for her son's graduation expenses.

loan.name: Valentina

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Valentina es socia del Banco Comunal â€œMujeres Unidas al Triunfoâ€ del distrito, provincia y departamento. Tiene 57 aÃ±os de edad, es separada y tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad. Con el primer prÃ©stamo de S/. 300 comprÃ³ mercaderÃ­a para vender en su puesto de trabajo en el puerto. Tiene 18 ciclos trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que vive con su hija, su nieto y su yerno. Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 1,200, el cual serÃ¡ cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprarÃ¡ panetones y demÃ¡s mercaderÃ­a para ser vendida en las fiestas de navidad. Valentina desea continuar trabajando para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Valentina is a member of the community bank â€œMujeres Unidas al Triunfoâ€ in the district, province, and department. She is 57 years old, separated, and has 5 adult children. With her first 300 soles loan, she bought merchandise to sell in her stall in the port. She has been working for 18 cycles with the community bank and says that she lives with her daughter, her grandson, and her son-in-law. With this 1,200 soles loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy panettones and more merchandise to sell during the Christmas holiday. Valentine wants to keep working in order to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy panettones and other merchandise.

loan.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin es productor de leche de vaca, misma que es comercializada a la Empresa PIL (Planta Industrializadora de Leche); tambiÃ©n cuenta con un carro con el que trabaja en su misma comunidad transportando alimentos para los ganados, por que en el sector no entra movilidad; la esposa colabora con el cuidado de los ganados. Edwin tiene dos hijos de 4 y 6 aÃ±os de edad y vive con su familia en la comunidad Cotacota â€“ Pucarani Provincia Los Andes a una dos y media de la ciudad de El Alto.
El crÃ©dito lo destinarÃ¡ para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad, lo cual que le ayudarÃ¡ para mayor producciÃ³n de leche, y en consecuencia un mejoramiento de sus ingresos.
Es primer crÃ©dito con Impro, la evaluaciÃ³n realizada califica a Edwin para la aprobaciÃ³n del prÃ©stamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Edwin is a producer of cow's milk, which is sold in the PIL business (Industrialized Milk Plant). He also has a car with which he works in his own community transporting feed for cattle because mobility is limited in his area. His wife works with him in tending the cattle. Edwin has two children of 4 and 6 years of age and lives with his family in the community Cotacota-Pucarani in the Andes Province about an hour and a half from El Alto. The loan will be used fro the purchase of a milk cow of average quality, which will help him to improve milk production, and consequently improve his income. This is his first loan from Impro, whose evaluation showed Edwin qualified to receive the loan he is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of cattle.

loan.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela es productora de leche de vaca; tiene dos vacas de cuya producciÃ³n de leche provienen sus ingresos con los que cubre su manutenciÃ³n y estudios universitarios. Vive en la casa de sus padres en la comunidad Muruamaya- Viacha Provincia Ingavi a dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto.
El crÃ©dito lo destinarÃ¡ para la compra de una vaquilla para su posterior producciÃ³n de leche.
Es primer crÃ©dito con Impro, la evaluaciÃ³n realizada califica para la aprobaciÃ³n del prestamos solicitado.
texts.en:
Mariela is a producer of cow's milk. She has two cows, whose milk production provides income which covers the cost of living and university studies for her children. She lives in her parents' home in the community of Muruamaya- Viacha Province Ingavi, about 2 hours from the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase one female calf for its later production of milk. This is her first credit with Impro, her evaluation showed that she is qualified to receive the loan she is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of cattle.

loan.name: Eloy Julio

texts.es:
Eloy es chofer propietario de un taxi mismo que trabaja como trufi interciudad La Paz â€“ El Alto. Esta es su principal fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutenciÃ³n de su familia. Eloy vive en casa alquilada ubicada en la Zona Alto San Pedro Ciudad de La Paz.
El prÃ©stamo lo destinarÃ¡ la reparaciÃ³n de su herramienta de trabajo (taxi) para poder continuar prestando servicio de transporte publico.
Es segundo crÃ©dito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro prÃ©stamo.
texts.en:
Eloy is a chauffeur and has his own taxi that he uses for transport between La Paz and El Alto. This is his principal source of income with which he covers the cost of living for his family. Eloy lives in a rented house located in the Alto San Pedro Zone in the city of La Paz. The loan he is requesting will be used for repairing his taxi in order to be able to continue providing service as a public transport. This is his second loan with Impro, his good payment history allowed him to request another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Maintenance of his Taxi

loan.name: SafiÃ©tou

Elle veut acheter un rÃ©frigÃ©rateur, des sacs de pain de singe (fruit du baobab), du sucre pour prÃ©parer et vendre des glaces, des jus et des crÃ¨mes glacÃ©es. Son souhait est de renforcer son activitÃ© afin dâ€™amÃ©liorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Le prÃªt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursÃ© au bout de six mois en une seule Ã©chÃ©ance.
texts.en:
SafiÃ©tou ManÃ©, age 48, is married and the mother of two children who are in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of KandÃ© Alassane for eight years and wants to buy a refrigerator, sacks of "monkey bread" (the fruit of the baobab tree), and some sugar to make and sell ice, juices, and ice cream. Her wish is to bolster her business to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

loan.name: Willy

texts.es:
Willy es chofer propietario de un taxi que trabaja como trufi inter-ciudad La Paz â€“ El Alto, la esposa es comerciante de masitas que comercializa en las ferias populares. Estas dos actividades se convierten en sus principales fuentes de ingreso. Viven en casa de la hermana de Willy, ubicada en la Zona ExaltaciÃ³n de la Ciudad de El Alto.
El prÃ©stamo lo destinarÃ¡ la reparaciÃ³n de su herramienta de trabajo (taxi) para poder continuar prestando servicio de transporte publico.
Es primer crÃ©dito con Impro, la evaluaciÃ³n socio econÃ³mica realizada permite aprobarle el prÃ©stamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Willy is an owner-driver of a taxi who has a route between the cities of La Paz and El Alto. His wife sells cookies at local fairs. These two activities are their main source of income. They live in Willy's sister's home, in the neighbourhood of Zona ExaltaciÃ³n in El Alto. The loan will be use to repair the taxi in order to continue to be able to offer public transportation services. This is his first loan with Impro; the socio-economic evaluation results qualify Willy for the loan requested.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.name: Astou

texts.fr: Astou F., veuve est membre du banc villageois de KandÃ© Alassane depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter de lâ€™huile de palme, de la pÃ¢te dâ€™arachide, des bidons et des seaux pour renforcer son petit commerce. Les produits sont achetÃ©s Ã Yarang et revendu Ã Ziguinchor. Elle vend aussi des cacahuÃ¨tes Ã tout moment. Elle participe aux dÃ©penses familiales et contribue au bien Ãªtre de sa famille. Le prÃªt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursÃ© au bout de six mois en une seule Ã©chÃ©ance.
texts.en:
Astou F. is a widow. She has been a member of the village loan group of KandÃ© Alassane for seven and a half years and wants to buy some palm oil, peanut butter, containers, and buckets to bolster her modest business. Goods are purchased in Yarang and are resold in Ziguinchor. Astou also sells peanuts anytime. She is helping to cover family expenses and contributes to the well-being of her family. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Commerce in palm oil and peanut butter

loan.name: Miriam Francisca

texts.es:
Miriam, como muchas mujeres bolivianas, es madre soltera de tres hijos de 18, 9 y 6 aÃ±os de edad; el esposo la abandonÃ³ hace cinco aÃ±os y ella se convirtiÃ³ en padre y madre de sus hijos. Miriam trabaja como comerciante de vÃ­veres y tambiÃ©n tiene una tienda donde confecciona polleras y mantas para cholitas. Vive en la casa de su padre ubicada en la zona Villa Ingenio â€“ Rio Seco, de la Ciudad de El Alto.
El crÃ©dito lo destinarÃ¡ para la compra de materia prima (telas) para confeccionar mayor cantidad de polleras y mantas, pues esta actividad es la que le genera mayores ingresos.
Es el primer crÃ©dito con Impro, la evaluaciÃ³n realizada permite la aprobaciÃ³n del prÃ©stamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Miriam, like many Bolivian women, is a single mother of three children, ages 6, 9 and 18; her husband abandoned her five years ago and she became both mother and father to her children. Miriam sells food and also has a shop where she makes traditional gathered skirts and shawls for mestizo women. Miriam lives with her father in a house located in the Villa Ingenioâ€“Rio Seco area of El Alto. The loan is for the purchase of fabric for making high quality skirts and shawls, as this is the business that generates most of her income. This is her first loan with Impro. After an assessment she was approved for the loan she had requested.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working Capital

loan.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca iniciÃ³ el negocio porquÃ© siempre le ha gustado el comercio, ademÃ¡s de que por donde vive no habÃ­a quien vendiera verduras lo cual la motivÃ³ a empezar a venderlas y poco a poco ha ido agregando mÃ¡s productos. ComenzÃ³ en Agosto de 1992, a vender verduras desde que llego a su actual domicilio, posteriormente abriÃ³ una tiendita, pero por cuestiones de una enfermedad tuvo que cerrarla y quedarse solamente con el negocio de las verduras. Hoy en dÃ­a de nuevo ha comenzado a levantar su tiendita y ya la tiene mÃ¡s surtida.
Ella necesita un prÃ©stamo por MXN $5,000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas para comprar mÃ¡s verduras y abarrotes que le permitan tener bien surtida su tienda para este mes de diciembre en que las ventas aumentan por motivo de las fiestas navideÃ±as.
texts.en:
Francisca started her business because she has always liked commerce. Also, because in the area that she lives there was no one that sells any produce and that motivated her to start selling it and slowly, she has been adding more products. She started selling produce on August 1992 as soon as she arrived at her current address. Lately, she opened a small shop but due to health reasons, she had to close it and only stayed with the produce business. Today, she has started again to build up her small shop and provide it with more assorted products.

She needs a $375 loan to buy more produce and groceries that will allow her to keep the shop with a good assortment of products during the month of December when the sales increase due to the holiday festivities.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying merchandise

loan.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama T., 43 ans, mariÃ©e mÃ¨re de 07 enfants dont deux filles dÃ©jÃ mariÃ©es est membre du banc villageois de KandÃ© Alassane depuis 8 ans. Elle veut acheter des tissus teintÃ©s, des bijoux, de lâ€™huile de palme et des poissons sÃ©chÃ©s pour renforcer son commerce. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer Ã la charge familiale Le prÃªt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursÃ© au bout de six mois en une seule Ã©chÃ©ance.
texts.en:
Mariama T., age 43, is married and the mother of seven children, including two daughters who are already married. She has been a member of the village loan group KandÃ© Alassane for eight years and wants to buy some dyed fabrics, jewelry, palm oil, and dried fish to bolster her commerce. Her income enables her to help cover family expenses. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Commerce in dyed cloth, palm oil, and dried fish

loan.name: Joaquin

texts.es: El seÃ±or JoaquÃ­n GonzÃ¡lez Matinez vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz, con su hijo. El seÃ±or JoaquÃ­n trabaja como costurero en su taller, elaborando buzos deportivos que comercializa a los comerciantes minoristas de La Paz. Requiere el crÃ©dito para el incremento de capital ya que la compra de tela en poca cantidad le significa un costo mayor de producciÃ³n y sus ganancias se minimizan. Esta es la quinta vez que solicita prÃ©stamo y el anÃ¡lisis socioeconÃ³mico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder a un crÃ©dito.
texts.en:
Mr. JoaquÃ­n GonzÃ¡lez Matinez lives with his son in his parents' house in the Sopocachi neighborhood of La Paz. Joaquin makes athletic clothing in his workshop, which he then sells to retailers in La Paz. Joaquin needs this loan for working capital, since when he buys fabric in small quantities his production costs increase and his profits decrease.

This is the fifth time Joaquin has requested a loan from IMPRO, and he has received a good credit score following a socioeconomic analysis, so he qualifies for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy fabric in bulk

loan.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Ignacio inicio el negocio ya que requerÃ­a de una actividad econÃ³mica redituable para asegurar que su hijos pudieran tener una educaciÃ³n universitaria como el deseo que el tenia. ComenzÃ³ el negocio en Marzo de 1995 era ayudante en su juventud de un taller de vidrierÃ­a y cuando se caso se vio en la necesidad de independizarse y tener su propio taller gracias a su empleo anterior el ya tenia muchos clientes potenciales que conocÃ­an de la calidad de su trabajo y esto le a facilitado las cosas para tener un negocio de Ã©xito.
El necesita un prÃ©stamo por MXN $5000 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una mayor cantidad de mercancÃ­a para atender un mayor numero de clientes y ampliar su mercado.
texts.en:
Ignacio started his business in order make enough money to ensure that his children would have the opportunity to get a college education, which he wishes he had had. He started his business in March of 1995. In his youth he was an assistant at a glass workshop and when he got married he saw the need to be independent and have his own workshop. Thanks to his previous work he had many potential clients who knew the quality of his work. This has helped him to build a very successful business.

Ignacio needs a loan for $5,000 MXN, which he will repay in 6 months. With the loan he will purchase a larger quantity of supplies so that he can work with more customers and grow his business.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase supplies

loan.name: Jesus

texts.es: El seÃ±or JesÃºs Q. Q. vive en casa propia, en la zona de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con sus dos hijos ya que su esposa falleciÃ³. El seÃ±or JesÃºs comercializa llamas que compra en la regiÃ³n del altiplano y los vende en una poblaciÃ³n distante a dos dÃ­as arreando el ganado. El crÃ©dito es para la compra de una mayor cantidad de llamas pues no cuenta con suficiente capital para que le salga ganancias que le permitan subsistir. Esta es la tercera vez que solicita prÃ©stamo y el anÃ¡lisis socioeconÃ³mico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder a un crÃ©dito.
texts.en:
JesÃºs Q. Q. Lives in his own home in the Pasankeri neighborhood on the west side of the city of La Paz. He is a widower and lives with his two children.

Jesus sells llamas, which he buys in the highlands of western Bolivia. He then shepherds the herd of llamas to a town two days away, where he sells them. This loan will be used to buy more llamas, since Jesus doesn't have enough investment money to earn enough to live on.

This is the third time Jesus has requested a loan from IMPRO. He has received a good credit score following a socioeconomic analysis, so he qualifies to receive this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy more llamas

loan.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela es madre de 3 hijos: Patricia de 39 aÃ±os, JesÃºs de 36 aÃ±os y Coral de 33 aÃ±os, todos adultos. Ella iniciÃ³ el negocio en Abril de 2003 porquÃ© necesitaba tener un ingreso para sostenerse ella y una hija que tenÃ­a muy enferma ya que hace mas de cinco aÃ±os su esposo los abandonÃ³ y dejo de ayudarles. Lamentablemente su hija muriÃ³ tiempo despuÃ©s inicio el negocio gracias a una vecina que la animÃ³ a que vendiera productos de belleza ya que ella le decÃ­a que estos productos siempre tienen una buena demanda. Poco a poco fue progresando porque sus clientes fueron aumentando al igual que sus ganancias y al dÃ­a de hoy le va bien. AdemÃ¡s de la venta de cosmÃ©ticos en esta temporada navideÃ±a ella elabora manualidades alusivas a la navidad con lo que incrementa un poco mÃ¡s sus ganancias.
Ella necesita un prÃ©stamo por MXN $10,000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas para comprar cosmÃ©ticos y materia prima para la elaboraciÃ³n de sus que le permitirÃ¡n atender los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marcela is a mother of three children: Patricia of 39 years, JesÃºs of 36 years and Coral of 33 years, all of whom are adults. She started her business in April of 2003 because she needed sufficient income to support herself and one of her daughters, who was very sick and whose husband abandoned and stopped supporting them over five years ago. Sadly, her daughter died a short while after she started her business. She started selling beauty products after being encouraged to sell them by a neighbor who said that there was always a good demand for beauty products. Little by little she made progress as she increased her customer base as well as her income, which is still progressing to this day. In addition to selling cosmetics, she sells Christmas themed handicrafts during the Christmas season, which help to increase her earnings.

Marcela needs a loan for $10,000 MXN, which she will repay in 12 payments. The loan will be used to purchase cosmetics and raw materials to create her Christmas handicrafts so that she can fill the orders from her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Jorge

texts.es: El seÃ±or Jorge ImaÃ±a U. vive en casa propia, en la zona de Villa FÃ¡tima, de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa la seÃ±ora Gueysi VÃ¡squez. El seÃ±or Jorge se dedica a la elaboraciÃ³n de pan casero que vende diariamente a los vecinos de su zona y adyacentes. El crÃ©dito es para aumentar su capital de trabajo y comprar mÃ¡s harina, ya que se estÃ¡n presentando la oportunidad de elaborar otras masitas que le permitan incrementar sus ganancias. Esta es la tercera vez que solicita prÃ©stamo y el anÃ¡lisis socioeconÃ³mico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder a un crÃ©dito.
texts.en:
SeÃ±or Jorge ImaÃ±a U. lives with his wife, Gueysi VÃ¡squez, in their own home in the Villa Fatima neighborhood of the city of La Paz. Jorge bakes homemade bread, which he sells each day to the people in his area and in surrounding neighborhoods. He plans to use this loan as working capital and to buy more flour so that he can start making different kinds of baked goods and earn more.

This is the third time that Jorge has requested a loan from IMPRO. After a socioeconomic analysis, he has received a good credit score, so he qualifies for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy flour

loan.name: Juana Celia

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Juana vive en casa propia con su hermano en la calle Chorolque de la zona 14 de septiembre de la ciudad de La Paz. La actividad que realiza es la elaboraciÃ³n de piÃ±atas y canastitas para fiestas infantiles; el crÃ©dito que solicita es para la compra de material ya que el papel y el cartÃ³n que ella utiliza es mejor comprarlo en cantidad para reducir el costo y obtener mejores ganancias.
El historial de la seÃ±ora es muy bueno por lo tanto califica para obtener un nuevo crÃ©dito.
texts.en:
Juana lives in her own home on Chorolque Street in the 14 de Septiembre neighborhood of the city of La Paz. She makes piÃ±atas and little baskets for children's parties. She is requesting this loan to buy materials, since it's best to buy paper and cardboard in bulk to reduce costs and earn more.

Juana has excellent credit history, so she qualifies to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy paper and cardboard

loan.name: Maria Imelda

texts.es:
Imelda iniciÃ³ el negocio porquÃ© el padre de sus hijos los abandonÃ³ y tenÃ­a que sostener a sus hijos y como querÃ­a darles lo mejor, fue por eso que decidiÃ³ iniciar su negocio, ya que aunque era empleada en un Motel, el sueldo no le alcanzaba para darles todo. ComenzÃ³ en 1982 vendiendo productos cosmÃ©ticos entre sus compaÃ±eros de trabajo y vecinos, en las noches tambiÃ©n vendÃ­a cenas para completar para los gastos de la casa pues hijos estaban muy pequeÃ±os. Posteriormente, tambiÃ©n empecÃ© a vender productos de otra marca que es en la actualidad a lo que mas se dedica, ademÃ¡s tambiÃ©n esta vendiendo billetes de loterÃ­a y ropa nueva.
Ella necesita un prÃ©stamo por MXN $8,000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas para comprar cosmÃ©ticos y tener un surtido extenso para esta Ã©poca de fin de aÃ±o en donde los clientes demandan mÃ¡s productos.
texts.en:
Imelda started her business because the father of her children abandoned them and she had to support her children. She wanted to give her children the best life she could and although she was employed by a motel, she felt that she did not earn enough to provide her children with everything she wanted for them. In 1982 she began selling cosmetic products to her coworkers and neighbors. She also sold dinners at night in order to help pay for the household expenses since her children were very young. Later, she began selling products of a different brand and now spends the majority of her time selling these products. In addition, she sells lottery tickets and new clothes.

Imelda needs a loan for $8,000 MXN, which she will repay in 12 payments. The loan will be used to buy cosmetics so that she will have an extensive assortment of products to sell during the end of the year season, when her customers have a higher demand for her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Juana

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Juana vive en casa de sus padres en la calle G de la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz , trabaja como profesora en un colegio de la ciudad; el crÃ©dito que solicita es para educaciÃ³n ya que desde hace un aÃ±o atrÃ¡s ella asiste a un curso de actualizaciÃ³n el cual le obligaron a tomar para conservar su trabajo y en un futuro mejorar su sueldo.
El historial de la seÃ±ora es muy bueno por lo tanto califica para obtener un nuevo crÃ©dito.
texts.en:
Juana lives in her parents' house on G Street in the Llojeta neighborhood of the city of La Paz. She works as a schoolteacher in one of the city's schools. This loan is for educational purposes: for the past year, Juana's employers have required her to take a training course in order to keep her job and to earn a higher salary in the future.

Juana has a very good credit history, so she qualifies to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Pay for continuing education classes

loan.name: Silviana Jael

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Silviana vive en alquiler con su mamÃ¡ con la cual comparte los gastos de la casa, vive en la calle Burgos de la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz; ella trabaja en una radio emisora donde le pagan un salario mÃ­nimo, el crÃ©dito que solicita es para la compra de una computadora y con el equipo que tiene, mas un socio, instalar un cafÃ© Internet por su zona ya que es un lugar muy alejado y no cuentan con este servicio. TambiÃ©n de esta manera poder generar mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida
El historial de la seÃ±ora es muy bueno por lo tanto califica para obtener un nuevo crÃ©dito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silviana lives in a rental unit with her mother with whom she shares household expenses. She lives on Burgos street in the Achachicala zone in the city of La Paz. She works at a radio station where they pay her a minimal salary. The loan she is requesting is for buying a computer. With the equipment she has, she and a partner will open an Internet cafe in their neighborhood since it's a remote area and they don't yet have this service. In this way, she will also be able to increase her income and improve her quality of life.

Silviana's credit history is very good, and she is qualified to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of a computer

loan.name: Flor Magaly

texts.es:
Flor SÃ¡nchez C. forma parte del Banco Comunal â€œNiÃ±o Manuelito IIâ€ de la provincia de Huaraz.
Flor tiene 23 aÃ±os y es madre soltera de una niÃ±a, la dificultad mas grande para ella ha sido tener que enfrentar la separaciÃ³n de su conviviente hace tres aÃ±os ella afirma â€œser padre y madre para mi hijaâ€ es un reto muy grande, ella en la actualidad no tiene un negocio estable debido a que cuando su hija ingresÃ³ al jardÃ­n le ha dificultado realizar la actividad que siempre ha realizado el de vender comida y brindar alimentaciÃ³n a los trabajadores de la zona de TacllÃ¡n que trabajan en la extracciÃ³n de arena y agregados de construcciÃ³n, ella espera mejorar y reintegrarse al trabajo pronto porque su hija saldrÃ¡ de vacaciones.
Con este prÃ©stamo de s/.1700.00, que pagarÃ¡ en seis cuotas lo destinarÃ¡ en el arreglo de su casa para el enlucido con yeso de las paredes y techo de su casa y tener mejores condiciones de vida debido a que actualmente es totalmente de adobes y tierra.
A flor le gustarÃ­a aprender otras alternativas de negocio y continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Flor SÃ¡nchez C. is part of the communal bank â€œNiÃ±o Manuelito IIâ€ in the province of Huaraz.

Flor is 23 years old and is the single mother of one little girl. Her greatest difficulty has been dealing with the separation from her partner three years ago. She states that "being the father and mother for my daughter" is a difficult challenge. She does not currently have a stable business since, when her daughter entered kindergarten, it became difficult for her to carry out her former job of selling food and bringing it to the workers in the TacllÃ¡n region who extract sand and other construction aggregates. She hopes it will get better and she can get back into her work soon because her daughter will be out for vacations.

With this loan for $575, which she will repay in six payments, she will make repairs to her home to replaster the walls and roof of her home and improve their living conditions, since the house is currently made of adobe and earth.

Flor would like to learn other ways of doing business and to continue working.


Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Repairs on the front, walls, and roof of her house.

loan.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz Maria comenzÃ³ su negocio en el mes de Agosto de 1995 cuando llego a la ciudad de Tampico, Tamaulipas con su hijo reciÃ©n nacido a la casa de una tÃ­a, que fue la que le apoyÃ³ al ver su situaciÃ³n. Primero empezÃ³ a ayudarla a ella en su negocio de Agua Purificada, y ya despuÃ©s que se junto con su actual pareja y se cambio de domicilio a otra colonia, vio que en esa zona casi no habÃ­a expendios de agua, por lo que se asocio con su tÃ­a para distribuir el agua que ella fabrica en la zona donde vive, por lo que actualmente surte en las tiendas de la zona y a particulares. En la actualidad, aparte del negocio de agua tambiÃ©n se dedico a promover vales de zapatos de una prestigiada zapaterÃ­a de la ciudad de los cuales obtiene una comisiÃ³n como ganancia y tambiÃ©n trabaja en la cooperativa de una escuela secundaria vendiendo comida para los alumnos y maestros.
Ella necesita un prÃ©stamo por MXN $5,000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas para comprar mas botellones ya que cada dÃ­a esta ampliando mas su zona de reparto y tambiÃ©n para comprar materia prima para la elaboraciÃ³n de las comidas.
texts.en:
Luz Maria started her business in August of 1995 when she arrived at her aunt's house in the city of Tampico, Tamaulipas with her recently born son. Her aunt supported Luz Maria upon seeing her situation. First, Luz Maria began to help her aunt in her purified water business. After she joined with her current parter and moved her home to another district, she saw that in this zone there were almost no water suppliers. For this reason, she formed a partnership with her aunt to distribute the water that she makes in the region where she lives, which Luz Maria now supplies to the stores in the district and to private homes. Currently, aside from the water business, she also promotes shoes for a prestigious shoe store in the city. She receives a commission as her earnings. She also works in the store of a high school, selling food for the students and teachers. Luz Maria needs a loan of $5,000 Mexican pesos, which she will repay in 10 bi-monthly installments, to buy more large bottles, since her delivery zone is expanding each day. She also needs the loan to buy staples for preparing the foods.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: to buy large bottles and staples to prepare food

loan.name: Victoria

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal â€œMujeres de Villa del Lago IIâ€ del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 38 aÃ±os de edad, es casada y es madre de 5 hijos. Con el primer prÃ©stamo de S/ 300 comprÃ³ frutas y verduras para vender en su puesto de trabajo. Tiene casi un aÃ±o trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que ha aumentado sus golosinas para vender en su triciclo, actividad a la que ahora se dedica. Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 700, el cual serÃ¡ cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirÃ¡ en una mayor cantidad de golosinas para vender es su puesto. Victoria desea continuar trabajando para comprar un local fijo donde vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres de Villa del Lago II" in the district, province, and region of Puno. She is 38 years old, married, and has five children. With her first 300 soles loan she bought fruit and vegetables to sell at her stall. She has been with the communal bank for almost a year and shared with us that she expanded the sales of sweets from her tricycle, which is what she does now. With this 700 soles loan, which will be repaid in four payments, she will invest in more candies to sell from her stall. Victoria wishes to continue working in order to buy a locale where she can sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela CarreÃ³n, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To stock up on sweets

loan.name: Zulema Genoveva

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Zulema es socia del Banco Comunal â€œWiÃ±ayâ€ del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 46 aÃ±os de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Con su primer prÃ©stamo de S/. 300 comprÃ³ ropa y productos de belleza para venderlos en su domicilio. Tiene casi 5 aÃ±os trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que aumentÃ³ sus ganancias desde que empezÃ³ con su negocio. Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 1,600, el cual serÃ¡ cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprarÃ¡ mÃ¡s ropa y productos de belleza para venderlos en su casa. Zulema desea continuar trabajando para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Zulema is a member if the communal bank â€œWiÃ±ayâ€, located in the district, province and region of Puno. She is 46 years old, and married with three children. With her first loan for 300 Peruvian soles Zulema bought clothing and beauty products in order to sell them from her home. She has been working with the communal bank for 5 years and reports that she has increased her earnings since she started her business. With this loan for 1,600 Peruvian soles, which will be repayed in 4 installments, Zulema will buy more clothing and beauty products to sell from her home. Zulema's wish is to continuing working to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy clothing and beauty products

loan.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia V. G. forma parte del Banco Comunal â€œManuela Ramos de Tincoâ€ de la provincia de Carhuaz.
Lidia tiene la edad de 30 aÃ±os, es madre soltera de 01 hijo, aunque tiene una profesiÃ³n, ella observa que su mayor logro ha sido tener y mantener su negocio, Lidia comenta que con su trabajo asume todas las responsabilidades para su hijo porque el padre de Ã©ste no se hace cargo, situaciÃ³n que Lidia reconoce como la mÃ¡s difÃ­cil que tiene que enfrentar porque su hijo aÃºn cuando es muy pequeÃ±o siempre desea ver a su padre. Lidia dedica su tiempo a la venta de abarrotes que compra desde Huaraz o de los distribuidores y otros productos en una bodega en su casa frente al Ã³valo de Tinco en la calle principal, con ayuda de su madre y su familia, ahora ella comenta que le va bien se encuentra mÃ¡s tranquila y su deseo es crecer e invertir para poder cubrir las necesidades familiares en especial de su hijo.
Con este prÃ©stamo de s/.1300.00, que pagarÃ¡ en seis cuotas invertirÃ¡ en la compra de abarrotes y productos de navidad como son mÃ¡s panetones y otros insumos.
Lidia afirma que le gustarÃ­a recibir capacitaciones para mejorar su negocio y con mayor Ã©nfasis su vida personal.
texts.en:
Lidia V. G. is part of the communal bank â€œManuela Ramos de Tincoâ€ in the Carhuaz province. Lidia is 30 years old and the single mother of a son. Although she was trained in a profession, she states that her greatest achievement has been owning her own business. Lidia comments that she assumes all of the responsibilities of her work for her son. His father does not take responsibility for him, creating a situation that Lidia recognizes as the most difficult she faces. Her son is still very small and for that reason always longs to see his father. Liliana sells groceries that she buys in Huaraz or from the distributors, along with other products, in a store in her home. She says that with the help of her mother and family, all is going well for her and she finds herself calm. Her wish is to grow and invest in order to be able to cover the necessities of her family, especially those of her son. With this loan for 1,300 Peruvian soles which she will repay in 6 installments, Lidia will invest in the purchase of groceries and Christmas products such as Christmas breads and other holiday foods. Lidia adds that she would like to receive training to improve her business, so that she can improve her personal life, as well, when she is able to put more emphasis on it.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of groceries and other products

loan.name: Juana Alberta

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Juana vive en casa propia con una D. sus hijas en la calle Cumana D. la zona D. Villa Nuevo PotosÃ­ D. la ciudad D. La Paz; tiene una tienda D. abarrotes ubicada en la Av. Buenos Aires, con esta actividad ella se mantiene y pueD. cubrir sus necesidades D. alimentaciÃ³n y ropa. El crÃ©dito que solicita es para la compra D. mÃ¡s productos y tener su tienda con bastante stock y D. esta manera no perder clientela y mejorar sus ingresos.
El historial D. la seÃ±ora es muy bueno por lo tanto califica para obtener un nuevo crÃ©dito. Es cliente D. IMPRO desD. el aÃ±o 2003.
texts.en:
Juana lives in her own home on Cumana Street in the Villa Nuevo Potosi zone of the city of La Paz with one of her daughters. She owns a a grocery store located on Buenos Aires Avenue. With the earnings from her store she supports herself and is able to cover her needs for food and clothing. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy more products in in order to stock her store well. This will assure that she does not lose clients and will allow her to improve her income. Juana's credit history is very good and qualifies her to receive a new loan. She has been a client of IMPRO since 2003.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital

loan.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana V. G. forma parte del Banco Comunal â€œManuela Ramos de Tincoâ€ de la provincia de Carhuaz.
Liliana tiene 37 aÃ±os de edad es madre soltera de 02 hijos, ella es profesora, y siendo su profesiÃ³n el mas grande logro en su vida personal, Liliana alterna su trabajo de profesora con la actividad de crianza y comercializaciÃ³n de cerdos, animal que compra en la feria de Carhuaz o de la zona rural del distrito de Tinco y lo vende a pedido en su casa o lleva la carne directamente hasta los compradores. Liliana afirma que ha crecido regularmente porque cuando iniciÃ³ su negocio lo hizo con una inversiÃ³n de s/300.00 y en la actualidad ella invierte mÃ¡s de s/1000.00 en cada compra, aunque comenta que en la Ãºltima compra que realizÃ³, la carne de uno de los cerdos tenÃ­a triquina (parÃ¡sito que se aloja en la carne de cerdo, totalmente daÃ±ino para la salud humana), problema comÃºn en este negocio afirma Liliana, razÃ³n por la cual ahora tambiÃ©n comercializarÃ¡ cuyes para diversificar sus productos y seguir creciendo en su negocio.
Con este prÃ©stamo de s/.2,500.00, que pagarÃ¡ en ocho cuotas invertirÃ¡ en la compra de cuyes y cerdos.
Liliana asume que es necesario aprender de nuevas alternativas de negocio para seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Liliana V. G. is part of the communal bank â€œManuela Ramos de Tincoâ€ in the Carhuaz province. Liliana is 37 years old and the single mother of 2 sons. She is a teacher and considers her profession the greatest achievement of her personal life. Liliana alternates her work as a teacher with work growing and selling pigs. She buys the animals at the Carhuaz fair or in the rural zone of the Tinco district and then sells them to order from her home, or delivers the meat directly to her clients. Liliana asserts that her business has grown steadily. When she started the business she did so with an investment of 300 Peruvian soles and currently she invests more than 1000 soles into every animal purchase. However, she add that one of the pigs she bought in her last purchase was infested with trichina (a parasite that lives in pork meat and is a threat to human health); trichina is a common problem in Liliana's line of business. For that reason she will now also market guinea pigs in order to diversify her products and continue growing her business. With this loan of 2,500 soles, which she will repay in 8 installements, Lillian will invest in the purchase of guinea pigs and swine. Liliana takes as a given the need to learn about new lines of business in order to continue growing.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy young animals (guinea pigs and swine)

loan.name: Noe Magdiel

texts.es:
Noe iniciÃ³ el negocio para poder obtener ingresos mejores ya que su salario como empleado era muy poco y no les alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos familiares y sus hijos cada vez pedÃ­an mÃ¡s cosas para la escuela. ComenzÃ³ el negocio en Marzo de 2001 ya que su papÃ¡ y hermano que son albaÃ±iles, ellos le enseÃ±aron el oficio ya que como empleado ganaba muy poco y de esta forma pudo obtener mayores ingresos. Su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco pero hoy ya puede hacer construcciones mas grandes, comenzÃ³ haciendo trabajos pequeÃ±os como revoques, bardas, pegar pisos, etc. pero ahora ya puedo hasta construir una casa.
El ahora necesita un prÃ©stamo por MXN $3,000 que pagara en 8 catorcenas para comprar algunas herramientas para poder realizar mejor su trabajo asÃ­ como material como: yeso, cemento y pegamento de azulejos y aprovechar esta Ã©poca de fin de aÃ±o en que la gente procura arreglar sus casas
texts.en:
Noe began this business so that he would be able to earn more income since his salary as an employee was very small and was not enough to cover the familyâ€™s expenses; his children always need more things for school. He started the business in March 2001 because his father and brother, both of whom are bricklayers, taught him the trade since he earned very little as an employee. In this way, he was able to earn a better income. His business has been growing little by little but nowadays he can pursue larger construction projects. He began doing small projects such as plastering, straw work, fixing floors, etc. Now he can build a house. At this time, he needs a loan of MXN $3,000, which he will repay in 8 periods of fourteen days. The loan will be used to buy some tools so that he can pursue more work and buy material like plaster, cement, and glue for tiles. He will take advantage of this time at the end of the year, when people try to repair their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy tools

loan.name: Ivan Andres

texts.es:
El seÃ±or Ivan vive en casa de sus suegros con su esposa en la calle San CristÃ³bal de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz, se dedica a la fabricaciÃ³n artesanal de botas para damas, con esta actividad mantiene su hogar, el crÃ©dito que solicita es para la compra de material (cuero, goma, etc.) ya que se acercan las fiestas de fin de aÃ±o y tiene muchos pedidos.
El historial crediticio de Ivan es bueno y por lo tanto califica para obtener un nuevo crÃ©dito.
texts.en:
Ivan lives in his inlaw's home on San CristÃ³bal Street in the Tacagua zone of the city of La Paz with his wife. He earns his living handcrafting boots for women. He supports his household with this work. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of materials (leather, rubber for soles, etc.) since the end of year holidays bring him lots of orders.

Ivan's credit history is good, and qualifies him to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of materials

loan.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
AngÃ©lica iniciÃ³ el negocio debido a que su esposo es comisionista, por lo que el ingreso familiar no era fijo, lo que hacia que en ciertas fechas estuviera apurados para completar los gastos bÃ¡sicos de la familia., por lo cual decidieron poner una papelerÃ­a ya que su esposo conoce de ese negocio, debido a que es comisionista de una papelera grande. ComenzÃ³ el negocio en agosto de 1993, en lo que era la sala de su casa, la acondiciono en pequeÃ±o para poner unos pocos estantes y un pequeÃ±o mostrador con artÃ­culos de papelerÃ­a bÃ¡sicos, lo que trajo consigo que se dieran a conocer dentro de la colonia la cual era relativamente nueva. Desde que inicio le ha ido muy bien ya que sus mismos clientes la han ido recomendado lo que le ha permitido generar mas clientes, en la actualidad ademÃ¡s de vender artÃ­culos de papelerÃ­a, venden regalos y novedades acordes a las necesidades de sus clientes, y como hay cerca una escuela esto les permitiÃ³ brindar un nuevo servicio que es el fotocopiado de documentos, que aumento considerablemente los ingresos
Ahora ella necesita un prÃ©stamo por MXN $11,000 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una fotocopiadora mÃ¡s y poder dar un mejor y mas rÃ¡pido servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
