Angelica began her business since her husband is a commission agent and their household income was not secure. This made it so, on certain dates, the family was short of the income needed for basic household expenses. For this reason, they decided to set up a stationery store since her husband knows this business, as he was a commissioner for a large stationery store. She began the business in August of 1993 in what was the living room of their house. She prepared a small space to put a few shelves and a small counter with basic stationery items, which she brought with her to make the products known through the relatively new district. Since it began, the business has gone very well given that her clients have recommended her which has allowed her to generate more clients. Currently, in addition to selling stationery items, they sell gifts and novelties according to the needs of her clients. And, since there is a school nearby, they are able to offer a new service, photocopying documents, which has considerably increased their income. Now she needs a loan of $11,000 Mexican pesos, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy another photocopier so that she can provide better and faster services to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: to buy a photocopier

loan.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es: Maria es comerciante y venD. ropa y artÃ­culos para el hogar, su esposo es empleado y tiene 3 hijos Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Irpavi II D. la ciudad D. La Paz. Vive en casa propia pero no cuenta con el servicio D. alcantarillado Es la es la sexta vez que solicita un crÃ©dito en Impro, y la tercera que requiere el apoyo D. Kiva. El crÃ©dito solicitado serÃ¡ usado en la compra D. mÃ¡s ropa y articulos para el hogar. Su trabajo y las ganas D. superaciÃ³n le permiten acceder a este crÃ©dito ya que con esta ayuda mejoraran sus ingresos y por enD. su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Maria is a merchant who sells clothes and other homeware. Her husband is employed and they have three children. Her home is located in the Irpavi II zone of the city of La Paz. She lives in her own house but does not yet have a sewage system installed. This is the sixth loan she has taken out with IMPRO and the third that she will finance with Kiva. The loan requested will be used to purchase more clothes and small home items. Her work and desire to improve allows Maria to access this credit which will help increase her income and therefore her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital

loan.name: Zully Vanessa

texts.es: La seÃ±orita Zully es socia del Banco Comunal â€œWiÃ±ayâ€ del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 21 aÃ±os de edad, es soltera y madre de un hijo menor de edad. Con su primer prÃ©stamo de S/. 300 comprÃ³ abarrotes para su bodega. Tiene casi 3 aÃ±os y medio trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que su negocio ha crecido desde que estÃ¡ trabajando con el banco comunal. Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 1,500, el cual serÃ¡ cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprarÃ¡ panetones y productos navideÃ±os para vender en su bodega. Zully desea continuar trabajando para hacer crecer su bodega.
texts.en:
Miss Zully is a member of the Communal Bank â€œWiÃ±ayâ€ in the district, province, and department of Puno. She is 21 years old, single and mother of a young son. With her first loan of (about) $100 she purchased general goods for her store. She has worked for about 3 and a half years with the Communal Bank and tells us that her business has grown since working with the bank. With this loan of $500, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase dessert bread and Christmas products to sell in her general store. Zully hopes to continue working toward making her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase dessert bread and Christmas items

loan.name: Juliana

texts.es: Juliana se dedica a la venta de chamarras de cuero y carteras. Su esposo es albaÃ±il contratista y tiene cuatro hijos. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz. Vive en alquiler ya que no cuenta con una vivienda propia. Es la quinta vez que solicita un crÃ©dito en Impro, y la cuarta vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crÃ©dito. El crÃ©dito serÃ¡ destinado para la compra de materia MercaderÃ­a. (chamarras, carteras, bolsones) Su antecedente crediticio le permite acceder a este crÃ©dito ya que tiene experiencia en el trabajo.
texts.en:
Julian sells leather jackets and wallets. Her husband is a contracted bricklayer and they have 4 children. He home is located in the de Irpavi II zone of the city of La Paz. She lives in a rental since she does not own her own home. This is the fifth time she has requested a loan with Impro, and the fourth time she has required help from Kiva. Her credit history qualifies her as a top client, which is to say that she has an excellent repayment history of her loans. The loan will be used for the purchase of merchandise materials. (Jackets, wallets, bags). Her previous loan allowed her to continue to this loan since she now has work experience.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Business Capital

loan.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene es comerciante se dedica a la venta D. chicharrÃ³n D. cuero D. chancho seco, su esposo es empleado. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona D. Irpavi II y vive en Alquiler Su actividad econÃ³mica D. la seÃ±ora es la venta D. chicharron D. chancho ambulando por las calles ya que no cuenta con un puesto fijo y asÃ­ le pueD. ayudar para generar ingresos a su esposo. Sus ganas D. trabajar le permiten acceder a este crÃ©dito ya que serÃ¡ D. gran ayuda para su actividad econÃ³mica. Es la sexta vez que solicita un crÃ©dito en impro y la tercera vez que requiere la ayuda D. Kiva. El crÃ©dito serÃ¡ destinado para la compra D. mercaderÃ­a (cuero D. chancho, sal, pimienta).
texts.en:
Irene is a business woman who sells deep fried pork rind. Her husband is her employee. Their home is a rental located in the Irpavi II neighborhood. Irene sells pork rinds on the street walking from place to place because she does not have a food stall, and in this way has been able to generate income to assist her husband. Her desire to work qualifies her for this loan, which will proviD. a substantial stimulus to her business. This is the sixth time Irene has requested a loan from Impro and the third time she has required Kivaâ€™s assistance. The loan will be used for the purchase of ingredients (pork rind, salt and pepper).

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working Capital

loan.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty L. F. forma parte del Banco Comunal â€œMujeres Yungainas al Progresoâ€ de la provincia de Yungay.
Betty tiene la edad de 34 aÃ±os tiene 02 hijos con su conviviente, aunque siempre su dificultad ha sido ver la irresponsabilidad de su conviviente, porque no se ocupa de sus hijos, ella afirma que tener a sus hijos ha sido lo mejor que le ha podido suceder porque significan la razÃ³n de vivir para Betty, ella vende comida en el Jr. Santa Rosa S/n ex oficina de la radio Maravilla, prepara los alimentos en este lugar para venderlos a sus clientes, comenta que ha crecido regularmente porque iniciÃ³ este negocio hace 01 aÃ±o con un prÃ©stamo que logrÃ³ obtener por medio de su banco comunal y en la actualidad abrirÃ¡ un puesto de comida en los mÃ³dulos del mercado en la feria de Yungay donde piensa implementar su negocio para brindar mejor servicio
Con este prÃ©stamo de s/.2000.00, que pagarÃ¡ en seis cuotas invertirÃ¡ en la compra de mesas, sillas y una vitrina para implementar su puesto de venta.
Betty afirma que necesita aprender sobre como manejar un negocio.
texts.en:
Betty L. F. is a member of Yungay Provinceâ€™s Mujeres Yungainas al Progreso community bank. Betty is 34 years old and has two children by her common law husband, but his irresponsibility has been a constant source of difficulties because he does not support their children. Betty claims that having her children has been the best thing that could have happened because it gives her a reason for living. She sells food on Santa Rosa Boulevard, at the former offices of the Maravilla radio station. She prepares the food on site to sell to her customers. She says that her customers have steadily increased since beginning the business one year ago with a loan that she was able to obtain through her community bank. Now she will open a food stall in the market at the Yungay fair, where she plans to start a business to provide better service. This loan of $675 (2000 Peruvian nuevos soles), which she will repay in six installments, will be invested in setting up her stall, in the purchase of tables, chairs and a cabinet. Betty says that she needs to learn how to manage a business.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of tables, chairs and a cabinet.

loan.name: Amalia Rufina

texts.es: Amalia se dedica a la venta de fruta; es casada y tiene un hijo. La fruta la vende en las ferias de la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz. Y requiere el crÃ©dito para la compra de fruta por carga para reducir sus costos y aumentar sus ingresos. Vive en la zona de bajo irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz en casa alquilada. Es la tercera vez que solicita un crÃ©dito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crÃ©dito.
texts.en:
Amalia sells fruit. She is married and has one child. She sells fruit at the local markets in the city of La Paz, and needs a loan in order to purchase fruit by the bushel in order to reduce her costs and increase her income. She lives in a rental home in the lower Irpavi section of the city of La Paz. This is the third time that she has applied to Impro for a loan. Her credit history, the way she repays her loans, makes her an excellent credit risk.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working Capital

loan.name: Adela Megina

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora ADELA MEGINA es socia del Banco Comunal â€œSANTA ANAâ€, vive en Departamento de San MartÃ­n, Provincia y Distrito de Moyobamba. Se dedica a la venta de sabanas y cosmÃ©ticos. Vende de manera ambulatoria visitando las casas de sus amigas vecinas y familiares.
Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 2,000, el cual serÃ¡ pagado en 06 cuotas mensuales, comprarÃ¡ sabanas de diferentes tamaÃ±os modelos y colores, asÃ­ como tambiÃ©n ropa para damas caballeros y niÃ±os como polos, blusas, camisas, pantalones entre otros. Una parte quiere invertir en la compra de cosmÃ©ticos que tienen mayor rotaciÃ³n y que estÃ¡n de oferta para luego venderlos al precio normal y obtener mayores ganancias y asÃ­ aprovechar las fiestas de fin de aÃ±o y satisfacer las exigencias de su clientela.
La SeÃ±ora Adela tiene 44 aÃ±os de edad, vive con su pequeÃ±o hijo y su esposo que tiene un taller de cerrajerÃ­a. Su meta es llegar a tener una tienda-bazar en su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adela Megina is a member of the Santa Ana Communal Bank. She lives in the San MartÃ­n department in the province and district of Moyobamba. She sells bedsheets and cosmetics. She practices ambulatory sales, visiting the houses of her friends, neighbors, and family. With this loan of $675, which she will repay in 6 monthly payments, she will purchase sheets of different sizes, styles, and colors, as well as clothing for women, men, and children like polos, blouses, shirts, pants and other things. A part of the loan she wants to invest in the purchase of cosmetics so that she has a better rotation and to be offered later for sale at normal prices to obtain higher income and take advantage of the end of year festivals and satisfy the demands of her clientele. Adela is 44 years old, lives with her young son and her husband who has a locksmith's shop. Her goal is to have a boutique store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of sheets, clothing for women, men, and children, as well as cosmetics.

loan.name: Carmen Ita

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora CARMEN ITA pertenece al Banco Comunal â€œLOS JAZMINESâ€, vive en la RegiÃ³n San MartÃ­n y Provincia y distrito de Moyabamba, se dedica a la venta de panes, roscas, biscochos y dulces. Desarrolla su negocio en un puesto que tienen en el mercado central de la ciudad.
Con este crÃ©dito de S/. 3,000, el cual serÃ¡ pagado en 6 meses, comprarÃ¡ diariamente insumos como harina, azÃºcar en sacos, levadura para la preparaciÃ³n de panes y panteones para aprovechar las fiestas navideÃ±as y asÃ­ satisfacer la gran demanda de sus clientes.
La seÃ±ora Carmen Ita tiene 36 aÃ±os de edad y es madre de 03 hijos con quienes vive junto a su esposo.
Carmen manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es un apoyo para ella y para su familia, asÃ­ como para las demÃ¡s mujeres emprendedoras. Su meta es contar con un negocio en su propia casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen Ita is a member of the Communal Bank "Los Jazmines" (the Jasmines). She lives in the San MartÃ­n region in the province and district of Moyabamba. She sells bread, rolls, spongecake, and sweets. She develops her business in a location that she has in the central market of the city. With this loan of $1000, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy daily supplies like flour, sacks of sugar, yeast for preparing breads and Christmas cakes to take advantage of the Christmas festivals and satisfy they great demand from her clients. Carmen Ita is 36 years old and mother of 3 children who live with her and her husband. Carmen says that Manuela Ramos is a support for her and her family, as they are for the rest of hardworking business women. Her goal is to have a business in her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of flour, sacks of sugar, and yeast for preparing bread and Christmas cakes.

loan.name: Virginia Mercedes

texts.es:
Virginia MejÃ­a J. forma parte del Banco Comunal â€œNiÃ±o Manuelito IIâ€ de la provincia de Huaraz.
Virginia tiene 40 aÃ±os, es casada y tiene 03 hijos, comenta virginia que no ha tenido problemas difÃ­ciles que enfrentar, al contrario ella transcurre tranquilamente por la vida y siendo su negocio su mas grande logro que le sirve para apoyar a su esposo y a su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de materiales agregados que recoge de las mÃ¡rgenes del rÃ­o Santa en el barrio de TacllÃ¡n en las afueras de la ciudad de Huaraz, virginia extrae todos los dÃ­as arena fina y gruesa para venderlos a los compradores que trasladan el producto hasta las obras de construcciÃ³n; ella comenta que ha crecido regularmente y no tiene muchas dificultades con esta actividad.
Con este prÃ©stamo de s/.1500.00, que pagarÃ¡ en ocho cuotas invertirÃ¡ en su negocio, con la compra de materiales para extracciÃ³n (lampas), asÃ­ mismo comprarÃ¡ a los mÃ¡s pequeÃ±os recolectores de materia prima para venderlos en mayor cantidad a los que trasladan los agregados de construcciÃ³n.
virginia desea recibir capacitaciones para mejorar su negocio y su vida personal.
texts.en:
Virginia MejÃ­a J. is part of the Communal Bank, â€œNiÃ±o Manuelito II,â€ in the province of Huaraz. Virginia is 40 years old, married and has 3 children. Virginia comments that she has not had very difficult problems to confront, on the contrary, she has gone through life peacefully. The greatest success of her business is that it serves to support her husband and her family. She sells various materials that she collects from the banks of the Santa river in the neighborhood of TacllÃ¡n on the outskirts of the city of Huaraz. Every day Virginia extracts fine sand and thick mud to sell to buyers that transport the supplies to construction sites. She says that her business has grown regularly and she does not have many difficulties with this work. With this loan of $500, which she will repay over the course of 8 months, she will invest in her business through the purchase of materials for extraction (lamps). She will also purchase smaller containers of raw material to sell in the large quantities to buyers. Virginia hopes to receive training to improve her business and her personal life.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of lamps and other materials.

loan.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Carmen, socia del Banco Comunal â€œEl Alto Mayoâ€, vive en el Departamento de San MartÃ­n, provincia y distrito de Rioja. Se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas caballeros y niÃ±os. Su negocio estÃ¡ ubicado en un puesto que tiene en el mercado central de la ciudad.
Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 3,000, el cual serÃ¡ cancelado en 6 meses, comprarÃ¡ ropa para damas como polos, blusas, pantalones, ropa para niÃ±os y niÃ±as para atender los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes quienes son la razÃ³n de su negocio, ademÃ¡s quiere aprovechar las fiestas de fin de aÃ±o.
Carmen tiene 38 aÃ±os de edad, vive con sus 02 hijos y con su esposo quien le apoya en sus proyectos. Su meta es seguir con su negocio, mantenerlo bien surtido para fidelizar a su clientela y capturar nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Carmen, a member of the "El Alto Mayo" Communal Bank, lives in the department of San Martin, province and district of Rioja. She sells clothing for women, men and children. Her business is located at a stand she has in the city's central market. With this loan for S/. 3,000, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy women's clothing such as t-shirts, blouses and pants, and clothing for boys and girls, so that she can take care of her customers' requests, since they are the reason for the business, and she also wants to take advantage of the year-end holidays. Carmen is 38 years old and lives with her 2 children and her husband, who are supportive of her projects. Her goal is to keep the business going and well-stocked so that she maintains her clients' loyalty and gets new clients.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase women's clothing, such as t-shirts, blouses and pants, and clothing for boys and girls.

loan.name: Paola Alejandra

texts.es: Paola se dedica a la venta de cosmÃ©ticos y perfumes en las oficinas y mercados. Otorga su producto a crÃ©dito, para poder cobrar cada dÃ­a, a la semana o cada quincena Es una persona que se esfuerza para poder generar ingresos para su familia ya que es madres soltera. Se hizo operar de la vista pues tenia cataratas, aun asÃ­ cumpliÃ³ con su crÃ©dito y siguiÃ³ trabajando. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Bolognia de la ciudad de La Paz. Vive en Alquiler El crÃ©dito serÃ¡ destinado para capital de Trabajo (Perfumes, cosmÃ©ticos, desodorantes, cremas y otros) El crÃ©dito le ayudara a mejorar sus condiciones de vida ya que aumentarÃ¡ sus ingresos en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Paola sells cosmetics and perfumes in offices and at markets. She offers her products on credit, which she collects daily, weekly or on each payday. She is a person who works hard to generate income for her family, since she is a single mother. She was operated on for cataracts, but even so was able to meet her loan repayments and continue working. Her home, which she rents, is located in the Bolognia section of the city of La Paz. This loan will be used for working capital (perfumes, cosmetics, deodorants, creams and other products). The loan will help her improve her standard of living since she will be able to increase her income from sales.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital

loan.name: Celinda

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Celinda, socia del BC â€œLos Jazminesâ€, vive en la RegiÃ³n San MartÃ­n, Provincia y distrito D. Moyobamba. Tiene 61 aÃ±os D. edad, es madre D. 06 hijos, quienes ya son independientes. Se dedica a la venta D. menestras sancochadas y quesos en su puesto en el mercado central D. la ciudad.
Con este prÃ©stamo D. S/. 1,500, el cual serÃ¡ pagado en 6 meses, comprarÃ¡ diferentes variedades D. frijoles como huasca, canario, pinto entre otros para sancocharlos y venderlos al menudeo, tambiÃ©n comprarÃ¡ leche en grandes cantidades para la preparaciÃ³n D. quesos y satisfacer los gustos D. sus clientes.
Celinda es una mujer muy trabajadora que quiere crecer en su negocio, ademÃ¡s mÃ¡s adelante desea surtir mas su negocio con mÃ¡s variedad D. productos a ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Celinda, a member of the "Los Jazmines" Communal Bank, lives in the San Martin region, province and district of Moyobamba. She is 61 years old and the mother of 6 children, who are all adults. She sells stews and cheeses from her stand in the city's central market. With this loan for S/. 1,500, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy different varieties of dried beans such as canary beans and pinto beans, to cook and sell. She will also buy large quantities of milk to prepare cheeses and satisfy the different tastes of her customers. Celinda is a very hard-working women who wants to see her business grow. In the future she would like to offer a greater variety of products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy different varieties of dried beans.

loan.name: Leocadia Lola

texts.es:
Leocadia C. M. forma parte del Banco Comunal â€œManuela Ramos de Tincoâ€ de la provincia de Carhuaz.
Leocadia tiene 49 aÃ±os y tiene 04 hijos, Leocadia comenta que ha tenido que superar muchos problemas junto a su esposo, el tener que enfrentar la enfermedad de su hijo por ejemplo, ella menciona que para iniciarse en el negocio ha tenido que superar muchos temores, el de acceder a un crÃ©dito principalmente que poco a poco ha ido superando, ella afirma que ha crecido mucho en su negocio, Leocadia comercializa productos de la regiÃ³n que compra en la feria de Carhuaz y lo vende en la ciudad de Lima de donde tambiÃ©n compra flores para venderlos a pedido en la ciudad de Huaraz y Carhuaz con la ayuda de su hermana. Leocadia afirma que le agrada trabajar y apoyar a su familia con su trabajo.
Con este prÃ©stamo de s/.3000.00, que pagarÃ¡ en ocho cuotas invertirÃ¡ en la compra de mercaderÃ­a para venderlos en la ciudad de Lima y Flores amarillas para las fiestas de fin de aÃ±o.
A Leocadia le gustarÃ­a capacitarse para mejorar en su vida personal y en su negocio.
texts.en:
Leocadia C. M. is part of the "Manuela Ramos de Tinco" Communal Bank in the province of Carhuaz. Leocadia is 49 years old and has 4 children. She tells us that she and her husband have had to overcome many problems, such as the illness of her son for example. To start up her business she had to overcome many fears, mainly that of taking out a loan, but little by little she has progressed and her business has grown alot. Leocadia sells regional products which she buys at the market in Carhuaz and sells in the city of Lima, where she buys flowers which she then sells in Huaraz and Carhuaz with the help of her sister. Leocadia enjoys working and helping out her family through her work. With this loan for S/. 3,000, which will be repaid in 8 installments, she will buy goods to sell in Lima and yellow flowers to sell during the year-end holidays. Leocadia would like to take courses to make improvements in both her personal life and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy flowers wholesale.

loan.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Consuelo, socia del BC â€œMujeres Emprendedorasâ€â€, vive en la RegiÃ³n San MartÃ­n, Provincia y distrito de Moyobamba. Tiene 42 aÃ±os de edad, es madre de 04 hijos, todos ya son independientes. Se dedica a la venta de frutas asÃ­ como aguajes, pijuayo entre otros, asÃ­ como dulces de la regiÃ³n. Desarrolla su negocio en la vereda de una de las boticas mÃ¡s concurridas de ciudad.
Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 3,000, el cual serÃ¡ pagado en 6 meses, comprarÃ¡ aguajes en sacos, pijuayos en racimos, harina para preparar biscochuelos y Mani en kilos para preparar dulces y venderlos al menudeo, tambiÃ©n quiere comprar materiales para construir cuartos en su casa y poder alquilarlos mÃ¡s adelante.
Consuelo es una mujer emprendedora que estÃ¡ agradecida a Manuela Ramos por la confianza que le dio al brindarle un prÃ©stamo que la ayudÃ³ a crecer en su negocio. Desea mÃ¡s adelante arreglar su casa para poner un negocio.
texts.en:
Consuela, a member of the "Mujeres Emprendedoras" Communal Bank, lives in the San Martin region, in the province and district of Moyobamba. She is 42 years old and the mother of 4 children, who are all adults. She sells fruit such as palm fruit and pijuayo as well as regional sweets. She has her business outside one of the busiest pharmacies in the city. With this loan for S/. 3,000, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy sacks of palm fruit, pijuayos, flour for preparing biscocheulos (honey bread) and peanuts for preparing sweets, which she will sell at retail. She will also buy materials for building some rooms onto her house which she will rent out. Consuelo is a hard-working woman who is grateful to Manuela Ramos for giving her a loan to help her grow her business. In the future she would like to fix up her house so she can set up her business there.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buys sacks of palm fruit, pijuayos, flour to prepare biscochuelos (honey bread) and peanuts

loan.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Rosalina B. PÃ©rez forma parte del Banco Comunal â€œMujeres Yungainas al Progreso de la provincia de Yungay.
Rosalina tiene 31 aÃ±os y dos hijos con su conviviente, ella comenta que su principal dificultad ha sido superar la muerte de sus padres hace 04 aÃ±os, donde ha tenido que recuperarse por el bienestar de sus hijos, RosalÃ­a comenta que con su trabajo ha podido construir su casa, asÃ­ mismo comprar un carro de trabajo y tambiÃ©n tiene muebles para el uso familiar; ella se dedica a la venta de comida en el mercado central de la ciudad de Yungay en un puesto del segundo piso hace 8 aÃ±os, menciona que cuando empezÃ³ invirtiÃ³ s/1000.00 soles aproximadamente y ahora tiene invertido en todo su negocio mas de s/3000.00 , y no ha tenido muchos problemas en su negocio.
Con este prÃ©stamo de s/.1000.00, que pagarÃ¡ en seis cuotas invertirÃ¡ en la promociÃ³n de su hijo, porque comenta que su hijo ha terminado un nivel en el colegio
Rosalina piensa que es necesario capacitarse en cuestiones de negocio para mejorar su actividad.
texts.en:
Rosalina B. P. is part of the "Mujeres Yungainas al Progreso" Communal Bank in the province of Yungay. Rosalina is 31 years old and has two children with her partner. It has been hard for her to recover from the death of her parents 4 years ago, but she has had to make an effort for the good of her children. With her work she has been able to build her home as well as buy a small cart for her job and furniture for the family. For the past 8 years she has sold food from a stand on the second floor of the city of Yungay's central market. When she started out she invested around S/. 1,000 and now she has a total of more than S/. 3,000 invested and has had very few problems with the business. With this loan for S/. 1,000, which will be repaid in six installments, she will invest in her son's education: he has just finished a level in school. Rosalina thinks she needs business training so that she can improve in that activity.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Personal use, education expenses for her son.

loan.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es:
Su Nombre es Mercedes del Carmen E. LÃ³pez tiene la edad de 55 aÃ±os, su estado civil es casada, DoÃ±a Mercedes tiene 2 hijos sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor tiene 30 aÃ±os de edad y labora por cuenta propia y su hijo menor de 13 aÃ±os y cursa el 5 grado de primaria, su esposo no labora recientemente, sus deseos mas grande son de realizarle las mejoras pertinente a su vivienda para tener una mejor comodidad para sus hijos y su familia en un futuro, sus propÃ³sitos son de aumentar en su negocio y mantenerlo activo para que este le pueda seguir generando ingresos ya que en este momento lo que ocupa su mayor interÃ©s es el proporcionarle a sus hijos estabilidad en los estudios para que estos tengan un buen porvenir para el dÃ­a de maÃ±ana.
La actividad econÃ³mica a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de cerdos, la ubicaciÃ³n de su negocio es en su casa de habitaciÃ³n en chichigalpa, ella inicio su negocio por cuenta propia por lo que tenia que sacar adelante a su familia al inicio no tenia mucha afluencia de clientes antes realizaba la venta de nacatamales pero debido a que todo esta mas caro no le resultaba suficientes ingresos y al venderlos a un precio mucho mas bajo de lo que ella habÃ­a invertido en su producto no le daba los resultados esperados por lo que le resulta de manera mas factible comercializar el producto a otros paÃ­ses ya que tiene ciertos amigos que viajan al extranjero y le efectÃºan encargos de carne de cerdo por lo que asÃ­ decidiÃ³ quedarse con este negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita invertir en la compra de mas cerdos.
texts.en:
Her name is Mercedes del Carmen E. LÃ³pez. She is 55 years old and married. Mercedes has 2 children: the elder is 30 years old and is self-employed and the younger is 13 years old and in grade 5. Her husband is recently unemployed. Her greatest wish is to make improvements to her home so that her children can live more comfortably. She plans to build a future for her family by increasing her business and continue working so that the business can continue to generate income which will allow her to provide her children with stability for their studies, that they may have a bright future. She buys and sells pigs. Her business is home-based in Chichigalpa. She started her business on her own as she had to make a better life for her family. Initially, she sold nacatamales (typical food) and did not have many clients and due to high costs the business did not generate enough income. She had to sell her food for a much lower price than it cost her to make it. It became more feasible to sell her product abroad: she has friends who travel abroad and who placed orders for pork with her, and therefore she has decided to focus on this business. The loan she requests is working capital because she needs to invest in the purchase of more pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La SeÃ±ora de Nombre Martha Lorena GutiÃ©rrez tiene la edad de 41 aÃ±os, su estado civil es casada DoÃ±a Martha tiene 3 hijos de los cuales sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 20 aÃ±os trabaja por cuenta propia y su otro hijo de 12 aÃ±os que cursa el 1 aÃ±o de secundaria y su otro hijo de 15 aÃ±os cursa el 3 aÃ±o de secundaria, su compaÃ±ero de vida labora de obrero en el Ingenio San Antonio, las aspiraciones que DoÃ±a Martha tiene son de mantener su negocio y lograr tener mas recurso para almacenar su materia prima, sus deseos son sobrevivir a la situaciÃ³n econÃ³mica ya que no quiere que siempre se mantenga la ayuda para los paÃ­ses pobres pese a la situaciÃ³n polÃ­tica del paÃ­s en sus sueÃ±os esta lograr mejorara su casa y que sus hijo puedan tener una carrera profesional ya que tanto esfuerzo que ha realizado hasta la fecha no quiere que sea en vano para que el dÃ­a de maÃ±ana puedan enfrentar los retos para el dÃ­a de maÃ±ana.
La actividad econÃ³mica a la que se dedica es la venta de tortillas y venta de refrescos, la ubicaciÃ³n de su negocio es en su casa de habitaciÃ³n en chichigalpa, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 3 aÃ±os, su negocio inicia por su Mama que fue la fundadora del negocio y paso a sus manos de DoÃ±a Martha y lo logrado ya que desde ahÃ­ se hace cargo de su Mama y sus hijos y a la misma vez mantiene los mismos clientes y tambiÃ©n con su negocio de refrescos ya que este no tiene mucho tiempo de poseerlo pero ha logrado tener mas clientes con este negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene darle mas inversiÃ³n a su negocio para la compra de materia prima como: leÃ±a, maÃ­z y para los refrescos azÃºcar, frutas, sal y leche por lo que no quiere que la afluencia de clientes se disminuya por no ofrecer lo suficiente.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena GutiÃ©rrez is 41 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her eldest child is 20 years old and is self-employed; her second is 15 years old and in the 3rd year of high school; her third is 12 years old and in the 1st year of high school. Her partner is a labourer for the Ingenio San Antonio sugar mill. Martha's dreams are to keep her business and have a better ability to store her raw materials; her wish is to survive the economic situation as she does not want continued aid for poor countries despite the political situation. She dreams of improving her home and that her children may have a career; she has worked so hard that she does not want it all to be in vain, so that they will be prepared for future challenges. She sells tortillas and refreshments from her home in Chichigalpa. She has had this business for 3 years. Her mother started the business, and passed it to Martha who is now responsible for her mother's care in addition to that of her children, all the while serving the same clients in addition to her refreshments business which she has not had for very long but thanks to which she has managed to increase her client base. The loan is for working capital as she wants to invest in her business by buying basic materials such as wood, corn and for the refreshments: sugar, fruit, salt and milk as she does not want to lose customer due to not having enough to offer them.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital

loan.name: Eva Gloria

texts.es:
Eva C. T. forma parte del Banco Comunal â€œNiÃ±o Manuelito IIâ€ de la provincia de Huaraz.
Eva tiene 50 aÃ±os de edad, y tiene 04 hijos con su conviviente, Eva afirma que no ha tenido dificultades las cuales no pudiera superar, asegura que ver por sus hijos y tener su negocio han sido sus mayores logros, ella se dedica a la extracciÃ³n y comercializaciÃ³n de agregados (arena, piedras) para las construcciones, que extrae de un Ã¡rea del rÃ­o Santa en la zona de TacllÃ¡n en las afueras de la ciudad de Huaraz, que luego distribuye a las construcciones haciendo uso de su propio medio de transporte (volquete), aunque ella comparte este negocio con su esposo, comenta que le ha ido muy bien aunque ahora hay mucha competencia, porque los empresarios hacen uso de herramientas para la extracciÃ³n de mayor volumen de agregados que propician que los pequeÃ±os extractores solo puedan vender a estos empresarios o simplemente ya no realicen esta actividad por ello Eva tambiÃ©n desea tener otro negocio que le genere mayores ingresos.
Con este prÃ©stamo de s/.1700.00, que pagarÃ¡ en seis cuotas; harÃ¡ uso de este dinero para la reparaciÃ³n de su volquete y su respectivo mantenimiento.
Eva segura que necesita saber sobre otras alternativas de negocio.
texts.en:
Eva C. T. is part of the "NiÃ±o Manuelito IIâ€ Communal Bank in the province of Huaraz. Eva is 50 years old and has 4 children with her partner. She has not had any difficulties which she has been unable to overcome, and looking after her children and her business has been her greatest achievement. She extracts and sells construction materials (sand, stones), which she excavates from an area of the Santa River in the Tacllan zone on the outskirts of the city of Huaraz. Later she distributes the materials to construction companies using her own means of transportation (dump truck). She shares the business with her husband and it has gone well. Now however there is much more competition because of the use of larger-volume extraction machinery and many of the smaller businesses either sell to the larger ones or get out of the business. Eva would like to have another business which generates greater income. With this loan for S/. 1,700, which will be repaid in six installments, she will repair and maintain the dump truck. Eva would like to learn about other business alternatives.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Repair and maintenance of machinery.

loan.name: Consuelo Esperanza

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Consuelo Esperanza pertenece al Banco Comunal â€œEl Alto Mayo,â€ vive en la regiÃ³n San MartÃ­n, provincia y distrito de Rioja y se dedica a la venta de frutas de manera ambulatoria en una de las calles principales de la ciudad.
Con este crÃ©dito de S/. 2,000, el cual serÃ¡ pagado en 6 meses, comprarÃ¡ diversas frutas de la regiÃ³n como mango, mandarina, granadilla, uva, manzana, pera, entre otras frutas para asÃ­ tener abastecido su puesto, satisfacer la exigencia de sus clientes y asegurar sus ventas.
Consuelo Esperanza tiene 44 aÃ±os de edad, es madre de 04 hijos, por quienes tiene que trabajar a diario porque quiere darles un futuro mejor, es padre y madre para ellos. Su meta es poner otro negocio en su casa.
texts.en:
Consuelo Esperanza belongs to the "El Alto Mayo" Communal Bank, lives in the San Martin region in the province and district of Rioja, and sells fruit along the main streets of the city. With this loan for S/. 2,000, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy a variety of regional fruits such as mangos, mandarin oranges, granadillas, grapes, apples and pears, to have a supply and be able to meet the demands of her customers. Consuelo Esperanza is 44 years old and the mother of 4 children, for whom she works every day in order to give them a better future; she is both mother and father to them. Her goal is to start up another business from home.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy a variety of fruit such as mangos, mandarin oranges, granadillas, grapes, apples, pears, etc.

loan.name: Hilda Ceferina

texts.es:
La SeÃ±ora de nombre Hilda Ceferina U. F. tiene la edad de 42 aÃ±os, su estado civil es casada, DoÃ±a Hilda tiene 3 hijos de los cuales sus edades son las siguientes su hija mayor de 28 aÃ±os de edad trabaja por cuenta propia su otro hijo de 24 aÃ±os de edad que tambiÃ©n trabaja y su hijo menor de 22 aÃ±os de edad que trabaja por cuenta propia, su compaÃ±ero de vida labora como contratista en una universidad, sus propÃ³sitos son de prosperar en su negocio debido a la difÃ­cil situaciÃ³n econÃ³mica sus sueÃ±os son de mantener siempre surtido su establecimiento para ofrecer todo lo que sus clientes le pidan y sus deseos son de que la situaciÃ³n del paÃ­s mejore ya que debido a esto su negocio tiene inestabilidad para su futuro y que siempre se mantenga el apoyo de los demÃ¡s pises ya que esto es una gran ayuda para todos.
La actividad econÃ³mica es la venta de frutas y verduras la ubicaciÃ³n es en mercado FÃ©lix Pedro Carrillo, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 30 aÃ±os, sus inicios se dan por que su familia ya que su Mama falleciÃ³ y al paso del tiempo ella logra aprender esta profesiÃ³n y se logra quedar con su negocio e inicio con frutas lo que al principio no tenia mucha afluencia de clientes pero ella decide seguir adelante por sus hijos y no descontinuÃ³ el negocio y siempre pudo mantener por la elocuciÃ³n de vender sus productos y asÃ­ obtuvo la fama y la preferencia de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Hilda Ceferina U. F. is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her eldest daughter is 28 and is self-employed; her 24-year old son also works, and her youngest son is 22 and also self-employed. Her husband works as a contractor in a university. Her goal is to succeed in business despite the difficult economic situation. Her dream is to be able to offer her clients everything they want. Her wish is that the situation in the country improve as the current situation causes instability for her business and for her future. She also wishes that others continue their support as it is a great help for all. She has sold fruits and vegetables in the FÃ©lix Pedro Carrillo market for the past 30 years. She began this work because of her family when her mother passed away. With time she learned her business and decided to continue. She started with fruits which initially did not draw many customers but she kept with it for her children and did not give up on the business and has always been able to attract clients, gaining local fame and becoming a customer favourite.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Purchase car filters and motor oil.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Purchase automobiles for transport

loan.name: Candida

texts.es: La seÃ±ora CÃ¡ndida es socia del Banco Comunal â€œFlores la Pampillaâ€ del distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 52 aÃ±os de edad, es casada y madre de 4 hijos. CÃ¡ndida con su primer prÃ©stamo de S/. 300 comprÃ³ prendas de vestir pata venderlas. Nos cuenta que ha variado su negocio vendiendo diferentes tipos de prendas de vestir. Tiene casi 7 aÃ±os trabajando con el banco. Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 1000 que pagarÃ¡ en 4 cuotas comprarÃ¡ polleras, mantas para venderlas. CÃ¡ndida desea continuar trabajando para apoyar a su familia
texts.en:
CÃ¡ndida is a member of the Community Bank â€œFlores la Pampillaâ€ of the district, province and department of Puno. She is 52 years old. She is married and has 4 children. CÃ¡ndida used her first $100 loan to purchase clothes for sale. She comments that she diversified her business selling different types of clothes. She has been working with the bank for almost 7 years. With this loan of $350, which will be paid off in 4 months, she will purchase skirts and blankets for sale. CÃ¡ndida would like to continue working to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase clothes typical of her area (skirts and blankets).

loan.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
El SeÃ±or de nombre Juan Bautista M. L. tiene la edad de 54 aÃ±os, su estado civil es acompaÃ±ado, Don Juan tiene 3 hijos de los cuales sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor tiene 31 aÃ±os de edad y trabaja por cuenta propia, su otro hijo de 29 aÃ±os de edad y trabaja por cuenta propia y su hijo de 10 aÃ±os de edad que cursa el 4 grado de primaria, su compaÃ±era de vida labora como comerciante, sus propÃ³sitos son de crecer para su vida personal y en su negocio, sus deseos son cambiar de unidad para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y sus sueÃ±os son que Dios le sigua suministrando mas vida para seguir adelante y llevara cabo sus propÃ³sitos.
La actividad econÃ³mica a la que se dedica es taxista, la ubicaciÃ³n de su negocio es de forma ambulante por lo que tiene que recorrer las calles de LeÃ³n en busca de clientes, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 13 aÃ±os, sus inicios se dan por cuenta propia por lo que tenia que buscar el medio de ganar dinero y a la edad e 22 aÃ±os empieza manejando camiÃ³n y logro quedarse con este trabajo por un buen tiempo pero debido a unos problemas con su esposa lo llevan al fracaso y lo embargan y con la ayuda de unos amigos que le brindaron el apoyo necesario logra salir adelante y obtiene una unidad de taxi y es asÃ­ como consigue este trabajo, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que esta destinado para la reparaciÃ³n general de su vehiculo y para los diferentes compromisos contraÃ­dos ya que agradece tambiÃ©n a FundaciÃ³n y las diferentes organizaciones que hagan posible esta ayuda.
texts.en:
SeÃ±or Juan Bautista M. L. is 54 and lives with his significant other. Don Juan has 3 children: his oldest son is 31 and works independently, his middle son is 29 and works independently, and his 10-year-old son is in fourth grade. His life companion is a saleswoman. Juan's goals are to grow in his personal life and in his business. His wish is to offer better service to his customers. His dream is that God continues to provide him with more life to get ahead and to fulfill his goals. He is a taxi driver and travels the streets of LeÃ³n in search of customers. He has owned his business for 13 years. He started with his own funds in search of a way to earn money. At the age of 22, he started driving a truck and made a living with this work for quite awhile. But due to some problems with his wife, they split up and they seized the truck. With the help of some friends, they gave him the necessary support to keep going and to obtain a taxi, and he continues with this work. The financing will go towards general repairs of his vehicle and towards different contractual obligations. He thanks FundaciÃ³n LeÃ³n and the different organizations that make this help possible.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital

loan.name: Daysi Yesenia

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Daysi Yesenia, socia del BC â€œLos Jazminesâ€, vive en la RegiÃ³n San MartÃ­n, Provincia y distrito de Moyabamba. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general y bebidas gasificadas. Su negocio estÃ¡ ubicado en su casa, lugar donde acuden a diario sus clientes.
Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 3,000, el cual pagarÃ¡ en 06 meses, comprarÃ¡ productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azÃºcar en saco, detergentes de diferentes marcas, conservas, leche en cajas, artÃ­culos de higiene personal y demÃ¡s productos que requiere para surtir su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Daysi Yesenia tiene 29 aÃ±os de edad, vive con sus 02 hijos y su esposo quien se dedica a trabajos eventuales. EstÃ¡ agradecida por el apoyo brindado que le permite crecer en su negocio, Su meta es crecer en su negocio y comprar su casa.
texts.en:
Daysi Yesenia is a member of the Community Bank â€œLos Jazminesâ€ (The Jazmines). She lives in the San MartÃ­n region, province and district of Moyabamba. She own a grocery store where she sells food and sodas. She has the store at home, where she receives customers every day. She will use this $1000 loan, which will be paid back in 6 months, to purchase basic products such as rice, sugar, detergent, durable products, milk, hygiene items and others to diversify her business and to satisfy her customerâ€™s needs. Daysi Yesenia is 29 years old. She lives with her 2 children and her husband who has a temporary job. She is very grateful with all the support she has received that has helped improve her business and to also purchase a new house.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase basic products such as rice, sugar, detergent, durable products, milk, hygiene items and others

loan.name: Modesta Alicia

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Modesta Alicia S. tiene la edad de 76 aÃ±os, su estado civil es viuda, DoÃ±a Modesta tiene 1 hijo de la edad de 40 aÃ±os y trabaja por cuenta propia y ademÃ¡s le ayuda a su Mama en la venta, sus propÃ³sitos son de incrementar su negocio y mantenerlo de forma activa, los deseos son de mantener su negocio activo para generar mas ingresos a su familia, sus sueÃ±os son de seguir con vida para seguir adelante con su negocio y darle a su casa las respectivas mejoras para vivir como ella desea.
La actividad econÃ³mica es la elaboraciÃ³n de cosa de horno, prisionero y queques, la ubicaciÃ³n de su negocio es en la siguiente direcciÃ³n barrio el calvarito tenis 75 varas arriba, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 24 aÃ±os, ella inicia este negocio por cuenta propia ya que su Mama le habÃ­a enseÃ±ado a elaborar este tipo de oficio ya que ellas no vivÃ­an en leÃ³n ya que a los 15 aÃ±os de edad decide venirse a vivir en leÃ³n y para poder sobrevivir instala una panaderÃ­a y que este le pudiera generar ingresos para su familia y es asÃ­ como su negocio obtiene fama en su cuadra por las riquÃ­simas cosas de hornos que ella misma preparaba ya que ademÃ¡s de elaborar la cosa de horno tambiÃ©n podÃ­a realizar prisionero y quesadilla pero debido a la edad que tiene actualmente ya no pudo continuar realizando los prisioneros y las quesadillas por lo que decide solo vender las cosas de hornos, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que realizar las compras de materia prima ya que ella tiene que comprar al por mayor para que este le resulte mas favorable como seria la compra de: harina, azÃºcar, huevo y queso entre otros.
texts.en:
Modesta Alicia S. is 76 years old and a widow. Modesta has a 40 year old son who is self-employed and helps his mother with sales. Her goal is to increase her business and keep active in it; her wish is to keep the business going so that she can generate more income for her family and her dream is to better her life through her business and make the home improvements she wishes to make. She has been in business for 24 years, selling baked goods such as cakes in the neighbourhood known as " el calvarito tenis 75 varas arriba". She opened the business herself as her mother had taught her this trade before they lived in LeÃ³n. She moved to LeÃ³n at the age of 15 and opened a bakery in order to make ends meet. With this business, she was able to make enough money to support her family and as her business became well known in her neighbourhood because of the delicious baked goods she made herself. In addition to baking, she realized she could also prepare foods such as quesadillas. Due to her age, she finds herself unable to continue making quesadillas and so has decided to sell only baked goods. The loan is for working capital which she will use to buy raw materials in bulk to maximize her profits, products such as: flour, sugar, eggs and cheese among others.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Delina

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Delina pertenece al Banco Comunal â€œSanta Ana,â€ vive en la regiÃ³n San MartÃ­n, provincia y distrito D. Moyobamba, se dedica a la venta D. ropa, zapatos y cosmÃ©ticos, tambiÃ©n tiene un locutorio y su negocio estÃ¡ ubicado en su propia casa.
Con este crÃ©dito D. S/. 2,000, el cual serÃ¡ pagado en 6 meses, comprarÃ¡ ropa para damas caballeros y niÃ±os, asÃ­ como tambiÃ©n invertirÃ¡ en juguetes para aprovechar las fiestas D. navidad.
La seÃ±ora Delina tiene 64 aÃ±os D. edad, es madre D. 03 hijos quienes ya son independientes. Ahora vive con su esposo y quiere mÃ¡s adelante implementar mejor su tÃ³pico para dar servicio D. inyectables y curaciones porque tambiÃ©n estudiÃ³ primeros auxilios.
texts.en:
Delina belongs to the â€œSanta Anaâ€ Communal Bank. She lives in the San MartÃ­n region of the province and district of Moyobamba. She sells clothing, shoes and cosmetics, and she also has a public phone service and her business is located in her home. With this loan for S/. 2,000, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy clothing for women, men and children, and she will invest in toys to take advantage of the Christmas holidays. Delina is 64 years old and mother of 3 grown children. She now lives with her husband and in the future she wants to expand her business to proviD. services related to injectables and treatments because she also studied first aid.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy toys and clothing for women, men and children

loan.name: Elida Elizabeth

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Elida Elizabeth, socia del BC â€œLos Jazminesâ€, vive en la RegiÃ³n San MartÃ­n, Provincia y distrito de Moyabamba. Se dedica a la preparaciÃ³n y venta de panes, abarrotes en general y bebidas gasificadas. Su negocio estÃ¡ ubicado en su casa, lugar donde acuden a diario sus clientes.
Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 3,000, el cual serÃ¡ cancelado en 06 meses, comprarÃ¡ productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azÃºcar en saco, detergentes de diferentes marcas, conservas, leche en cajas, artÃ­culos de higiene personal y otros productos que requiere para surtir su negocio, tambiÃ©n invertirÃ¡ en la compra de insumos para la preparaciÃ³n de panteones y asÃ­ satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Elida Elizabeth tiene 40 aÃ±os de edad, vive con sus 02 hijos y su esposo quien se dedica tambiÃ©n al negocio. EstÃ¡ agradecida con el apoyo brindado porque le permite crecer en su negocio. Su meta es crecer en su negocio y comprar su propia casa.
texts.en:
Elida Elizabeth belongs to the â€œLos Jazminesâ€ Communal Bank. She lives in the San MartÃ­n region of the province and district of Moyobamba. She bakes and sells bread, groceries and soda pop. Her business is located in her home, where she serves her customers daily. With this loan for S/. 3,000, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy basic needs products such as rice, sacks of sugar, various brands of detergent, canned goods, cartons of milk, personal hygiene items and other products she needs to stock her business. She will also invest in the purchase of consumables needed to prepare mausoleums and in this way satisfy the needs of her customers. Elida Elizabeth is 40 years old and lives with her 2 children and her husband who also works in this business. She is grateful for the support provided to her because it allows her to grow her business. Her goal is to grown her business and buy her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: buy basic needs products such as rice, sacks of sugar, various brands of detergent, canned goods, cartons of milk, personal hygiene items and other items.

loan.name: Elsa

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Elsa pertenece al BC. â€œMujeres Emprendedorasâ€, vive en el departamento de San MartÃ­n, provincia y distrito de Moyobamba, se dedica a la venta de jugos y extractos de frutas y verduras y su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el Mercado Central de la ciudad, lugar donde espera a sus clientes. Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 3,000, el cual serÃ¡ pagado en 6 meses, comprarÃ¡ frutas frescas como plÃ¡tanos, piÃ±as, papayas, azÃºcar en saco, leche, cerveza negra, bebidas gasificadas y los insumos necesarios para la preparaciÃ³n de desayunos como sanguches, arroz chaufa Juanes entre otros. Quiere estar abastecida con lo necesario para atender bien a sus clientes. Elsa es madre de 03 hijas quienes viven con ella y con su esposo. Tiene 34 aÃ±os de edad y ya tiene 07 aÃ±os trabajando con el banco comunal. EstÃ¡ contenta con el apoyo brindado. Su meta es implementar mÃ¡s su negocio y ver profesionales a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Elsa belongs to the â€œMujeres Emprendedorasâ€ Communal Bank. She lives in San MartÃ­n state, in the province and district of Moyobamba. She sells juices, fruit extracts and vegetables, and her business is located in the cityâ€™s Central Market, where she serves her customers. With this loan for S/. 3,000, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy fresh fruits such as bananas, pineapples, papayas, sacks of sugar, milk, dark beer, soda pop and the consumables needed to make breakfast dishes such as sandwiches, Juanes fried rice and other dishes. She wants to be stocked with what she needs in order to take care of her customers well. Elsa lives with her husband and 3 children. She is 34 years old and has been working with the Communal Bank for 7 years. She is content with the support she receives. Her goal is to expand her business and for her children to grow up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy fresh fruits such as bananas, pineapples, papayas, sacks of sugar, milk, dark beer, soda pop and other consumables

loan.name: Elvina

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Elvina, socia del BC â€œLos Jazminesâ€, vive en la RegiÃ³n San MartÃ­n, Provincia y distrito de Moyobamba. Tiene 61 aÃ±os de edad, es madre de 05 hijos quienes ya son independientes. Se dedica a la venta de menestras sancochadas y mote en un puesto en el mercado central de la ciudad.
Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 3,000, el cual serÃ¡ pagado en 6 meses, comprarÃ¡ diferentes variedades de frijoles como huasca, canario, pinto entre otros, asÃ­ como maÃ­z para mote para sancocharlos y venderlos al menudeo, tambiÃ©n comprara leche en grandes cantidades para la preparaciÃ³n de quesos y satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes.
Elvina es una mujer muy trabajadora que quiere crecer en su negocio, desea mÃ¡s adelante surtir su negocio con mayor variedad de productos a ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elvina is a member of the Community Bank â€œLos Jazminesâ€ (The Jasmines). She lives in the San MartÃ­n region, province and district of Moyobamba. She is 61 years old and has 5 children who are already independent. She sells stews in a shop at the city central market. She will use this $1000 loan, which will be paid off in 6 months, to purchase different varieties of local beans, such as huasca, canario, pinto among others, as well as corn for stews and beans in packages for retail sale. She will also buy milk in bulk to make cheese and so satisfy her customerâ€™s remand. Elvina is a hard working woman that wants to see her business grow. She would like to be able to offer a larger variety of products to her customers in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: purchase different varieties of local beans, such as huasca, canario, pinto and others to make stews

loan.name: Exsilda

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Exsilda, socia del BC â€œSanta Anaâ€, vive en la RegiÃ³n San MartÃ­n Provincia y distrito Moyabamba, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general y frutas y su negocio estÃ¡ ubicado en su propia casa.
Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 1,000, el cual serÃ¡ cancelado en 06 meses, comprarÃ¡ productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azÃºcar en saco, detergentes de diferentes marcas, conservas, leche en cajas, artÃ­culos de higiene personal y otros productos que requiere para surtir su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Exilda tiene 62 aÃ±os de edad y es madre de 06 hijos. Ahora vive con su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura. EstÃ¡ agradecida con el apoyo brindado porque le permite crecer en su negocio. Su meta es arreglar su casa para darle seguridad a su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Exsilda is a member of the Santa Ana Communal Bank. She lives in the San MartÃ­n Region, in the Province and district of Moyabamba. She sells groceries in general and fruit. Her business is located in her own house.

With this loan for $350 (S/.1,000), she will buy basic necessities such as rice, sacks of sugar, different brands of detergents, canned goods, boxed milk, personal hygiene products and other products she needs to stock her business and satisfy her customers' needs. The loan will be repaid in 6 months.

Exsilda is 62 years old and the mother of 6 children. Now she lives with her husband who works in agriculture. She is thankful for the support given to her because it allows her to build up her business. Her goal is to fix her house to provide security for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase rice, sacks of sugar, detergents, canned goods, boxed milk, personal hygiene products and other products.

loan.name: Gabriela

texts.es: La seÃ±orita Gabriela es socia del Banco Comunal â€œVirgen de Cancharaniâ€ de la provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 41 aÃ±os de edad, es conviviente y madre de 5 hijos. Con su primer prÃ©stamo de S/. 500 comprÃ³ insumos para su negocio de comidas preparadas. Tiene casi 3 aÃ±os trabajando con el banco. Nos cuenta que su negocio ha crecido y ahora tambiÃ©n vende miel y almanaques. Con este prÃ©stamo de S/.1500 que pagarÃ¡ en 6 cuotas, lo usarÃ¡ para comercializar adornos de navidad. Gabriela desea continuar trabajando para construir su casa y tener su propio local para vender miel.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a member of the Community Bank â€œVirgen de Cancharaniâ€ of the province and department of Puno. She is 41 years old. She lives with her partner and has 5 children. She used her first $150 loan to purchase supplies of her business of home made food. She has been working with the bank for almost 3 years. She comments that her managed to diversify her business so she is currently also selling honey and calendars. She will use this new loan of $500, which will be paid off in 6 months, to purchase Christmas ornaments. Gabriela wishes to continue working to save money to build her home and buy her own store where she could sell honey.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase Christmas ornaments.

loan.name: Gema

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Gema, socia del BC â€œMUJERES AUDACESâ€, vive en la RegiÃ³n San MartÃ­n, Provincia y distrito de Moyobamba, se dedica a la venta de comida tipo menÃº y su negocio estÃ¡ ubicado en su propia casa, lugar donde diariamente acuden gran cantidad de clientes por la buena sazÃ³n y trato que les brinda.
Con este crÃ©dito de S/ 3,000, el cual serÃ¡ cancelado en 6 meses, comprarÃ¡ insumos como arroz, azÃºcar en saco, aceite en galÃ³n, fideos y otros que necesita para la preparaciÃ³n de sus platos a ofertar a sus clientes. TambiÃ©n quiere hacer algunos arreglos a su local como pintarlo y comprar mesas y sillas.
Gema es una mujer perseverante y muy amigable, tiene 39 aÃ±os de edad, vive con sus dos hijos, quienes la impulsan a esforzarse cada dÃ­a mÃ¡s y con su esposo. Desea para el futuro contar con un recreo turÃ­stico y vender comidas tÃ­picas de la regiÃ³n.
texts.en:
Gema, a member of the communal bank, Bold Women, lives in the San Martin region, in the province and district of Moyobamba. She sells meals out of her own home, a place where a large number of customers visit every day for the great seasoning (in the food) and the good service that Gema offers. With this loan of $1,000, which will be paid back in six months, she will buy ingredients like rice, sacks of sugar, gallons of cooking oil, pasta, and other things that she needs to prepare her meals to offer her customers. She also wants to do a few things around her house/business, such as paint it and buy tables and chairs. Gema is a persevering woman and very friendly. She is 39 years old and lives with her two children who inspire her to work hard every day. She also lives with her husband. In the future, she would like to have tourism-related business and sell food typical to the region.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, pasta, and other ingredients

loan.name: Grimanesa

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Grimanesa, socia del BC â€œSanta Anaâ€, vive en la RegiÃ³n San MartÃ­n, Provincia y distrito de Moyobamba, se dedica a la elaboraciÃ³n y venta de cecina y chorizo de cerdo, asÃ­ como a la venta de carne fresca de cerdo, ademÃ¡s tiene dos puestos de venta en el mercado central de la ciudad.
Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 2,000, el cual serÃ¡ cancelado en 06 meses, comprarÃ¡ cerdos de diferentes tamaÃ±os para luego sacrificarlos y preparar sus productos y asÃ­ poder atender los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, tambiÃ©n quiere arreglar su casa y el ambiente donde prepara la cecina y chorizo que vende.
La seÃ±ora Grimanesa tiene 62 aÃ±os de edad, es madre de 07 hijos quienes ya son independientes, ahora vive con una de ellas quien la apoya en sus actividades y sobre todo la acompaÃ±a. EstÃ¡ agradecida con el apoyo brindado porque le permite crecer en su negocio. Su meta es arreglar bien su casa para poner su negocio.
texts.en:
Grimanesa, member of the Saint Ann Communal Bank, lives in the San Martin Region, in the province and district of Moyobamba. She cooks and sells pork jerky and sausage, as well as sells fresh pork. She has two booths at the central market in the city. With this loan of $675, which will be paid back in six months, she will buy different size pigs to butcher and prepare for her products so that she will be able to meet her customers' orders. She also wants to fix up her house and the area where she prepares the jerky and sausage that she sells. Grimanesa is 62 years old. She is the mother of seven children who are already grown. She now lives with one of her daughters who helps her with her work and accompanies her with everything. She is grateful for the loan because it will allow her to grow her business. Her goal is to fix up her home for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase pigs and fix up the area where she prepares jerky and sausage

loan.name: Janeth Del Pilar

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Janeth del Pilar es socia del BC â€œEl Alto Mayoâ€, vive en la RegiÃ³n San MartÃ­n, Provincia y distrito de Rioja. Se dedica a la venta de artÃ­culos de mercerÃ­a como vinchas, esmaltes, correas, ganchos, pulseras, colets y juguetes. Su negocio estÃ¡ ubicado en su puesto en el mercado Grau de la ciudad.
Con este prÃ©stamo de S/.1,000, el cual serÃ¡ cancelado en 06 meses, comprarÃ¡ aretes, collares, esmaltes, vinchas y todo tipo de juguetes para surtir bien su negocio y contar con lo necesario para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Janeth del Pilar tiene 35 aÃ±os de edad, vive con su esposo y tiene dos hijos que son estudiantes y quienes la ayudan en atender el negocio. Su meta es surtir mÃ¡s su negocio para que no le falten ventas.
texts.en:
Janeth del Pilar is a member of the Alto Mayo Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin Region, in the province and district of Rioja. She sells merchandise such as hair clips, nail polish, belts, bracelets, and toys. Her business is located in a booth at the Grau Market in the city. With this loan of $350, which will be paid back in six months, she will buy earrings, necklaces, nail polish, hair clips, and all sorts of toys to stock up her business and have everything necessary for satisfying her customers' needs. Janeth del Pilar is 35 years old. She lives with her husband and has two children who are in school and who help her run the business. Her goal is to stock up her business so she doesn't lose sales.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase earrings, necklaces, nail polish, hair clips, and toys for her inventory

loan.name: Lita

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Lita, socia del BC â€œEl Alto Mayoâ€, vive en la RegiÃ³n San MartÃ­n, Provincia y distrito de Rioja. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general y su negocio estÃ¡ ubicado en un lugar alquilado en una calle cÃ©ntrica de la ciudad, lugar donde acuden a diario sus clientes.
Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 3,000, el cual serÃ¡ cancelado en 06 meses, comprarÃ¡ algunos productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azÃºcar en saco, aceite de diferentes tamaÃ±os y marcas, conservas y detergentes de diferentes marcas, leche evaporada, artÃ­culos de higiene personal y bebidas heladas con la finalidad de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Lita tiene 29 aÃ±os de edad, vive con su hijo y su esposo quien la apoya en su negocio. EstÃ¡ agradecida con el apoyo brindado porque le permite crecer en su negocio. Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Lita, a member of the Alto Mayo Communal Bank, lives in the San Martin Region, in the province and district of Rioja. She sells groceries, and her business is located in a rented space on the city's main street, where her customers visit daily. With this loan of $1,000, which will be paid back in six months, she will buy needed products such as rice, sacks of sugar, different size bottles and brands of cooking oil, canned food, different brands of detergent, evaporated milk, personal hygiene items, and cold drinks so that she can meet her customers' needs. Lita is 29 years old. She lives with her husband, who helps her with the business. She is grateful for this loan because it will allow her to grow her business. Her goal is to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase rice, sacks of sugar, different size bottles and brands of cooking oil, canned food, different brands of detergent, evaporated milk, personal hygiene items, and cold drinks

loan.name: Lilia Esther

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Lilia Esther, socia del Banco Comunal â€œEl Alto Mayoâ€, vive en el Departamento de San MartÃ­n, provincia y distrito de Rioja, se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niÃ±os, zapatillas y artÃ­culos de regalos. Su negocio estÃ¡ ubicado en su propia casa, lugar donde llegan sus clientes.
Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 1,700, el cual serÃ¡ cancelado en 06 meses, lo invertirÃ¡ en la compra de ropa para damas, caballeros y niÃ±os como polos, blusas, camisas, pantalones y juguetes para aprovechar las fiestas de navidad y poder satisfacer asÃ­ los requerimientos de sus clientes.
Tiene 41 aÃ±os de edad, es madre de 05 hijos, 2 de ellos todavÃ­a estÃ¡n a su cargo y quienes son su motor para seguir trabajando. Su meta es mantener bien surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Lilia Esther, member of the Alto Mayo Communal Bank, lives in the San Martin Region, in the province and district of Rioja. She sells clothing for women, men, and children, as well as sneakers and gift items. Her business is located in her own home, where her customers visit. With this loan of $575, which will be paid back in six months, she will purchase women's, men's, and children's clothes such as polo shirts, blouses, button-up shirts, and pants, as well as toys to have on hand for the Christmas holiday and to be able to satisfy her customers' demands. She is 41 years old and the mother of five, two of whom are still in her care and who are her inspiration to continue working. Her goal is to keep her business well stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase women's, men's, and children's clothes such as polo shirts, blouses, button-up shirts, pants, as well as toys

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: 2 scroll saws, 3 dozen, large padlocks, 1 dozen jeans, 1 dozen camouflage pants, and 1 dozen large files.

loan.name: Lorfia

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Lorfia, socia del BC â€œSanta Anaâ€, vive en la RegiÃ³n San MartÃ­n, Provincia y distrito Moyabamba. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y frutas y su negocio estÃ¡ ubicado en su propia casa.
Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 1,500, el cual serÃ¡ cancelado en 06 meses, comprarÃ¡ productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azÃºcar en saco, detergentes de diferentes marcas, conservas, leche en cajas, artÃ­culos de higiene personal, frutas y demÃ¡s productos que requiere para surtir su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Lorfia tiene 33 aÃ±os de edad, es madre de 02 hijas quienes son su razÃ³n de lucha diaria. EstÃ¡ agradecida con el apoyo brindado porque le permite crecer en su negocio. Su meta es crecer en su negocio llegar a surtirlo mÃ¡s y arreglar su casa para darle seguridad a su negocio.
texts.en:
Lorfia, member of the Saint Ann Communal Bank, lives in the San Martin Region, in the province and district of Moyabamba. She sells groceries and fruit out of her own home. With this loan of $500, which will be paid back in six months, she will buy needed items such as rice, sacks of sugar, different brands of detergent, canned food, cartons of milk, personal hygiene items, fruits, and other items needed to stock up her business and satisfy her customers' needs. Lorfia is 33 years old. She is the mother of two girls who are her reason for fighting each day. She is grateful for this loan because it will allow her to grow her business. Her goal is to grow her business, stock it better, and fix up her home to ensure her business' safety.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase rice, sacks of sugar, different brands of detergent, canned food, cartons of milk, personal hygiene items, fruits, and other items

loan.name: Jose Benito

texts.es:
El Nombre del SeÃ±or JosÃ© Benito B. M. tiene la edad de 51 aÃ±os, su estado civil es casado, Don JosÃ© tiene 1 hija su edad es de 29 aÃ±os y labora como docente de primaria, su compaÃ±era de vida labora en una tienda llamada Brodway, sus propÃ³sitos son invertir en materia prima para obtener mas productos ya que esto es muy importante para el ya que necesita realizar la elaboraciÃ³n de los productos que los clientes le pidan sus deseos son que su negocio sea el mejor de todos ya que hay mucha demanda a lo que el se dedica y sus sueÃ±os son de darle un mejor mantenimiento a su negocio ya que por lo que los clientes tendrÃ­an mayor interÃ©s en su tienda y asÃ­ podrÃ­a ofertar mejor su producto.
La actividad econÃ³mica a la que se dedica es joyero en lo que realiza el siguiente trabajo anillos, pulsera, cadenas, chapas, la ubicaciÃ³n de su negocio es de la iglesia el calvario 1 cuadra y media abajo, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 2 aÃ±os, sus inicios se dan a la edad de 16 aÃ±os y mas tarde decide ingresar a un taller y al paso del tiempo decide instalar su mismo negocio e inicia con las siguientes herramientas una mesa, sopletes y balanza por lo que se decide instalar este negocio y obtuvo clientes por algunos amigos que le conocÃ­an y estos hicieron que Don JosÃ© tuviera fama con su joyerÃ­a por lo que fue algo muy difÃ­cil de lograr pero con el apoyo de su familias y amistades lo hizo realidad, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita la compra del material como lo es el oro y tiene que buscar donde se lo oferten de forma mas factible para realizar cada uno de sus productos.
texts.en:
Mr. JosÃ© Benito B. M. is 51-years old and married. He has a 29-year old daughter who works as an elementary school teacher and his wife works at a store called Brodway. Mr. Jose intends to invest in raw materials for his products. This is very important, as there is already high demand for his work, and he hopes to improve his business and better maintain his store to attract more customers. He works as a jeweler, making rings, bracelets, necklaces, and earrings in a workshop one and a half blocks from the Calvario church. Mr. JosÃ© has owned his business for 2 years; he began working at age 16, later taking a job in a workshop and after some time deciding to set up his own business. Starting with only a table, blowtorch, scale, and a few customers acquired through friends, Mr. JosÃ© built the reputation of his jewelry shop with much difficulty but with the support of his family and friends. This loan will finance working capital to buy raw materials at the best prices, such as the gold used in his fine work.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital for raw materials

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Fidela

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Fidela es socia del Banco Comunal â€œVirgen D. Cancharaniâ€ D. la provincia D. Puno, en el departamento D. Puno. Tiene 56 aÃ±os D. edad, es casada y madre D. 3 hijos. Con su primer prÃ©stamo D. S/. 500 comprÃ³ triciclos. Tiene casi 3 aÃ±os trabajando con el banco. Nos cuenta que comprÃ³ triciclos y tiene locales alquilados en su casa. Con este prÃ©stamo D. S/.1500 que pagarÃ¡ en 6 cuotas comprarÃ¡ mÃ¡s triciclos y aumentar su negocio. Fidela desea continuar trabajando para tener una librerÃ­a.
texts.en:
Fidela is a member of the Virgin of Cancharani Communal Bank in the province and district of Puno. She is 56 years old, married, and the mother of three. With her first loan of ~$165, she bought tricycles. She has been working with this bank for almost three years. She tells us that she bought tricycles and rents rooms in her home. With this loan of $500, which will be paid back in six installments, she will buy more tricycles to expand her business. Fidela wants to continue working so she can have a bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase tricycles

loan.name: Susana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Susana iniciÃ³ su negocio porque con el ingreso que recibÃ­a como empleada no era posible cubrir sus gastos, junto a su hermano decidieron poner una pequeÃ±a tienda de abarrotes para cubrir las necesidades bÃ¡sicas de la familia. ComenzÃ³ el negocio en enero del 2003, empezaron en el local en el que estÃ¡n ahora, originalmente solo vendÃ­an refrescos y botanas, con un poco de abarrotes. Ahora la venta principal son los abarrotes, y desean agregar la venta de salchichonerÃ­a y lÃ¡cteos. Desde que inicio la tienda a la fecha ha ido incrementando los clientes gracias la buen servicio que brindan.
Ella necesita un prÃ©stamo por MXN $4,500 que pagara en 6 meses para adquirir mÃ¡s mercancÃ­a que le permitirÃ¡ abarcar otro tipo de mercado o clientes, lo cual incrementara los ingresos y mejorara la imagen de la tienda.
texts.en:
Susana started her business because the money she earned as a domestic worker wasnâ€™t enough to cover her living expenses. Together with her brother, she decided to set up a small grocery store to pay for their familyâ€™s basic needs. They began the store in January of 2003, in the same location it is in today, originally selling only soda, snacks, and a few grocery items. They now sell mostly groceries and wish to add a delicatessen and dairy products to the store. Since opening, the grocery store has attracted more and more customers thanks to good customer service. Susana needs a loan of 4,500 MXN, which she will pay back in 6 months, to buy merchandise that will meet all of her customersâ€™ needs. These additional sales will both increase income and improve the storeâ€™s reputation.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase inventory

loan.name: Felicitas

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal â€œDante Navaâ€ de la provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 42 aÃ±os de edad, es soltera y madre de 7 hijos. Con su primer prÃ©stamo de S/. 300 comprÃ³ productos naturistas. Tiene casi 2 aÃ±os trabajando con el banco. Nos cuenta que apoya a sus hijos. Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 600 que pagarÃ¡ en 4 cuotas comprarÃ¡ productos naturistas. Felicitas desea continuar trabajando para que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Community Bank â€œDante Navaâ€ in the province and department of Puno. She is 42 years old. She is single and has 7 children and she is her only financial support. She used her first $100 loan to purchase natural products. She has been working with the bank for almost 2 years. She will use this $200 loan, which will be paid off in 4 months to purchase more natural products. Felicitas wants to continue working to support her children so they can finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase natural products

loan.name: Flor De Vida Group

texts.es: La asociaciÃ³n denominada â€œFlor de vidaâ€ pertenece a la familia de Pro-Mujer hace mÃ¡s de cuatro aÃ±os , esta se encuentra en la zona de villa Adela, de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha cuenta con 15 miembros y han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crÃ©dito. Dentro el grupo la mayorÃ­a tienen hijos, casi todos en edad escolar, intentan ofrecer a sus hijos ademÃ¡s de una educaciÃ³n bÃ¡sica, estudios universitarios para asÃ­ asegurarles un mejor futuro. AdemÃ¡s de la artesanÃ­a en ropa, actividad a la que se dedica Zenobia, la mayor parte de la asociaciÃ³n de dedica al comercio en general, venden verduras en el mercado central de la Ceja de El Alto, otras de las socias son vivanderas. Todas necesitan mayor capital para ampliar sus negocios, considerando que esta Ã©poca del aÃ±o aumenta su clientela.
texts.en:
The â€œFlor de Vidaâ€ association (â€˜Flower of Lifeâ€™) has been a part of the Pro-Mujer family for more than 4 years.
