It is located in the Villa Adela region of El Alto city and currently has 15 members, who have proved themselves very organized in regards to their timely loan payments. The majority of the group members have children, most of school age, and they try to provide both basic and higher education opportunities to their children for a better future. Besides Zenobiaâ€™s work making handicrafts and artisanal clothing, the other members have different small businesses, selling vegetables in the Ceja de El Alto central market or working as street vendors. All need more capital to expand their businesses, especially since they have more customers during this time of year.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital to expand business

loan.name: Eusebia

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Eusebia es socia del Banco Comunal â€œMujeres de Villa del Lago IIâ€ del distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 25 aÃ±os de edad, es conviviente y madre de 3 hijos menores a los que apoya econÃ³micamente. Eusebia con el primer prÃ©stamo de S/ 300 comprÃ³ ropa y artÃ­culos de segundo uso para vender en su puesto de trabajo. Tiene casi 2 aÃ±os trabajando con el banco. Nos cuenta que con lo ganado con los prÃ©stamos ha ganado lo suficiente para comprarse un auto y una motocicleta. Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 3000, el cual pagarÃ¡ en 4 cuotas comprarÃ¡ mayor cantidad de mercaderÃ­a para venderla en su puesto. Eusebia desea continuar trabajando para comprarse otro auto.
texts.en:
Eusebia is a member of the Community Bank â€œMujeres de Villa del Lago IIâ€ (Women of the Lake Village II) of the district, province and department of Puno. She is 25 years old. She lives with her partner and 3 small dependent children. With her first loan of $100 she purchased clothes and second hand items to sell at her shop. She has been working with the community bank for 2 years and she tells us that with the money obtained and the loans she received the got enough money to purchase a car and a motorbike. With this $1,000 loan, that will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase more products to sell at her shop. Eusebia would like to keep working to be able to purchase a second car.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Compra de ropa de segunda mano.

loan.name: Pablo Emilio

texts.es:
El microempresario Pablo Emilio MalespÃ­n NarvÃ¡ez tiene 64 aÃ±os de edad, es casado con 3 hijos todos mayores de edad y viven en sus propios hogares. El seÃ±or MalespÃ­n se dedica a la actividad de fotÃ³grafo desde hace 35 aÃ±os aproximadamente y con esta actividad a podido darle el estudio a sus hijos asÃ­ como una profesiÃ³n.
Por el tiempo que tiene de dedicarse a la actividad de fotÃ³grafo el seÃ±or MalespÃ­n tiene una buena cantidad de clientes quienes lo buscan para actividades de cumpleaÃ±os, matrimonios, bautizos, promociones entre otras actividades que los blufileÃ±os tradicionalmente celebran y que buscan como guardar esos recuerdos.
Sin embargo por la inconsistencia de los precios del material se requiere comprar en cantidades para de esa manera poder mantener el precio estable por cada fotografÃ­a. Por tal razÃ³n requiere del financiamiento para la compra de los siguientes productos:
60 rollos de pelÃ­cula 135x36 a US$ 4 dÃ³lares cada rollo, 20 cajas de pelÃ­cula polaroid a US$ 25 dÃ³lares cada caja de pelÃ­cula, 5 unidades de tinta para impresora a US$ 30 dÃ³lares cada unidad y 5 docenas de baterÃ­as AA a US$ 22 dÃ³lares cada docena.
texts.en:
Micro-entrepreneur Pablo Emilio MalespÃ­n NarvÃ¡ez is 64 years old. He is married and has three children that are already independent. Mr. MalespÃ­n has been a photographer for over 35 years, activity that allowed his to pay for his childrenâ€™s education. After all this time devoted to this profession, Mr. MalespÃ­n has acquired a vast clientele that requests for his services for birthday parties, weddings, baptisms, promotions and other reunions traditionally celebrated by the blufileÃ±os (inhabitants of Bluefields, Nicaragua) so they can save their memories. However, due to the inconsistency in the price of the material he needs to purchase large amounts of products to maintain a stable price for his services. This is the reason why he is looking for financing to purchase the following items: 60 135x36 film rolls at a price of $ 4 each, 20 Polaroid film boxes at $ 25 each, 5 units of printer ink at $ 30 each and 5 dozens of AA batteries at $ 22 each dozen.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase 60 135x36 film rolls at a price of $ 4 each, 20 Polaroid film boxes at $ 25 each, 5 units of printer ink at $ 30 each and 5 dozens of AA batteries at $ 22 each dozen.

loan.name: San Gabriel Group

texts.es: En la zona de villa Tejada, se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociaciÃ³n â€œSan Gabriel â€œ.Un grupo muy simpÃ¡tico y particular formado por catorce mujeres que trabajan de manera organizada hace mucho tiempo. Las actividades que realiza la asociaciÃ³n, son de todo tipo, una de ellas tiene una pensiÃ³n, donde ofrece almuerzos todos los dÃ­as, tambiÃ©n se dedican a venta de relojes y otros accesorios; venta de mandiles, venta de ropa y otros. Ahora por las fiestas navideÃ±as, ademÃ¡s de la venta tradicional de sus productos, quieren vender adornos navideÃ±os, focos y otros productos que sean fÃ¡cilmente comercializados por estas fechas.Por lo que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de mercaderÃ­a, para poder ampliar sus negocios y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
There is a center in the villa Tejada area that goes by the same name. It pertains to the San Gabriel Association, a charming group comprised of fourteen women who have been working in an organized manner for a long time. The members of the association partake in different business activities. One of them has a guesthouse in which she offers lunch everyday, other members sell watches and other accessories, while still other members sell aprons, clothing and other goods. Because of the holiday season, they want to sell Christmas ornaments, lights, and other products that are easily sold this season. They need more capital to purchase merchandise so that they can expand their businesses and increase their profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase merchandise

loan.name: Agustina

texts.es: Agustina tiene 52 aÃ±os, es madre soltera, vive con sus dos hijas menores de edad. Se dedica a su tiendita de abarrotes que abriÃ³ hace 8 aÃ±os a base de mucho esfuerzo, ya que en su hogar tuvo que ser padre y madre y afrontar sola las dificultades de la vida, pero gracias a su gran capacidad para los negocios y las ventas tuvo grandes oportunidades que supo aprovechar y asÃ­ obtuvo la tiendita que tanto querÃ­a a la cual se dedica Ã­ntegramente, sin descuidarla, estando siempre abierta frente a las demandas de sus vecinos, las cuales hay que aprovechar y brindar una atenciÃ³n de calidad es su prioridad, logrando rentabilidad en su negocio a pesar de los costosos precios de las mercaderÃ­as. Agustina estÃ¡ en su tercer prÃ©stamo con MFP, y siempre ha sido una clienta muy responsable y entusiasta dentro de su grupo, ya que motivaba a las socias frente a situaciones difÃ­ciles. Con el dinero que solicita implementarÃ¡ la mercaderÃ­a para su tienda y asÃ­ convertirla en una de las mÃ¡s competitivas dentro de su localidad.
texts.en:
Agustina is a 52-year-old single mother who lives with her two underage daughters. Eight years ago, after much effort, she opened up her own general store because she had to be both the mother and father of the household, facing the difficulties of life on her own. However, thanks to her great business abilities, she was able to take advantage of the opportunities that came her way. Thus, she obtained the general store she had always wanted. She is fully dedicated to her shop; she never neglects it and keeps it open to meet her neighborsâ€™ demands. Customer service is her priority, and she manages to make hers a lucrative business despite the high prices. This is Agustinaâ€™s third loan with MFP, and she has always been a very responsible and enthusiastic client in her group since she motivates the other members to face adversity. With the money that she is requesting, she will obtain more goods for her store, thus making it one of the most competitive shops in her locality.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase goods for general store

loan.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 29 aÃ±os, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Hace 4 aÃ±os se dedica a la venta de quesos que compra en comunidades alejadas para luego traerlos a las ciudades y venderlos en los mercados, dentro de su labor, lo que mÃ¡s le agrada realizar es la comercializaciÃ³n, y lo tedioso es ir a los pueblos lejanos. Pero de todas maneras esta actividad es muy rentable, ya que los pobladores solicitan todos los dÃ­as quesos frescos y muy ricos, tÃ­picos de zonas rurales donde los preparan. Carmen es nueva en MFP, pero se muestra muy comprometida y responsable ante los demÃ¡s. InvertirÃ¡ lo que solicita en la compra de mayores cantidades de queso, para venderlos, ya no tan solo en su ciudad, sino tambiÃ©n en las ciudades aledaÃ±as.
texts.en:
Carmen is 29 and lives with her husband and 3 children. She has sold cheese that she buys in remote communities and takes to the cities to sell in the markets for 4 years. What she likes most about her job is selling. The tedious part is going to far away towns. But this business is very profitable because the people who live in the city request fresh and very delicious cheeses from her every day that are traditional to the areas where they are prepared. Carmen is new to Microfinanzas Prisma, but she has shown that she is committed and responsible above all. She will invest her loan in the purchase of larger quantities of cheese to sell, not only in her city, but also in nearby cities.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of a larger quantity of cheese to sell

loan.name: Manuela

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Manuela, socia del B. C â€œEl Alto Mayoâ€, vive en la RegiÃ³n San MartÃ­n, Provincia y distrito de Rioja, se dedica a la venta de Raspadillas aprovechando el clima caluroso de la zona y vende de manera ambulatoria en una de las esquinas de la plaza de la ciudad.
Con este prÃ©stamo S/. 800, el cual serÃ¡ cancelado en 06 meses, comprarÃ¡ insumos para la preparaciÃ³n de raspadillas como esencias, vasitos, sorbetes y sobretodo invertirÃ¡ en la compra de otra mÃ¡quina y su respectivo carrito para raspadillas, porque ve que su negocio tiene acogida y no tienen mucha competencia.
Manuela tiene 35 aÃ±os de edad, vive con sus 4 hijos y con su esposo. Sus hijos la apoyan en Ã©poca de vacaciones. Es una persona amable y trabajadora. Su meta es tener crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Manuela, a member of the community bank â€œEl Alto Mayoâ€, lives in the region of San MartÃ­n in the province and district of Rioja. She is a street vendor and sells snow cones on one of the corners of the town square, taking advantage of the warm climate of her region. With this S/. 800 loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy in bulk the products she requires to make the snow cones: flavoured syrups, cups and straws. Above all, she will invest in another machine and cart for snow cones as she sees that her business is well received and that there is not much competition. Manuela is 35 years old and lives with her 4 children and her husband. Her children help her during school holidays. She is friendly and hard-working. Her goal is to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy in bulk for the preparation of her snow cones (crushed ice with syrup).

loan.name: Marilu

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Marilu es socia del Banco Comunal â€œEl Alto Mayoâ€, vive en la RegiÃ³n San MartÃ­n y Provincia y distrito de Rioja, se dedica a la preparaciÃ³n y venta de comida tipo menÃº vende de manera diaria, da pensiÃ³n a quienes lo requieren y desarrolla su negocio en su propia casa.
Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 1,000, el cual serÃ¡ cancelado en 6 meses, comprarÃ¡ los insumos como arroz, azÃºcar en saco, aceite en galÃ³n, fideos, verduras y carnes y otros insumos que necesita para la preparaciÃ³n de sus platos a ofertar a sus clientes. La seÃ±ora Marilu tiene 41 aÃ±os de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 03 hijos, dos de ellos aÃºn estudian y dependen de ella, ademÃ¡s son la razÃ³n para luchar cada dÃ­a. MÃ¡s adelante quiere arreglar su casa y ampliar mÃ¡s su negocio.
texts.en:
Marilu belongs to the "El Alto Mayo" Communal Bank and lives in the San MartÃ­n Region in the Rioja district and province. She earns a living by preparing and selling menu-of-the-day type food. She offers food and accomodation to those needing it and carries out her business in her own house. With this loan of US$350 (S/. 1,000) which will be paid over six months, she will buy ingredients such as rice and sugar by the sack, oil by the gallon, pasta, vegetables, meat and other goods that she needs for the preparation of the meals to offer to her clients. Marilu is 41 years old and lives with her husband and their 3 children. Two of the children are still studying and dependent on her, and moreover are the reason to keep pushing onwards every day. In the future she wants to fix up her house and expand her business further.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: She will buy rice, sugar by the sack, oil by the gallon, pasta, vegetables, meats and other goods

loan.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana tiene 30 aÃ±os, es madre soltera y tiene una hija de 4 aÃ±os con quien vive. Ella es secretaria, pero para cubrir los gastos de su hija tuvo que dedicarse adicionalmente a la crianza de animales menores, sobre todo de cuyes, los cuales cuida de manera especial, ya que hay que separarlos y seleccionarlos adecuadamente para que tengan un adecuado crecimiento. Diana estÃ¡ pensando en instalar mÃ³dulos de crianza para mejorar la crianza de sus animales, lo difÃ­cil es matarlos para luego venderlos en los mercados de su ciudad. Este es su 5to prÃ©stamo con MFP, y hasta la fecha ha sido cumplida con sus pagos respectivos. Con el dinero que solicita podrÃ¡ instalar los mÃ³dulos de crianza para sus cuyes que tanto desea.
texts.en:
Diana is 30 years old, is a single mother, and has a four-year-old daughter, who lives with her. She is a secretary but in order to cover her daughterâ€™s expenses, she had to also raise young animals, especially guinea pigs. She cares for these animals in a special way, since she has to separate them and select them adequately so that they will grow well. Diana is thinking of installing breeding modules to improve the breeding of her animals. It is difficult for her to kill them so that she can sell them later in the markets in the city. This is her fifth loan with MFP and so far has been compliant with her payments. With the money that she is requesting, she will be able to install the breeding modules for her in-demand guinea pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To improve the pens where she takes care of her guinea pigs

loan.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Margarita, socia del BC â€œMUJERES AUDACESâ€, vive en la RegiÃ³n San MartÃ­n, Provincia y distrito de Moyobamba, se dedica a la venta de comida tipo menÃº y desarrolla su negocio en un local alquilado en una de las calles cÃ©ntricas de la ciudad a donde acuden gran cantidad de clientes por la buena sazÃ³n y trato que les brinda.
Con este crÃ©dito de S/. 2,000, el cual serÃ¡ cancelado en 6 meses, comprarÃ¡ los insumos como arroz, azÃºcar en saco, aceite en galÃ³n, fideos, verduras, carnes y otros insumos que necesita para la preparaciÃ³n de sus platos a ofertar a sus clientes. La seÃ±ora Margarita tiene 47 aÃ±os de edad, vive con su esposo y con sus dos hijos que cursan estudios superiores y quienes la impulsan a esforzarse cada dÃ­a mÃ¡s. Desea para el futuro contar con su restaurante bien arreglado porque hace poco que estÃ¡ en ese lugar.
texts.en:
Margarita, a member of the â€œBold Womenâ€ communal bank, lives in the San MartÃ­n region, in the province and district of Moyobamba. She works selling traditional food as part of a fixed menu, and her business is run out of a rented space on one of the main streets in the city where many customers come for the delicious flavor and the way she treats them. With this loan of 2,000 soles ($675), which she will repay over 6 months, she will buy ingredients such as rice, sacks of sugar, gallons of oil, noodles, vegetables, meat, and other ingredients that she needs to prepare her dishes to sell to her customers. Margarita is 47 years old and lives with her husband and two children who are in secondary school. Her children inspire her to keep working every day. In the future she would like to have a nicer restaurant because she has not been in her current space for very long.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy rice, sacks of sugar, gallons of oil, noodles, vegetables, meats, and other ingredients

loan.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith tiene 23 aÃ±os y vive con sus padres. Ella tiene un gran don para embellecer a las personas, y utiliza esta habilidad para ganarse la vida en su salÃ³n de belleza, el que instalÃ³ hace 2 aÃ±os, siendo dentro de todo, los cortes de cabello, lo que le mÃ¡s le agrada realizar, ya que son Ã©stos los que logran dar a sus clientes una nueva imagen que resalte su atractivo. Edith tiene en su salÃ³n de belleza una alternativa para salir de la pobreza en la que vive, y gracias a que no hay muchos salones de belleza puede atender a gran cantidad de personas. Este es su 7mo prÃ©stamo con MFP, y hasta hoy no ha tenido ningÃºn problema en pagar sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita implementarÃ¡ su salÃ³n de belleza con diversos instrumentos y productos indispensables para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Edith is 23 years old and lives with her parents. She has a great gift of making people beautiful. She uses this ability to earn a living in her beauty salon, which she began 2 years ago. She lives giving haircuts since with these, she succeeds in giving her clients a new image that makes them more attractive. Edith has, in her beauty salon, an alternative to the poverty in which she lives. Because there arenâ€™t many beauty salons, she can take care of more people. This is her seventh loan with MFP, and until today she hasnâ€™t had any problem in repaying punctually. With the money that she is requesting, she will stock her beauty salon with many instruments and indispensible products to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To stock her beauty salon with necessary products

loan.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora MarÃ­a Consuelo, socia del BC â€œSanta Anaâ€, vive en la RegiÃ³n San MartÃ­n, Provincia y distrito Moyabamba. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general y frutas, su negocio esta ubicado en su propia casa.
Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 800, el cual serÃ¡ cancelado en 06 meses, comprarÃ¡ productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azÃºcar en saco, detergentes de diferentes marcas, conservas, leche en cajas, artÃ­culos de higiene personal y otros productos que requiere para surtir su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
La seÃ±ora MarÃ­a Consuelo tiene 35 aÃ±os de edad, es madre de 4 hijos quienes aÃºn dependen de ella. EstÃ¡ agradecida con el apoyo brindado porque le permite crecer en su negocio. Su meta es surtir mÃ¡s su negocio y arreglar su casa para darle seguridad a su negocio.
texts.en:
MarÃ­a Consuelo, a member of the Santa Ana Communal Bank, lives in the San MartÃ­n region, in the province and district of Moyabamba. She works selling groceries in general as well as fruit, and her business is located in her home. With this loan of 800 soles ($275), which she will repay over 6 months, she will buy essential products such as rice, sacks of sugar, detergents of various brands, preserves, boxes of milk, personal hygiene products, and other products that she needs to stock her business and satisfy the needs of her customers. MarÃ­a Consuelo is 35 years old and is the mother of four children who are dependent on her. She is grateful to have this assistance because it will allow her to grow her business. Her goal is to better stock her business and fix her home to give her business better security.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy rice, sacks of sugar, detergent, boxes of milk, personal hygiene products, and other items

loan.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 34 aÃ±os, es madre soltera y vive con sus tres hijos. Se dedica a la venta de comida en la calle desde hace 3 aÃ±os y su buena sazÃ³n en la preparaciÃ³n de alimentos hace que las personas regresen a consumir sus deliciosos platos, los cuales ofrece a precios mÃ³dicos. AdemÃ¡s, Flor trata de brindar a sus clientes la mejor atenciÃ³n posible para asegurar su fidelidad e incrementar sus comensales, y por ende sus ingresos. Lo pesado de su labor es tener que levantarse muy de maÃ±ana y preparar todo lo necesario para luego salir a vender. Es una clienta nueva en MFP, y desea seguir trabajando con este grupo de socias a las cuales esta integrÃ¡ndose. Flor invertirÃ¡ en la compra de vitrinas, que faciliten su trabajo y capten la atenciÃ³n de las personas para poder consumir sus platillos.
texts.en:
Flor is 34 years old, is a single mother, and lives with her three children. She has sold food in the street for 3 years, and her good seasoning in the preparation of the food makes people return to eat her delicious plates, which she offers at modest prices. Also, Flor tries to give her clients the best attention possible to assure their loyalty and increase her customers. In this way, she will increase her income. The difficult thing is having to wake up very early in the morning and prepare everything that she needs to sell her food. She is a new client of MFP and wants to continue working with this group, which she is becoming integrated into. Flor will invest by buying a showcase, which will make her work easier and will capture peopleâ€™s attention so that they will eat her food.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy a showcase for her business

loan.name: Maria Lusmila

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora MarÃ­a Lusmila, es socia del BC â€œLos Jazminesâ€, vive en la RegiÃ³n San MartÃ­n, provincia y distrito D. Moyabamba. Se dedica a la venta D. mercerÃ­a como ungÃ¼entos, desodorantes, betÃºn, tijeras y artÃ­culos D. limpieza. Desarrolla su negocio en las afueras del mercado central D. la ciudad, tambiÃ©n sale a recorrer los alrededores y dentro del mercado.
Con este prÃ©stamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual serÃ¡ cancelado en 06 meses, comprarÃ¡ escobillas, crema dental, peines, afeitadores, ungÃ¼entos, desodorantes D. diferentes marcas y presentaciones, pilas D. diferentes tamaÃ±os y demÃ¡s productos que tiene mayor salida. Quiere surtir bien su negocio y contar con lo necesario para satisfacer las necesidades D. sus clientes.
MarÃ­a Lusmila tiene 69 aÃ±os D. edad, es madre D. 04 hijos quienes ya son independientes, ahora ella vive con su esposo y con sus dos nietas que son estudiantes y a quienes estÃ¡ criando, ademÃ¡s la ayudan atender el negocio. Su meta es poner su negocio en su casa.
texts.en:
MarÃ­a Lusmila is a member of Los Jazmines community bank. She lives in RegiÃ³n San MartÃ­n in Moyabama district and province. MarÃ­a sells merchandise such as ointment, deodorant, shoe polish, scissors and cleaning products. Her business has grown on the outskirts of the cityâ€™s central market. She travels to both neighboring areas and within the market itself. With this loan of $350 (1000 Peruvian nuevos soles), which will be repaid in six month, MarÃ­a will buy brushes, toothpaste, combs, shaving cream, various brands and types of deodorant, batteries in a variety of sizes and other popular products. She wants to increase her inventory in order to have on hand the necessities to meet the customer demand. Maria Lusmila is 69 years old and the mother of four grown children. At present she lives with her husband and the two grandchildren that they are raising. The grandchildren are still in school, but they also help her tend to the business. Mariaâ€™s goal is to run the business out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of brushes, toothpaste, combs, shaving cream, deodorant, batteries and other products

loan.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
La SeÃ±ora Maria Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal â€œMujeres Emprendedorasâ€, vive en la regiÃ³n San MartÃ­n, provincia y distrito de Moyobamba, se dedica a la venta de productos de pan llevar como plÃ¡tanos, menestras, yuca verduras, Mani y su negocio estÃ¡ ubicado en el mercado central de la ciudad, lugar donde acuden diariamente a comprar sus clientes que son los visitantes del mercado.
Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 2,000, el cual serÃ¡ cancelado en 6 meses, comprarÃ¡ plÃ¡tanos en racimos, yuca en sacos, frijoles en sacos de diferentes variedades asÃ­ como manÃ­ en sacos y otros productos que necesita para surtir su negocio y atender las exigencias de sus clientes.
MarÃ­a Victoria tiene 66 aÃ±os, es madre de 12 hijos de los cuales solo 4 viven, ya todos son independientes. Ahora vive con su esposo y con uno de sus hijos quien la apoya en su negocio y acompaÃ±a a sus padres. EstÃ¡ agradecida por el apoyo brindado por Manuela Ramos que le permite crecer, tanto a ella como tambiÃ©n a las demÃ¡s mujeres trabajadoras, en sus respectivos negocios.
texts.en:
Maria Victoria is a member of the community bank â€œMujeres Emprendedorasâ€ (â€˜Women Entrepreneursâ€™) and lives in the San MartÃ­n region of the Moyobamba district and province. She sells bread as well as bananas, vegetable stew, yucca, and peanuts at the cityâ€™s central market everyday. With this loan of 2,000 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy bananas in bulk, sacks of yucca, peanuts and different types of beans, and other products to supply her business and meet her customersâ€™ needs. Maria Victoria is 66-years old, mother of 12 children, only 4 of which are living and now independent. She currently lives with her husband and a son, who helps his parents and supports Maria Victoria in her work. She is grateful for the support provided by the Manuela Ramos microfinance program, CrediMUJER, which has made it possible for her, as well as so many other working women, to improve business.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of bananas, yucca, beans, peanuts, and other products in bulk

loan.name: Sartawi Group

texts.es: La asociaciÃ³n denominada â€œSartawiâ€ pertenece a la familia de Pro-Mujer hace tres aÃ±os aproximadamente. La mencionada asociaciÃ³n pertenece al centro focal de Villa ExaltaciÃ³n, ubicada en la zona del mismo nombre, de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha cuenta con catorce miembros que han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crÃ©dito y actividades internas. Existen diferentes negocios dentro la asociaciÃ³n podemos decir que son comerciantes en su mayorÃ­a; venden comida, dulces, fruta, cosmÃ©ticos, abarrotes, ropa usada, ropa nueva y otros. Comercializan sus productos en puestos fijos y tambiÃ©n de manera ambulante. La asociaciÃ³n Sartawi precisa de crÃ©ditos para comprar mayor cantidad de productos ya que por las fiestas de fin de aÃ±o, es seguro que sus ventas aumentaran y tambiÃ©n sus ganancias.
texts.en:
The association called â€œSartawiâ€ has belonged to the Pro-Mujer family for about three years. That association belongs to the center of Villa ExaltaciÃ³n, located in the zone of the same name, in the city of El Alto. Sartawi has fourteen members, who have shown that they are an organized group through their credit payments and internal activities. The members of the association pursue different businesses, but they are mostly merchants. They sell food, sweets, fruit, cosmetics, groceries, used clothes, and new clothes, among other goods. They market their products in fixed stands and also through traveling sales. The association Sartawi needs loans to buy more products for parties at the end of the year. Their sales will certainly increase, as will their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: They need loans to buy more products

loan.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Mrs. Julieta S. is 36 years old and lives at Sunset Boulevard, Dawo, Dapitan City. She has been a single mother of five children since her husband left them in 2000. Three of her children are in school. Now, she finds herself again in a relationship and has been living with him for several years already. Their source of income is a sari-sari store. She has difficulty in raising her children considering the situation, but life must go on for Julieta. Her live-in partner also helps them financially through day labor.
Due to lack of capital, Julieta joined Paglaum MPC last April. She was inclined to be a member due to its benefits given to members. She has made good use of several loans and, at present, she is applying for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods and soft drinks for her sari-sari store.
Julieta plans to make her sari-sari store into a mini-grocery someday, with a variety of goods for sale. She really strives hard to be able to send all of her children to school and to become fulfilled seeing her children finish their studies and have comfortable careers.

loan.use: to buy canned goods & soft drinks for her sari-sari store

loan.name: Sang

texts.en:
Mr. Sang S. is 22 years old and is married to Yan Srey Mom, 26. They are residents of Kandal Province. The young couple makes a living working for a garment factory as garment workers. They currently get a salary of US$ 180 per month. They both are responsible for one young child who is attending school.

The young couple's living conditions are not so good because their house is so old and small for them. Therefore, Sang S. and Yan Srey Mom decided to request a loan to use as capital plus their savings to purchase house equipment to repair and decorate their house. The loan will help their family's life be a little more comfortable.

loan.use: To purchase house equipment

loan.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
This simple housekeeper from Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental is coping with life's challenges. At the age of 42, Clemencia S. admits that there is no room for her to rest comfortably and wait for unknown blessings. She and her husband Ernesto did not finish any college degree. Given that fact, the couple tried the fishing business. The first few months went by with unpredictable returns. But the couple did not give up. They continued and learned the business. At present, they own 2 units of pumpboats that give a weekly net income of PHP 800 to PHP 1,000. Not bad when they were just starting out.

To yield more income, they want to purchase additional fish nets which they can have for rent. They applied for a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. Clemencia has safeguarded her credit records with the cooperative. Being a member for almost 4 years, she shared that though the loan windows are readily available, the savings products of Paglaum are what she likes most.

Mr. and Mrs. S. have saved for the education of their children. They want their children to be able to fulfill their dreams by pursuing their studies. They conclude that Paglaum MPC has been a consistent partner in extending financial assistance for their livelihood. So if financial difficulties arise, they can always run to Paglaum.

loan.use: to purchase additional fish nets

loan.name: Tit

texts.en:
Tit B., 48, is a food seller and lives in Kandal Province. He runs a little restaurant where he sells rice and more types of food like Traditional Khmer Food, which he sells to students and passers-by. He is married to Kheav Chantha who is 48 years old and works with him in his business. She is a good mother to their three children; two of them are single and one is married.

To help a little more with the family's needs, all of her children are employed and working for companies; they currently earn a salary of US$ 190 per month. The couple is facing a difficulty with their living conditions: their old house is broken down and too small for them. B. and his wife would like to request a loan to buy house equipment to repair their old house. (In the photograph, the couple appears in front of their food shop.)

loan.use: To buy house equipment to repair their old house

loan.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie R., 42, has 4 children and presently resides in Bato, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She has been a member of Pag-asa Center since June 2006. She has received several types of loan and recently she applied for PHP 15,000 to support her husband's farming activities. The family is cultivating a small parcel of land, and in order to have a good yield, fertilizer and insecticides are what they need.

Elsie's husband never gets tired of finding means to make a living. He also does fishing using their own "banca" (small boat). Their daily consumption is no longer a worry for the family. The couple also have a piggery where they focus on breeding pigs.

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative gave a glimpse of hope for their different business ventures since they want to expand their piggery and develop their rice field. Slowly they have been able to save for their children's studies, and they hope to live a comfortable life.

loan.use: purchase of fertilizer and insecticides

loan.name: Sophan

texts.en: Mr. Sophan L. is a villager in Samraong Village in Takeo Province. He is a pig breeder. Mr. Sophan L. is 55 years old and the father of three children. One of his children is employed in a garment factory while another one helps him in the business and the youngest one is attending the local school. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand, so he decided to ask for a loan of $375 to buy six more piglets. He would use the rest of the loan to buy more pig food to feed his pigs. His wife, Mrs. Keo Im, is a farmer who cultivates rice for a living. She appears on the left in the photo.

loan.use: To buy six piglets and to buy more pig food to feed his pigs.

loan.name: Naem

texts.en: Mr. Naem S. is a farmer who lives in Samraong Village in Takeo Province. Mr. Naem S. is 42 years old and the father of five children. One of the children is working in a garment factory while three are attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. He now faces a problem on his plantation because he does not have enough rice seeds to cultivate. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan of $500 to buy more rice seeds for cultivation. He would use the rest of the loan to hire laborers to work in the field. His wife, Mrs. Prach Thoeurn, helps him on the plantation. She is shown on the left in the photo.

loan.use: To buy more rice seeds for cultivation and to hire laborers to work in the field.

loan.name: Morn

texts.en: Mrs. Morn K. lives in Press Leu village in Takeo province. She is a 46-year-old widow with three children. One of the children is working in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. She is a farmer who has a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Although she and her children work hard, they still do not earn an income which can provide decent living conditions for the family. In order to improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. Morn K. has decided to ask for a loan of $450 to buy a cow to start a breeding cow business.

loan.use: To buy a cow to start breeding cow business.

loan.name: Pich

texts.en: Mrs. Pich N. is a villager in Press Leu village in Takeo Province. She is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and resell later at a better price. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to keep in stock. Her husband, Mr. Vul Vann, helps her in the current business. Mrs. Pich N. is 38 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of photo.

loan.use: To buy more rice to keep in stock

loan.name: Mrs. Hun Luon Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan goes to a group of eight people in Tong Rong village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Hun L. is the village bank president, selected by the members. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy different kinds of vegetables to resell. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan. She is a 37-year-old widow with two children who both attend the local school.

loan.use: To buy different kinds of vegetables to resell

loan.name: Mrs. Sahun Chhor Village Bank Group

texts.en: This loan goes to nine people in Phum Ty village, in Kampong Chhnang province, who formed a village bank loan group. They will each use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sahun C. is the village bank president, selected by the members. She and her husband, Mr. C. Sahun, are construction workers. Since their work place is far from home, they spend a lot of money on transportation. In order to reduce these expenses, Mrs. Sahun C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a bike to go to work. She will use the rest of the loan to buy chickens for breeding. Mrs. Sahun C. is 28 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom attends the local school while the younger one, at age five, is too young to work or study.

loan.use: To buy a bike to get to work

loan.name: Mr. Sarun Um Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This is a village bank loan to a group that consists of ten people in PhU. Ty village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mr. Sarun U. is the village bank president. He is a vice village chief who makes a little salary. His wife, Mrs. Khun Chanda, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Aside from the plantation, she is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and then resell later at a better price. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so Mr. Sarun U. decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to keep in stock. Mr. Sarun U. is 46 years old and the father of three children who all attend the local school.
Two members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. The end-of-term members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMKâ€™s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodiaâ€™s poor. These allow people to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMKâ€™s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: To buy more rice to keep in stock

loan.name: Cristine

texts.en: Cristine P. is 25 years old and married to Eddie. The young couple were blessed with three children and live in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Cristine became a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative way back in April 2003. With the wide array of programs and services of the Cooperative, she decided to join Paglaum MPC. Two of their children are beneficiaries of Paglaum Community Development Foundation Incorporated (PCDFI), the mother organization, and at the same time, the social development partner of the Cooperative. With the education sponsorship of PCDFI to their children, the couple is aiming to survive on their daily expenses. Gifted with skills in carpentry, they tried their hand at the construction of fishing boats. In need of capital, they are reaching out to Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for a PHP 15,000 loan. Cristine and Eddie would like to own a motorized pumpboat in the future and hope to see their children fulfill their lifelong careers.

loan.use: Construction of fishing boats

loan.name: Mrs. Thy Klang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The group receiving this village bank loan consists of twenty people I. Thnal village I. Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Thy K. is a village bank president. She is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep I. stock and then resell later at a better price. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to keep I. stock. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan. Her husband, Mr. Uk Kry, is a construction worker who can make a little income to support the family. Mrs. Thy K. is 48 years old and the mother of four children who all attend the local school.
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Eight members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMKâ€™s maI. product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodiaâ€™s poor. These allow people to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMKâ€™s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: To buy more rice to keep in stock

loan.name: Mr. Sophat Orm Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people in Thnal village in Kampong Chhnang province make up the group that will receive this village bank loan, and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mr. Sophat O. is the village bank president. He is a firewood seller in the local village. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it, so he decided to ask for a loan to buy more firewood to resell. His wife, Mrs. Su Srey, is a farmer who has to 0.5 hectares to cultivate rice to earn a living. Mr. Sophat O. is 34 years old and the father of three children who all attend the local school. Group members Mrs. Sokhen O. and Mrs. KH. O. are not taking a loan themselves, but their husbands are, so their husbands are presented in the picture instead.
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Fourteen members have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMKâ€™s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodiaâ€™s poor. These allow people to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMKâ€™s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: To buy more firewood to resell

loan.name: Mrs. Sokhum Dang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan will go to sixteen people in Phum Soupy village in Kampong Chhnang province, and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sokhum D. is a village bank president, selected by the members. She is a basket seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Sdao Kin, is a laborer who can make a small income to support the family. Although they try to work hard, they still earn only a little income to support the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sokhum D. decided to ask for a loan to buy three piglets to start a breeding business. Mrs. Sokhum D. is 39 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is a laborer while the others attend the local school. Group member Mr. Yung N. is not taking a loan, but his wife is, so she is presented in the picture instead of him.
All the members in this village bank have end-of-term loans, so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMKâ€™s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodiaâ€™s poor. These allow people to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMKâ€™s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: To buy three piglets to start a breeding business

loan.name: Lo's Group

texts.en:
This small loan request is being made by five borrowers, all residents of Siem Reap Province, led by Mrs. Lo P., a 40-year-old rice farmer and fish-seller in her village. Having started her business in 2000, she can earn on average $2 per day. Lo has three children, all teenagers attending school, and is married to 41-year-old Hin Samboeun, a fisherman. In order to increase income, Lo is requesting a loan to purchase rice from a local farmer to store and later sell at a profit.

The other four group members are:

Bit H., 31, a fish-seller seeking a loan to buy rice to sell for a profit;

Yem R., 41, a fish-seller requesting a loan to purchase rice to store for sale;

Lep L., a 33-year-old pig-raiser who wants to buy rice to sell for a profit;

Hin S., a 36-year-old construction worker who hopes to start a new business and is therefore requesting a loan to buy piglets to raise.

loan.use: To purchase rice to store for later sale.

loan.name: Chheng Oin's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chheng Oin N. is the leader of a group of four who all live in Pour Steang village in Kampong Cham province. She is a duck breeder. Since her duck breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it; therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Y Im, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice.
All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans, so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMKâ€™s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodiaâ€™s poor. These allow people to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMKâ€™s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: To buy more ducks for breeding

loan.name: Chhunmeng

texts.en: Mr. Chhunmeng M. was born in 1961, and he now lives in Choeung Wat village in Kampong Cham province. He is a nurse at the Provincial Health Care Center. His wife, Mrs. Yun Kim Yan, sells medicines. Since Mr. Chhunmeng M. has a lot of patients, he decided to ask for a loan to purchase more medicines to sell them for an income. He hopes to increase his income and provide a better life for his family. He is the father of three children, two of whom stay at home to do housework while the other attends the local school. His wife is shown on the right of picture.

loan.use: To buy more medicines to sell

loan.name: Khun

texts.en: Mrs. Khun K. is a farmer in Kna Ruong village in Takeo province. She owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Ros Rim, is a construction worker. Even thought they try to work hard, they still earn insufficient income to provide a better life for their family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Khun K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start breeding. She is 44 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while another is a laborer and the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loan.use: To buy a cow to start breeding

loan.name: Sophy

texts.en: Mrs. Sophy O. lives in Dork Por village in Takeo province. She buys coconuts to resell in the local village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more coconuts to resell. She would use the rest of the money to purchase a cart to transport her coconuts to sell door-to-door. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Nuo Chor, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Sophy O. is 39 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom attend the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is pictured on the right of photo.

loan.use: To buy more coconuts and a cart to transport them

loan.name: Leng

texts.en: Mrs. Leng K. lives in Dork Por village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Chhorn Touch, are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate rice and vegetables to earn a living. On the farm, they face some problems with insufficient rice seeds and infertile soil. In order to solve these problems, Mrs. Leng K. decided to ask for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. In addition, she would use the rest of the loan to buy a pump to water the field to make her crop more productive. She is 43 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. Her husband is pictured with her in the photo.

loan.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizer and a water pump

loan.name: Kimsan

texts.en: Mrs. Kimsan S. was born in 1974, and she now lives in Dork Por village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Suos Chhoeun, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice and vegetables. On the farm, they face an obstacle: their field is infertile, which diminishes their crops. In order to correct this problem, Mrs. Kimsan S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer. She would use the rest of loan to buy a cow for breeding. She is the mother of eight children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another is a construction worker. Three of them attend the local school, and the others are too young to work or study.

loan.use: To buy fertilizer and a cow

loan.name: Nob

texts.en: Mr. Nob K. is a villager in Dork Por village in Takeo province. He is a coconut seller in the local village. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it, so he decided to ask for a loan to buy more coconuts to resell. In addition, he would use the rest of the loan to buy a cart to transport his coconuts to resell door-to-door. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions with this new loan. His wife, Mrs. Keop Long, is a farmer. Mr. Nob K. is 57 years old and the father of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. His wife is pictured on the right of the photo.

loan.use: To buy more coconuts and a cart to transport them

loan.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam C. was born in 1954, and she now lives in Traping Chok village in Kandal province. She owns a small grocery store in the local marketplace. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Mrs. Sam C. is a 54-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a car repairer while the other one attends the local school.

loan.use: To buy more grocery products for her inventory

loan.name: Rith

texts.en:
Mrs. Rith S. is a villager in Dock Por village in Takeo province. She is a coconut seller in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she is asking for a loan to buy more coconuts to re-sell. She will use the rest of the loan to buy a cart to transport her coconuts to re-sell door-to-door. Her husband, Mr. Saom Sambo, helps her in the current business.

Mrs. Rith S. is 46 years old and the mother of seven children three of whom are employed in a garment factory while three others are attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loan.use: To buy more coconuts to re-sell and to buy a cart to transport her coconuts.

loan.name: Jura

texts.en:
Jura A., a 47-year-old teacher by profession, is married with three children. Ten years ago, Jura saw a need for students to be able to buy used books and office supplies, so he opened a store which he operates with his loving family for this purpose. Jura has plentiful orders for a variety of books and office supplies, and now is applying to IMON for a loan to fulfill his orders. The well-being of Juraâ€™s family and his business are in your hands, and they are sincerely grateful for your support.
More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.
However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R. further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve the countryâ€™s agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.
IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients present a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loan.use: To purchase books and office supplies to expand the business.

loan.name: Sadriddinkhoja

texts.en:
Sadriddinkhoja K. is a young and energetic entrepreneur who started his own business when he was 17 in order to support his parents. His business is selling glasses and bijouterie in his store, located at the center of the city. This business allows him to support his large family which consists of his wife, parents, two sisters and little brother.
Today Sadriddinkhoja needs to increase the range of the goods he sells and so is requesting a loan of $1200 for the term of 12 months. This loan will allow him to expand his business, to earn more, and in the future to realize all of his projects. Be an important part of the growth of Sadriddinkhojaâ€™s business!

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loan.use: To purchase glasses and bijouterie to expand the range of goods for sale.

loan.name: Azimjon

texts.en:
Azimjon M. is 36 years old and heâ€™s married with three children. His wife is a housekeeper who looks after their children. Azimjon is the only breadwinner in the family and he is really hard working. He has a cafe where he sells the traditional meals and other foodstuff. He has been in this business for 3 years. Azimjon tries to have fresh foodstuff and tasty meals in his cafÃ©, to ensure his clients enjoy eating, have a rest, and buy any other items they need. His business is stable, and this allows him to generate a significant income to ensure a good lifestyle for his family.
Azimjonâ€™s children are now growing and the expenses of raising them are increasing too. Thus, Azimjon wants to increase his business to earn more money to cover the expenses of his children. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan to expand his cafÃ©. He plans to pay back the loan on time and thanks everyone for their support. Be an important part of the growth of Azimjonâ€™s business.

loan.use: To expand his business in order to earn more money.

loan.name: Malohat

texts.en:
Malohat S. is 49 years old. She is married and the loving mother of two children. Malohat breeds calves and cows. She buys the calves at the market for a low price, then feeds them and resells them at the same market for a more profitable amount. Her husband, who is in the picture too, also helps with this business. Malohat works hard in order to make the business successful and generate a stable income for the family.
Now, Malohat is planning to purchase three calves to raise and then sell. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting a loan. Malohat would like to thank everyone for their support and promises to manage the loan without violations or delinquency.
More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

loan.use: To purchase cattle for breeding and selling.

loan.name: Manzura

texts.en:
Manzura S. is a 37-year-old divorced mother of two children. She lives in the town of Kostakoz, and works as a nursing assistant in a medical clinic. In partnership with her brother, Manzura buys and sells cattle on her days off. Her brother helps her out with both business and personal matters. He advised her to buy several rams at the market while they were cheap, and therefore Manzura has decided to take out a loan with MicroInvest. When we stopped by, Manzura was at work, so her photograph was take in the office.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying and selling of cattle

loan.name: Bahodur

texts.en:
Bahodur is a 26-year-old who has four children. He works as an electrician in a factory in Kostakoz where juice and tomatoes are processed. Every Sunday Bahodur goes to the market and sells cattle. He has been in this business for six years. Many look to him for advice on how to choose cattle for purchase. Bahodur knows breeds of cattle very well, and therefore he would like to take out a loan for the purchase of inexpensive small-horned cattle.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase and sale of cattle

loan.name: Jitahidi Msakuzi Group

texts.en:
Amina Lukando, age 48, is a widow with four children ages 28, 25, 22 and 14. She has a vegetable and fruit business which she started 15 years ago. She works daily from 6am until 4pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $122.

This will be Aminaâ€™s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her capital and managed to employ samba boys. She bought enough seeds for planting the vegetables and fruits and has repaid the loans successfully. She now hopes for a third loan to buy an irrigation machine.

Amina will share this loan with her loan group, Jitahidi Msakuzi, which totals 15 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Amina is sitting in the middle in front.

loan.use: To buy an irrigation machine.

loan.name: Chham

texts.en:
Chham M. is 46 years old, a resident of Kompong Tom province. He plays the Khmer musical instrument to provide entertainment for wedding parties and other ceremonies, as well as raising pigs from his house. He started his businesses more than 10 years ago, and currently earns the money of approximately $5 a day. He is married to Mom Yorn, with five children. One of his daughters is employed as a garment worker in the Phnom Penh City. Mom Yorn is 46 years old and earns a living by selling Khmer cake as well as raising pigs with her husband.

Mr. M. has applied for a loan to buy more pig food and a pumping machine to pump water for his family's using. (The picture shows M.'s wife because he was not available.)

loan.use: To buy more pig food and a pumping machine.

loan.name: Muhiddin
