texts.en:
Muhiddin is a 45-year-old man, the father of two children, and works as a taxicab driver. His wife is a physician at the town's hospital. From childhood, Muhiddin helped his father to care for their domesticated cattle; generally they had cows. After the death of his father, Muhiddin stepped into his shoes and continued the business, and to this day he trades in cattle. At present he has two large cows and five rams, which he will sell at the Sunday market. Muhiddin decided to take out a loan in order to increase his herd.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase and sale of cattle

loan.name: Uvumilivu Group

texts.en:
Rukia K., age 46, is married with three children ages 25, 22 and 18. She sells ladies clothes, bags and vitenge (traditional Swahili fabrics). She started this business in 1990 and works daily from 10am until 6pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about $285.

This will be Rukiaâ€™s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first loan to buy sewing machines and opened a sewing shop and has paid the loans back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to expand her shop by purchasing an interlocking machine and another sewing machine.

Rukia will share this loan with subgroup A of the Uvumilivu group. The subgroup has seven members who run groceries, a salon, and sell clothes and food. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Rukia is first on the left.

loan.use: To buy an interlocking machine and a sewing machine.

loan.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid K. is 32 years old and married with four children. The family lives with his parents in Shewa, Jalalabad city, Nangarhar province. He is a teacher at his village's school, and he also has a lot of experience in agriculture because he owns land in his village.
Walid has two sons and two daughters who are very happy. His two sons attend school and also want to get a higher education. With this in mind, Walid has a plan to open a store in the school and has requested a loan for this purpose.
Therefore he contacted the lenders of AFSG to take out a loan to buy some supplies such as notebooks, pens, pencils, sharpeners, and other things. He will also use his own capital. He would like to thank Kiva and its lenders very much for their support.

loan.use: To buy some supplies for his school store.

loan.name: Im

texts.en:
Im A. is 49 years old and lives in Kompong Tom province. He owns and runs a horse-cart taxi, providing his service for passengers or merchandise transportation. He cA. earn A. income of $3 a day to help meet his family's expenses. He is married with eight children; seven of them are single and another one is married who lives away from home. Three of his children are employed as construction workers at the Thailand Country. His wife is a rice farmer and also is a good housewife.

Recently, A. cannot attract his clients as before because his old cart is often broken. Thus he decided to ask for a loA. to buy a new cart to replace the old one, and also to order rice to store and then sell for a profit. He is shown in the photo with his family.

loan.use: To buy a cart to replace an old one.

loan.name: Phat

texts.en:
Mr. Phat V. is a villager born in 1943. He now lives in Toek Nim village in Kandal province. He is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetable. His wife, Mrs. In Nai, helps him in the plantation. They have two children who are both employed in a garment factory.

Although they try to work hard, they still earn insufficient income and live in an old house in poor conditions. In order to improve these, Mr. Phat V. decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings to build a new house for the family. His wife is also presented with him in the picture.

loan.use: To add to his savings to build a new house for the family.

loan.name: Samnang Chum's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Samnang C. is a group leader of five who are all living in Kaeng Ta Sok village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Samnang C. is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetable. In vegetable farming, she faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy bean seeds to cultivate in the field. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Samnang C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more bean seeds. Her husband, Mr. Real Sophal, helps her in the farming. Mrs. Samnang C. is 44 years old and the mother of five children one of whom is working in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

All the members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. The end-of-term (EoT) loan is AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loan.use: To buy more bean seeds for cultivation.

loan.name: Rithy Moeung's Group

texts.en:
This group which consists of four people is located in Sontouch village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Rithy M. is the group leader. She is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and then re-sell later at a better price. This business is going well, so she wants to expand it and has asked for a loan to buy 1,000 kilograms of rice to keep in stock. Her husband, Mr. Chhoem Sarun, is a policeman who makes a small salary to support the family. Mrs. Rithy M. is 41 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are working as constructors while the others are attending the local school.

Mrs. Rithy M. will share this loan with the members of her group.

loan.use: To buy 1,000 kilograms of rice to keep in stock.

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Im

texts.en: Im S. is 31 years old and married to Sim Mao, 33. They are residents of Kompong Tom Province. The couple are both rice traders who earn their living by purchasing rice from farmers and reselling it for a profit. They are responsible for their three children, all of whom are single and go to school. Because the sale of rice is the principal way for them to earn money to sustain their family's needs, Im S. and Sim Mao hope to enlarge their business operation. Thus, they would like to request a loan to buy additional rice to sell.

loan.use: To buy additional rice to sell.

loan.name: Nem Srey's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nem S. is a group leader of six who all live in Phum Tmey village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a farmer who owns 0.5 hectares for rice cultivation. Aside from this plantation, she is a fisherwoman who catches a small number of fish to support the family. In order to catch more fish, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets and fishing line for her business. Mrs. Nem S. is a 32-year-old widow with three children two of whom are attending the local school while the remaining one is too young to work or study.

All the members in this village bank loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. The end-of-term (EoT) loan is AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loan.use: To buy more fishnets and fishing line for her business.

loan.name: Waliholla

texts.en: Waliholla is 39 years old and married with 3 children. He works hard in agriculture, and lives in Shewa, Nangarhar province. He has been involved in the business of agriculture for more than 5 years, and now wants to take out a loan from AFSG. He would like the loan to help his business grow, and promises to be a good client for Kiva and AFSG. Waliholla is certain that he can repay the loan on time and he is very happy about receiving this loan. He would like to thank everybody who helps him, in the poor country of Afghanistan.

loan.use: To increase his agricultural business.

loan.name: Mrs. Saory Horn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank which consists of 12 people is located in Thlok Damnak Luong village in Takeo province and all the members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Saory H. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a 0.3 hectare plantation to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a poultry breeder who raises chickens. Since this business is goI. well, she wants to expand it, so she is askI. for a loan to buy more chickens for breedI.. She will use the rest of the loan to buy chicken food to feed them. Her husband, Mr. S. Chim, is a cow breeder. Mrs. Saory H. is 22 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study.

One member in this village bank loan is an end-of-term (EoT) loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. The client with the EoT loan is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. The EoT loan is AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loan.use: To buy more chickens for breeding and chicken food to feed them.

loan.name: Prohim

texts.en:
Mr. Prohim E. is a villager in Kanhong village in Kampong Chhnang province. He is a farmer who owns two hectares to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Math Tiesas, is a housewife who cooks delicious food for the family. Although they try to work hard, they still earn insufficient income to support the family.

In order to improve the living conditions, Mr. Prohim E. decided to ask for a loan to start a cow breeding business. He hopes to increase their income after he sells his cow. Mr. Prohim E. is 38 years old and the father of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is 10 months old.

loan.use: To buy a cow to start cow breeding business.

loan.name: South

texts.en: Mrs. South D. was born in 1957 and she now lives in Phlov Veay village, in Kampong Chhnang province. She owns a small store where she sells rice and grocery products. Since this business is going well, she would like to expand it. She has decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to re-sell. South is a widow with three children, two of whom are working in a garment factory while the youngest one is attending the local school.

loan.use: Purchase more rice to re-sell.

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch D. lives in Kok village, in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a farmer, who earns a small revenue from a tiny piece of land where she cultivates rice. She now wants to expand her rice growing revenue and has decided to ask for a loan, which along with her savings will buy a additional plot of land to grow rice. Her husband, Mr. Nai Thol, helps her with the rice planting Mrs. Touch D. is 50 years old and the mother of five children; one is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loan.use: Requesting a loan to buy a plot of land to cultivate rice.

loan.name: Khun

texts.en: Khun N. is 38 years old and lives in Kompong Tom Province, where she makes a living catching fish for sale. She also sells the eggs of the ducks that she raises at home. She now earns a revenue of around $8 per day, and has operated her businesses for more than eight years. She takes care of four children, who are all teenagers and attend school. Her husband, Meung Mat, 34, helps her with her businesses. To expand the business and earn additional income, Khun N. needs a loan to buy more ducks to raise and to buy a second-hand motorcycle to transport the eggs and fish to the market. (Khun N., her husband, and her children are in the picture.)

loan.use: To buy more ducks to raise.

loan.name: Na

texts.en: Mrs. Na C. was born in 1980 and she now lives in Takol village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a farmer who cultivates rice on a 1 hectare plot of land. She is a 28 year old widow with one child who is attends the local school. Although she works hard, she still does not earn sufficient income to support the family. They also live in an old house that is in poor condition. In order to improve these conditions, Mrs. Na C. decided to request a loan to add to her savings and build a new house for her family. She hopes to provide a better life for her family with this new loan.

loan.use: requests a loan to add to her saving and build a new house for her family.

loan.name: Ghurzang

texts.en:
Ghurzang is a young man who is uneducated, but has lots of experience in the agricultural business. He has been involved in this business for more than 10 years in Shewa, Nangarhar province. Prior to this loan, he worked in agriculture in his own village, but now he has responsibility for his family. For the past 10 years he has tried many times to increase his sales of animals, but was unsuccessful. Then he was pleased to find AFSG in Jalalabad city, and decided to apply for a loan.
Now he requested an individual loan to enlarge his work and further his business with more success and become strong in his business and make a good monthly income for his family.

loan.use: To buy animals.

loan.name: Man

texts.en:
Man M. is 56 years old and widowed. She lives in Kandal Province, where she runs a little store selling various kinds of groceries such as prepared food, canned food, and sweets for kids. Most of her customers are neighbors. She started her business in 1990, and it is doing very well, and she currently earns approximately of $5 a day. She has three children: two are single and one is married. To help meet the family's expenses, two of her sons are employed as motorcycle taxi drivers.
Man M. hopes to build a washroom, but she is lacking the money to do that. Therefore, she would like to apply for a loan to build a restroom for her family. (She and her son are pictured.)

loan.use: To build a restroom.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To ask for a loan to buy one more cow and three more pigs for her husband's business.

loan.name: Sao Yim

texts.en: Mrs. Sao Yim S. is a villager in Dock Por village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a rice seller in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to re-sell to her customers. Her husband, Mr. Chea Sophat, is a teacher who can make a small salary to support the family. Mrs. Sao Yim S. is 40 years old and the mother of four children who are all attending the local school.

loan.use: To ask for a loan to buy more rice to re-sell to her customers.

loan.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad Z. has been involved in agriculture for more than five years. He lives in a household of 12 members in Shewa. He is a very hard worker man, but he can't support his family so he would like to expand his business. He has therefore requested an individual loan of 30,000 Afghanis (USD$625) with a term of 27 months to complete his stock and buy some seeds and other items for his land. He wants to further his business, help his family and make a better life in Afghanistan.

Muhammad is happy with this loan process. He plans to open a shop for his brother in the future. He would like to thank all lenders, Kiva and AFSG for this fantastic process of small loans in his country. He would like to be a good businessmen in the future.

loan.use: complete his stocks

loan.name: Thoerun

texts.en: Mr. Thoerun C. is a farmer who lives in Kraing Khmer village in Kampong Chhnang province. His wife, Mrs. Chea Sreymom, is pig breeder. Although they try to work hard, they still live in an old house in poor conditions. In order to improve these living conditions, Mr. Thoerun C. decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings to build a new house for his family. Mr. Thoerun C. is 38 years old and the father of five children, one of whom is working in Malaysia while three others are attending the local school and the remaining one, two years old, is too young to work or study.

loan.use: To ask for a loan to add to his savings to build a new house for his family.

loan.name: Thul's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Thul P. is a group leader of four members who all live in Khnong village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Thul P. and her husband, Mr. Chhai Chhon, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn their living. In this plantation, they can gather only a little rice revenue which cannot support the family well. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Thul P. decided to ask for a loan to buy piece of land to cultivate to expand her rice revenue. Mrs. Thul P. is 37 years old and the mother of five children, four of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child four years old.

loan.use: To ask for a loan to buy piece of land to cultivate to expand her rice revenue.

loan.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinat M. is a group leader of four members, who all live in Phum Ty Buon village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Sinat M. is 28 years old and the mother of a child who is four years old, too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Koy Pearom, is a vet in the local village.

Mrs. Sinat M. sells clothes in the local village. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. She decided to ask for a loan to purchase more fashionable clothing to sell to her customers.

loan.use: Buy more fashionable clothes for her customers

loan.name: Sabza Gul Group

texts.en:
Gul Khanum is the group leader of the Sabza Gul group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for his/her own business.

Ziba Gul and Gul Khanum want to take a loan for the business of sewing. Sabza Gul wants to take a loan for her husband's business and S. Agha wants to receive a loan for his fruit cart. They all want to see progress in their businesses and to earn more money to support their families and solve their problems.

They say that these loans can be very useful because they provide a chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses.

loan.use: To expand a sewing business.

loan.name: Khoja Mirwais

texts.en:
K. Mirwais lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. His house is near Lese Maryam. He is single and he has a general store. He has been involved in this business for more than five years and has a good number of customers.
Mirwais wants to make his business larger. He has requested an individual loan of 50,000 afghani (USD$1,050) for a term of 18 months. With it, he wants to expand his business, buy necessities and complete his stock.
Mirwais is very happy about this program of loans in Afghanistan and wants to thank AFSG and Kiva lenders around the world.

loan.use: To expand his general store.

loan.name: Miroslav

texts.en:
Miroslav is married and has two children. He rents a store and sells various construction supplies that are used to build and fix houses. His large assortment, good prices and good location bring more and more clients to his store. Miroslav has been in this business for six years. He knows what is in demand and offers his clients what they need.

Miroslav is a very optimistic person and believes that his business can grow even more. His goal is to purchase the store so that he can save money on rent. Moreover, one of his children (his one-year-old daughter) has an eye problem and the family needs money for the surgery and following treatment.

Miroslav would like to receive a loan of 7,000 UAH (USD$900) to purchase more inventory. At this time the prices for construction supplies are low and he can make very good deals and receive more profit.

loan.use: To increase the inventory in his construction supply store.

loan.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
El Sr. Feliciano tiene 47 aÃ±os de edad, esta casado con la seÃ±ora MarÃ­a Amarilla de 39 aÃ±os con la que tiene 3 hijos, un varÃ³n de 19 aÃ±os el cual trabaja en la empresa familiar y los otros dos son menores los cuales estÃ¡n a la tutela de sus padres.
El mismo tiene experiencia desde los 18 aÃ±os de edad trabajando como secretario para terceros donde aprendiÃ³ la profesiÃ³n. Actualmente cuanta con taller propio el mismo tiene todas las herramientas necesarios para dicho trabajo. El cliente viene desarrollando trabajos de mantenimiento, rectificaciones, parte elÃ©ctrica y todo lo relacionado a la parte mecÃ¡nica de motocicletas. El cliente comento que actualmente es el taller autorizado por chacomer (fabricante de motos de la marca Kenton) El prÃ©stamo serÃ¡ destinado para la compra de una prensa mecÃ¡nica, el cual serÃ¡ destinado para trabajos en el taller, con dicha herramienta el cliente harÃ¡ mÃ¡s Ã¡gil sus trabajos de reparaciÃ³n y mantenimiento de motocicletas.
texts.en:
SeÃ±or Feliciano is 47 years old and is married to SeÃ±ora Maria Amarilla, who is 39 years old. The couple has three children: a 19-year-old son who works in the family business, and two younger children who are still under their parents' guardianship.

SeÃ±or Feliciano began working as a secretary for motorcycle mechanics when he was 18 years old, and gradually learned the profession himself. He currently has his own repair shop, with all of the necessary tools to do his job. He performs maintenance, corrections, electrical work, and anything else involving mechanical work on motorcycles. His workshop was approved as an authorized maintenance location by the CHACOMER company (which manufactures Kenton brand motorcycles).

The loan will be used to buy a mechanical press to use in his workshop. This machine will allow him to refine the repair and maintenance work that he does on motorcycles.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy a mechanical press

loan.name: Lorena

texts.es:
La Sra. Lorena cuenta con 30 aÃ±os de edad, esta casada con el seÃ±or Robert Chamorro de 40 aÃ±os, matrimonio tiene 3 hijos todos menores los cuales, 1 varÃ³n de 8 aÃ±os, nenas de 6 y 4 aÃ±os respectivamente.
En el negocio trabaja la cliente y su marido esta en la parte de carnicerÃ­a, el mismo compra las reces, luego lo faena y vende en el mismo negocio el cual ayuda al ingreso, ademÃ¡s actÃºa de enganche para la venta de otros productos como fideos, arroz, aceites, sal, mandioca y otros que son de consumo diario.
Tiene cliente formada por que lleva trabajado desde hace 5 aÃ±os mÃ¡s o menos. Me comento que se inicio trabajando como vendedora de leche y poco a poco se hizo de capital y formo su propio negocio el cual hoy es una despensa y carnicerÃ­a muy bien surtida. El prÃ©stamo solicitado es para compra de sidras, cervezas y gaseosas ya que se aproximan las fiestas de fin de aÃ±o.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lorena is 30 years old and married. Her husband, Robert Chamorro, is 40 years old. They have three children. Their son is eight years old and their daughters are six and four, respectively. Lorena and her husband own a grocery and butcher shop. He works with the supplies, and she works with the clients. Robert buys the animals himself, later he butchers and sells the meat in the same business. This process increases the business' income, because he acts as the conduit to sell other products such as noodles, rice, cooking oil, salt, tapioca, and other staples. Lorena and Robert have developed a base of clients over the past five years, since they opened the store. They began this work by selling milk, and little by little they earned the capital to start their own business, which is now a well-supplied butcher shop and store. The loan will go toward the purchase of cider, beer, and soda, as we're now getting closer to end-of-the year parties.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy cider, beer, and soda

loan.name: Caritina

texts.es: La seÃ±ora es casada, tiene 54 aÃ±os de edad, su conyugue se encuentra trabajando en Argentina como constructor, tiene un hijo mayor, vive en la ciudad de Pilar, en casa propia, en el barrio 12 Octubre de esta ciudad, en dicha residencia particular cuenta con las comodidades para el hogar, en el mismo domicilio posee un local de un taller de carpinterÃ­a donde se realiza trabajos de todo tipo, ya sea compostura y trabajos por pedido. Esta en esta actividad como ya mas de 12 aÃ±os, posee todas las maquinarias necesarias para el desarrollo de su actividad que fuera para dentro del taller. Solicita el crÃ©dito para comprar madera para realizar trabajos que tienen pedidos para entregar.
texts.en:
Caritina is 54 years old and married. Her husband works in construction in Argentina. She has an adult son and she lives in the town of Pilar, in her own house in the neighbourhood of 12 Octubre. She has all she needs in her home, where she has a carpentry workshop to carry out all sorts of work, whether is be assembly or made-to-order. She has been in this business for more than 12 years and owns all the machinery needed for carpentry in her workshop. She is requesting the loan in order to buy materials for orders which they have to deliver.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy material for carpentry

loan.name: Mohamed Edouard

texts.fr: Mohamed pratique un Ã©levage de volaille Ã l'Ã©chelle familiale. Il habite au quartier ChÃ¢teau d'Eau et arrive ,grÃ¢ce Ã ses activitÃ©s , Ã subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il sollicite ce prÃªt pour renforecr son Ã©levage et faire du petit commerce.
texts.en:
Mohamed has a home-size poultry farm. He lives in the ChÃ¢teau d'Eau district. Thanks to his work, he manages to provide for his family. He is requesting this loan to bolster his poultry-raising business and to conduct small-scale commerce.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Raising poultry and small-scale commerce

loan.name: Carlos

texts.es: El Carlos RamÃ­rez, tiene 46 aÃ±os de edad, es casado, su conyugue se llama Zaida VerÃ³n, tienen dos hijos menores, un varÃ³n y una nena ambos menores de edad, vive en la ciudad de Mayor Martinez, vive en casa propia, en el centro mismo de esta ciudad, en dicha residencia particular cuenta con las comodidades para el hogar, en el mismo domicilio posee un local comercial denominado Comercial San Carlos , donde se comercializa todo tipo de artÃ­culos de primera necesidad, tienda, ferreterÃ­a, carnicerÃ­a, etc. Es dueÃ±o tambiÃ©n de dos lÃ­neas de trasporte de pasajeros que realiza viajes desde esta ciudad hasta la Ciudad de Pilar. Es comerciante, esta en esta actividad mÃ¡s de 10 aÃ±os, posee buena cantidad de mercaderÃ­as. Solicita el crÃ©dito para comprar animales para faenar.
texts.en:
Carlos RamÃ­rez, 46 years old, is married. His wife is Zaida VerÃ³n; they have two young children: a son and a daughter, both minors. He lives in the town of Mayor Martinez, in his own home in the centre of the town. He has all the necessities of home, and runs a business called Comercial San Carlos out of his house, where he sells all sorts of basic goods for stores, hardware stores, butcher shops, etc. He also owns two passenger transports which travel between his town and the town of Pilar. He has been in this business for more than 10 years and has a good stock of merchandise. He is requesting the loan to buy work animals.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy animals

loan.name: Juan

texts.es: El Sr. P. es casado tiene 4 hijos propietario de una empresa dedicada a la fabricaciÃ³n y reparaciÃ³n de camiones acoplados y semirremolques. El predio cuenta con 2 terrenos para desarrollar su actividad espacio que le es insuficiente. Con el crÃ©dito de la fundaciÃ³n podrÃ¡ completar sus ahorros y comprara el terreno que esta ubicado al costado izquierdo del taller. El cliente esta muy agradecido con la FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya ya que podrÃ¡ ampliar su local y aumentara sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mr. P. is married and has 4 children. He owns a business rebuilding and repairing truck trailers and semitrailers. The premises are made up of 2 lots which is not enough space for the work he does. With this loan from the Foundation he will be able to supplement his savings and buy the lot to the left of his workshop. The client is very grateful to FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya as he will be able to expand his workspace and increase his revenues.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy land

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy merchandise such as sugar, tea, milk, cookies, drinks of all kinds, etc.

loan.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Carmen vive en casa propia en la calle GuzmÃ¡n de Rojas de la zona de Sopocachi, no tiene hijos es mujer sola, la actividad que tiene es la de comerciante ya que tiene una tienda ubicada en la zona de Llojeta, con esta actividad ella se mantiene, el crÃ©dito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y surtir mejor su tienda con mayor variedad de productos (sodas, dulces, pan, leche, arroz, fideo, etc.) para atraer mas clientela.
El historial de la seÃ±ora e muy bueno por lo tanto califica para obtener un nuevo crÃ©dito.
texts.en:
Carmen lives in her own home on GuzmÃ¡n de Rojas Street in the Sopacachi neighborhood. She is single and has no children. She has her own store located in the Llojeta neighborhood, and this is how she earns her income. The loan that she has requested is to increase her capital and better stock her store with a better variety of products (sodas, sweets, bread, milk, rice, noodles, etc.) in order to attract more customers. Her credit history is very good, and because of this she qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy more products for her grocery store

loan.name: Marina

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Marina vive en alquiler en la calle circunvalaciÃ³n de la zona de Pasankeri, de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja en la Cancilleria en el Ã¡rea de servicio de tÃ©. El crÃ©dito que solicita es para salud ya que desde hace un mes sufre dolores de columna y el medico le dijo que necesitarÃ¡ varios exÃ¡menes para saber lo que tiene.
El historial de la seÃ±ora es muy bueno por lo tanto califica para obtener un nuevo crÃ©dito. Es cliente nuestro desde el aÃ±o 2006.
texts.en:
Marina lives in a rented home on CircunvalaciÃ³n street in the Pasankeri district of La Paz city; she works at the State Department in tea service. She asks for a loan for medical expenses. For a month she has suffered spinal pain for which the doctor said she will need various examinations to diagnose. Her credit history is very good, therefore she qualifies for a new loan. She has been an IMPRO client since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Expenses for medical exams and analysis for spinal pain

loan.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora se dedica a la compra y venta de chuÃ±o y queso que compra de las mayoristas por cantidad para vender al detalle. Vende su mercaderÃ­a en las ferias de la zona sur. El crÃ©dito solicitado serÃ¡ para incrementar su capital de trabajo y comprar mÃ¡s queso y chuÃ±o. Vive en la zona de Alto Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz tiene cinco hijos, dos estÃ¡n a su cargo y su esposo es albaÃ±il. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crÃ©dito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crÃ©dito.
texts.en:
Teodora works buying and selling potato flour and cheese that she buys wholesale to sell in smaller quantities. She sells her merchandise at the markets in the southern part of the city. The loan requested will be used to increase her working capital and buy more cheese and potato flour. She lives in the Alto Irpavi neighborhood in the city of La Paz. She has five children, two of whom are under her care, and her husband is a bricklayer. This is the second time that she has requested a loan from Kiva partner Impro. Her history qualifies her for this loan. In other words, she has had a good payment history.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy cheese and potato flour wholesale to sell in smaller quantities

loan.name: Avelina

texts.es: Avelina se dedica a la compra de botellas de plÃ¡stico al detalle para venderlas en cantidad en las empresas que reciclan botellas de plÃ¡stico. Vive en la zona de bajo Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene dos hijos que esta a su cargo ya que es el Ãºnica que genera ingresos en su familia porque es madre soltera. El crÃ©dito que solicita serÃ¡ utilizado para comprar 500 botellas de plastico y de vidrio, tambiÃ©n comprarÃ¡ papel (alrededor de 500 kilos) para vender a las fÃ¡bricas recicladotas y obtener mejores ingresos. Es la Segunda vez que solicita un crÃ©dito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crÃ©dito.
texts.en:
Avelina buys plastic bottles at retail value and sells them in bulk to recycling programs. She lives below the Irpavi district in La Paz city and is a single mother supporting her 2 children. The loan she requests will be used to buy 500 plastic and glass bottles, and about 500 kg of paper to sell to the recycling programs and increase her earnings. This is her second loan from Impro; her good payment history qualifies her for another loan.

loan.name: Felipa

texts.es: Felipa es comerciante, su esposo se dedica a la elaboraciÃ³n de muebles y ella se encarga de realizar los contratos y ofertar sus productos de carpinterÃ­a a pedido. Vive en la zona Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz como cuidadora, es decir vive en unas dos habitaciones sin pagar alquiler a cambio de cuidar esa vivienda. tiene tres hijos que estÃ¡n en edad escolar. El crÃ©dito que ahora solicita es para la compra de madera, venesta y barniz para continuar en el negocio de elaboraciÃ³n de muebles junto con su esposo. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crÃ©dito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crÃ©dito.
texts.en:
Felipa is a storekeeper. Her husband makes furniture and she is in charge of making contracts and offering their products to the workshops that order them. She lives in the zone Irpavi II in the city of La Paz as a nanny. This means she lives in two houses without paying rent in exchange for taking care of the homes. She has three children that are of school age. The loan that she is requesting is for buying wood, plywood, and varnish in order to continue the business of making furniture with her husband. This is the second time she has requested a loan with Impro. Her credit history qualifies her for a client rating 1 with Impro, which means that she has an excellent repayment history of her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying wood, plywood and varnish for her furniture-making business

loan.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar tiene una movilidad que trabaja como radio taxi, es soltero y el Ãºnico que genera ingresos para sus gastos de alimentaciÃ³n y otros gastos. Vive en la zona de Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz en casa alquilada El crÃ©dito serÃ¡ destinado para la el mantenimiento de su vehÃ­culo ( Compra de llantas, chaperio y arreglo de motor). Es la segunda vez que solicita un crÃ©dito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crÃ©dito.
texts.en:
Oscar has a car that he uses as a radio taxi (public taxi). He is single and the sole source of income for his food and other expenses. He lives in a rented house in the Obrajes neighborhood of La Paz. He plans to use his loan for maintenance of his vehicle (buy tires, do general repairs, and repair the engine). This will be his second loan with IMPRO. Oscarâ€™s credit history has earned him a #1 rating, meaning he has paid off his loans completely and on time.

loan.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy se dedica a la venta de abarrotes los fines de semana ya que de lunes a viernes trabaja en una imprenta. Vive en la zona de obrajes sector Collpajahuira de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene dos hijos que estÃ¡n a su cargo ya que es la Ãºnica que genera ingresos porque es madre soltera. El crÃ©dito solicitado serÃ¡ utilizado en la compra de mercaderÃ­a (arroz, fideo, dulces, sodas, etc.) para su posterior venta. Es la Segunda vez que solicita un crÃ©dito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crÃ©dito.

On the week-ends Nancy sells groceries and from Monday through Friday she works at a printer's. She lives in the zone of production, in the Collpajahuira sector of the town of La Paz. She has two children and she alone generates the necessary income as she is a single mother. The loan requested will be spent on buying merchandise (rice, noodles, candy, soda, etc.) to be sold later.

This is her second loan from Impro, she is qualified as a number 1 client, meaning she punctually repays her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase merchandise for a grocery store.

loan.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y refrescos y es la Ãºnica que genera ingresos en su familia ya que es viuda y tiene tres hijos. Vive en la zona de obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz en casa propia. El crÃ©dito serÃ¡ destinado para la compra de mercaderÃ­a ( abarrotes, refrescos, dulces, y galletas) Es la segunda vez que solicita un crÃ©dito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crÃ©dito.
texts.en:
Julia sells groceries and sodas. She alone generates income for her family as she is a widow with three children. She lives in her own house in the zone of production of the town of La Paz.

The loan will be spent on buying merchandise (groceries, sodas, candy and cookies). This is the second time she requests a loan from Impro, and she is qualified as a number 1 client, meaning she repays punctually her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loan.name: DiankÃ©

texts.fr: DiankÃ© SanÃ©, 59 ans, veuve, 01 enfant en charge est membre du banc villageois de Peyrissac depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter de lâ€™huile de palme pour renforcer son commerce. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer Ã la charge familiale Le prÃªt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursÃ© au bout de six mois en une seule Ã©chÃ©ance.

DiankÃ© SanÃ©, age 59, is a widow and has a child to look after. She has been a member of the village loan group of Peyrissac for seven and a half years. She wants to buy palm oil to bolster her commerce. Her income enables her to help cover family expenses. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.name: Pirlicas

texts.en:
Pirlicas I. has a lot of experience in growing vegetables in greenhouses. On a small area of 0.15 hectares he plants tomatoes, potatoes, cucumbers, etc. In early spring he brings his vegetables to the market at the nearby cities of Cantemir or Cahul. With the earned money he supports his family.
I. now needs a loan for autumn cultivatI. requirements of the land. With a loan of USD$1,150 he will cultivate and will prepare well the soil for spring. In the past, he has had three loans from Microinvest.

loan.use: cultivate soil.

loan.name: Dilan Satan

texts.fr: Dilan Satan S., 59 ans, mariÃ©e, 05 enfants scolarisÃ©s en charge est membre du banc villageois de Peyrissac depuis 3 ans. Son activitÃ© consiste Ã acheter et revendre des robes et ensembles africains. Les revenus tirÃ©s de son commerce vont lui permettre dâ€™amÃ©liorer les conditions de vie de sa famille Elle sollicite un prÃªt qui sera remboursÃ© au bout de six mois en une seule Ã©chÃ©ance.

Dilan Satan S., age 59, is married and has five children in school who are in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of Peyrissac for three years. Her work consists in buying and reselling dresses and African suits. The income derived from her commerce is going to allow her to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.name: Ema Pilar

Con su primer prÃ©stamo de S/. 500 pagÃ³ sus estudios. Tiene casi 1 aÃ±os trabajando con el banco. Ema nos cuenta que estudia enfermerÃ­a Con este prÃ©stamo de 500 nuevos soles que pagarÃ¡ en 4 cuotas pagara su titulaciÃ³n universitaria. Ema desea continuar trabajando para comprarse una casa.

Miss Ema is a partner of Banco Comunal "Las Amigas" of the province of Puno, in the department of Puno. She is 20 years old, single with no children. With her first loan of S/.500 she paid her studies. She has been working with the bank for 1 year. Ema tells us she is studying nursing.

With this loan of 500 nuevos soles, to be repaid in 4 payments, she will pay her university degree. Ema wishes to continue work in order to buy a house.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loan.name: Elida

texts.es: La seÃ±orita Elida es socia del Banco Comunal â€œFlores la Pampillaâ€ de la provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 23 aÃ±os de edad, es soltera y madre de 1 hija. Con su primer prÃ©stamo de S/. 300 comprÃ³ productos de belleza. Tiene casi 5 aÃ±os trabajando con el banco. Nos cuenta que cambiÃ³ de rubro, ahora vende celulares. Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 1,100 que pagarÃ¡ en 4 cuotas comprarÃ¡ celulares para su negocio Elida desea continuar trabajando para tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Miss Elida is a partner of Banco Comunal "Flores la Pampilla" of the province of Puno in the department of Puno. She is 23 years old, single and the mother of 1 daughter. With her first loan of S/.300 she bought beauty products. She has been working with the bank for almost 5 years. She tells us that at the moment she is selling mobile phones. With this loan of S/.1,100, to be repaid in 4 payments, she will purchase mobile phones for her business. Elida wishes to continue working in order to get her own premises.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

texts.fr: Awa B., mariÃ©e, 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Peyrissac depuis 7 ans et demi. Les revenus tirÃ©s de son commerce vont lui permettre dâ€™amÃ©liorer les conditions de vie de sa famille Elle sollicite un prÃªt qui sera remboursÃ© au bout de six mois en une seule Ã©chÃ©ance.
texts.en:
Awa B. is married and has three children to look after. She has been a member of the village loan group of Peyrissac for seven and a half years. Her work consists in buying cloth and supplies to make suits out of dyed fabrics, 'wax' cloth, and damask to sell. The income derived from her commerce is going to allow her to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.name: Fanta

texts.fr: Fanta S., 42 ans est veuve avec 07 enfants en charge dont 06 scolarisÃ©s. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Peyrissac depuis 7 ans et demi. Fanta veut renforcer son commerce dâ€™huile de palme. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer Ã lâ€™amÃ©lioration des conditions de vie et de santÃ© de sa famille Le prÃªt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursÃ© au bout de six mois en une seule Ã©chÃ©ance.
texts.en:
Fanta S., age 42, is a widow and has in her care seven children, of whom six are in school. She has been a member of the village loan group of Peyrissac for seven and a half years. Fanta wants to boost her commerce in palm oil. Her income enables her to help improve living conditions and her family's health. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.name: Dora

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Dora es socia del Banco Comunal â€œWiÃ±ayâ€ del distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 58 aÃ±os de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos a los que apoya econÃ³micamente. Dora con el primer prÃ©stamo de S/ 300 comprÃ³ mercaderÃ­a para venderla en su tienda. Tiene casi 3 aÃ±os trabajando con el banco. Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 1500 que pagarÃ© en 4 cuotas comprarÃ¡ mÃ¡s mercaderÃ­a para ser vendida en su tienda de abarrotes. Dora desea continuar trabajando para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Dora is a member of the communal bank "Winay", in the district and province of Puno. She is 58 years old and married with 2 children whom she helps support financially. With her first loan, Dora purchased merchandise to sell in her small general store. She has been working with the communal bank for almost 3 years now. With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 payments, she will purchase more merchandise for her business so that she can continue to support her family.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase more merchandise for her small general store

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy farm products to make more meals to resell

loan.name: ConcepciÃ³n

texts.es: La seÃ±ora ConcepciÃ³n es socia del Banco Comunal â€œDante Navaâ€ del distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 31 aÃ±os de edad, es soltera y madre de 3 hijos. ConcepciÃ³n con su primer prÃ©stamo de S/. 300 comprÃ³ lana para confeccionar prendas de vestir. Nos cuenta que con el negocio de los combustibles, al que ahora se dedica, ha aumentado su capital y sus ganancias. Tiene casi 4 aÃ±os trabajando con el banco. Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 1000 que pagarÃ¡ en 4 cuotas comprarÃ¡ combustibles y artÃ­culos de ferreterÃ­a para venderlos en su puesto. ConcepciÃ³n desea continuar trabajando para construir su casa propia y tener un local donde vender sus productos.

Ms. ConcepciÃ³n es a member of the Dante Nava Communal Bank in the district and province of Puno. She is 31 years old, single and the mother of three children. With her first loan, ConcepciÃ³n bought wool to produce clothing. She tells us that selling fuel, to which she is currently dedicated, has improved her earnings. She has worked with this bank for four years. With this loan that she'll pay in four installments, she will buy fuel and hardware to sell at her work. ConcepciÃ³n hopes to continue working so she can build her own house and have a local place where she can sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Misty McNally, Kiva Volunteer

loan.name: Celestina

texts.es: La seÃ±orita Celestina es socia del Banco Comunal â€œLas Amigasâ€ de la provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 24 aÃ±os de edad, es soltera sin hijos. Con su primer prÃ©stamo de S/. 500 comprÃ³ una computadora para su servicio de locutorio. Tiene casi 1 aÃ±os trabajando con el banco. Nos cuenta que estudia turismo. Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 800 que pagarÃ¡ en 4 cuotas tramitarÃ¡ su tÃ­tulo universitario. Celestina desea continuar trabajando para comprarse su casa.

Miss Celestina is a partner of Banco Comunal "Las Amigas" of the province of Puno in the department of Puno. She is 24 years old, single with no children. With her first loan of S/.500 she bought a computer for use at her call center. She has been working for almost a year with the bank. She tells us she is studying tourism. With this loan of S/.800, to be repaid in 4 payments, she will process her university degree. Celestina wishes to continue working in order to buy herself a house.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer
