loan.name: Familia Group

texts.en:
The Familia Village Bank is a new bank with 19 members, who after weeks of training are happy to begin their first loan cycle. Each of the members was invited to participate by the loan officer, and most of them live in the San Felipe and June 11th neighborhoods. The group members are involved in a variety of businesses, like grains, sweets, basic dry goods, meat, vegetables, firewood, cosmetics, and food sales. Some sell from their homes, while others are street or market vendors. The group members are requesting different loan amounts, like 300, 600 or 900 soles, and the group as a whole is requesting a total of 8,700 soles. They will use their loans to buy rice, sugar, pasta, meat, wheat, barley, cookies, caramels, cosmetics, firewood and wood. The group members dream of owning prosperous businesses, owning their own stores (as opposed to renting), that their children will grow up to be working professionals, and of owning their own homes.
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow
El Banco Comunal Familia es un Banco Nuevo que recien inicia con 19 socias, quienes despuÃ©s D. semanas D. capacitaciÃ³n inician con mucha alegrÃ­a. Todas ellas fueron invitadas por L. promotora, L. mayoria D. ellas son del asentamiento humano San Felipe y 11 D. junio. Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta prendan D. cereales, golosinas, abarrotes en general, carne, verduras, leÃ±a, cosmÃ©ticos y venta D. comida. Sus ventas los realizan en sus domicilios, ambulantemente, D. casa en casa y en mercados. Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prÃ©stamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles y 900 soles, haciendo un total D. 8,700 soles D. prÃ©stamos en el Banco Comunal. Los prÃ©stamos lo invertirÃ¡n en L. compra D. azucar, arroz, fideo, carne, trigo, cebada, galletas, caramelos, cosmÃ©ticos, leÃ±a y madera. Los sueÃ±os D. las socias es que sus negocios sean prÃ³speros, tener locales propios, sus hijos sean profesionales y tener casa propia.

loan.use: Buy rice, sugar, pasta, meat, wheat, barley, cookies, caramels, cosmetics, firewood and wood

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy and resell Christmas trees

loan.name: Aide

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Aide es socia del Banco Comunal â€œFlores la Pampillaâ€ del distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 22 aÃ±os de edad, es conviviente y madre de 1 hijo. Aide con su primer prÃ©stamo de S/. 300 comprÃ³ productos para vender en su quiosco. Nos cuenta que estudiÃ³ computaciÃ³n pero no ejerce su carrera por estar al cuidado de su bebe. Tiene casi 6 aÃ±os trabajando con el banco. Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 1200 que pagarÃ¡ en 4 cuotas comprarÃ¡ productos para vender en su quiosco, ademÃ¡s de juguetes. Aide desea continuar trabajando para llegar a ser propietaria de su casa.
texts.en:
SeÃ±ora Aide is a member of the community bank â€œFlowers of Pampillaâ€ from the District of Puno, in Puno Province, in the Department of Puno. She is 22 years old, has a common law husband, and is the mother of 1 child. With her first loan of S/.300, Aide bought products to sell in her kiosk. She tells us she studied computation but does not work in the field so she can care for her child. She has worked with our bank for almost 6 years. With this loan of S/.1200 that she would repay in 4 installments, she would buy products to sell in her kiosk, including toys. Aide wants to continue working so she can become the owner of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy sweets and toys

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Purchase of fuel at wholesale.

loan.name: Selina

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania and from SELFINA!! This is 35-year-old Selina A D., who is divorced with two children aged 8 and 14. Selina has been running a beauty salon business since 2003, a place where her friends and fellow women can gather and literally let their hair down. Most beauty salons in Tanzania are places where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own. It is quite a thing to be seen!
Selina works at her business ten hours a day, seven days a week, earning a monthly profit of approximately $200. She is now requesting a loan of $775 in order to purchase an additional hair dryer, chairs, hair products such as wigs, and other cosmetics. Due to the success of this business, she hopes to open another in the future, and she thanks you in advance for your support.
ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loan.use: To purchase an additional hair dryer, chairs, hair products and other cosmetics

loan.name: Vanessa Kristabel

texts.es: Vanessa se dedica al pintado de uÃ±as y tambiÃ©n manicure y pedicure, a domicilio, ya que no cuenta con un salÃ³n de esta especialidad. Es la Ãºnica que genera ingresos para los gastos de alimentaciÃ³n y estudios ya que se encuentra cursando la universidad. Vive en la zona de Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz es soltera y vive en la casa en anticrÃ©tico de sus padres.El crÃ©dito solicitado serÃ¡ destinado a la compra de tintes, cremas,, shampoos, liquidos para permanentes, etc. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crÃ©dito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crÃ©dito
texts.en:
Vanessa paints nails and does manicures and pedicures at people's homes because she does not have her own salon. She is attending a university and is the only one that earns income to cover her costs of food and education. She lives in the zone of Obraje of the city of La Paz, is single and lives in her parents' house under a special rental agreement (anticretico). The proceeds of the loan will go towards the purchase hair color, creams, shampoos, hair permanent solutions, etc.. This is the second time that she request a loan from Impro. Her history classifies her as a #1 client, meaning that she has complied with the terms of repayment of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Capital for her business.

loan.name: Marythza Rebeca

texts.es: Marythza se dedica a la compra y venta de perfumes, trabaja con catÃ¡logos a pedido Es soltera y tambiÃ©n estudia, tiene 27 aÃ±os y es la Ãºnica que genera ingresos para sus gastos ya que es independiente. El crÃ©dito serÃ¡ destinado para la compra de mercaderÃ­a ( perfumes y cosmÃ©ticos. Vive en la zona Santa rosa de la ciudad de El Alto del departamento de La Paz. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crÃ©dito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crÃ©dito.
texts.en:
Marythza buys and sells perfumes and works with orders from catalogues. She is single and a student. She is 27 years old and since she is independent, is the only one that generates income to cover her expenses. The loan will be used for the purchase of merchandise ( perfumes and cosmetics). She lives in the Santa Rosa zone of the city of El Alto of the department of La Paz. This is the second time that she request a loan from Impro. Her credit history classifies her as a #1 customer due to her good repayment history.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Capital for the business.

loan.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania and SELFINA! This is 43-year-old Mariam A. M., married with four children between the ages of 20 and 26. Mariam has been running a bar since 2004.
Her bar is a good place to relax and catch up with friends. Many cannot think of a better way to end a hard dayâ€™s work than with an ice cold local beer, under the shade from the blaring Tanzanian sun, with oneâ€™s friends.
Working at the business 16 hours per day, 7 days per week, and assisted by three employees, Mariam currently earns about $250 each month. She is now requesting a loan of $1000 in order to purchase additional stocks of beer, soda and drinking water, and in the future plans to increase her variety of stocks. Mariam thanks you for your support!
ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loan.use: To purchase additional stocks of beer, soda and drinking water.

loan.name: Lourdes Susy

texts.es: Lourdes se dedica a la venta de comida en una pensiÃ³n lo cual le ayuda de gran manera en los gastos de alimentaciÃ³n ya que es una pensiÃ³n donde le ayudan sus pequeÃ±os hijos. La pensiÃ³n y vivienda se encuentran ubicadas en la Zona de Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz. El crÃ©dito serÃ¡ destinado para la compra de insumos ( arroz, fideo, papa, aceite, y otros). Es la segunda vez que solicita un crÃ©dito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crÃ©dito.
texts.en:
Lourdes works selling food in a guest house, which helps her a great deal with the cost of feeding her family as the guest house helps her out with her small children. The guest house is located in Zona de Obrajes, in the city of La Paz. Her loan will be used to buy basic supplies such as rice, noodles, potatoes, cooking oil and other items. This is the second time that she has sought a loan from Impro. She successfully repaid her previous loan and is considered a model client.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital

loan.name: Israel Alejandro

texts.es: Israel tiene una pensiÃ³n donde vende por las noches cenas y refrescos, trabaja de lunes a domingo con su madre y por el dÃ­a como guardia de seguridad Vive en la zona de Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz es soltero y su negocio le permite solventar las gastos de su mare. El crÃ©dito serÃ¡ destinado para la compra de insumos ( arroz, fideo, papa, verduras, aceite y otros). Es la segunda vez que solicita un crÃ©dito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crÃ©dito.
texts.en:
Israel has a cafe where in the evenings he sells dinner and refreshments. He works with his mother from Monday through Sunday and is a security guard during the day. He lives in the Obrajes zone of the city of La Paz. He is single and his business allows him to cover his and his mother's expenses. The loan will be used in the purchase of supplies ( rice, noodles, potatoes, vegetables, oil and others). This is the second time that he request a loan from Impro. His credit record classifies him as a #1 client, meaning that he has a good repayment history.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Capital for the buisness.

loan.name: Johari

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Johari J. M. from Dar es Salaam, the married mother of a nine-year-old child. Johari has been running a tailoring business since 2003.
At her tailoring business she purchases vitambaa (material), vitenge (a traditional Tanzanian cloth with wax print), and kanga (printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides) and makes them into clothing mainly for women. She confided in us that what sets her tailoring business apart is that she is more skilled than others and is able to create different kinds of designs for her customers so they can stand out in a crowd.
Working at the business 11 hours per day, 6 days per week, and assisted by her husband, Johari currently earns about $240 per month. She is now requesting a loan of $550 to purchase additional materials required for making clothes. In the future, she plans to carry a greater variety of materials in order to differentiate her products even further. Johari thanks you for your support!
ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loan.use: To purchase additional materials required for making clothes.

loan.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe se dedica a la crÃ­a de ganado vacuno, cuya producciÃ³n de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). AdemÃ¡s trabaja como agricultor en la producciÃ³n de papa, chuÃ±o y tunta.
Vive. en la comunidad Chojasivi de la Provincia Loa Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado a cuatro horas de la ciudad de La Paz.
Vive junto a su esposa quien le colabora en los quehaceres del ganado y su hogar que consta de 7 hijos.
El crÃ©dito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera y asÃ­ incrementar la producciÃ³n de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
Es el primer crÃ©dito con Impro, la evaluaciÃ³n realizada le califica para otorgarle el prÃ©stamo
texts.en:
Felipe raises cows and sells the milk production to PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche). He also works as a farmer, producing potatoes and also a variety of freeze dried potatoes popular in the region ( chuÃ±o and tunta). He lives in the community of Chojasive of the Los Andes province of the department of La Paz, located four hours from the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife who helps him with the care of the livestock and his home which consists of 7 children. The loan will be used for the purchase of a milk cow, which will increase the milk production and therefore his income. This is the first loan with Impro. The credit evaluation qualifies him to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of livestock.

loan.name: KuÃ±a Kyrey Aty Group

texts.es:
El comitÃ© estÃ¡ compuesto por 16 seÃ±oras trabajadoras de la compaÃ±Ã­a CabaÃ±as de CaacupÃ©, la mayorÃ­a de las integrantes se dedican al cultivo y ventas de plantas para jardÃ­n, son personas antiguas del barrios y todas se ayudan para poder comercializar sus productos. Actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el 8 ciclo del programa de comitÃ© de Mujeres Emprendedoras, y la misma estÃ¡n siendo beneficiada con un crÃ©dito promedio de gs. 540.000 cada integrantes. La seÃ±ora Beatriz presidenta del comitÃ© comenta que el grupo de mujeres estÃ¡n llevando acabo un proyecto que esta teniendo buenos resultados y es la siguiente, llevar a exponer sus productos en la cercanÃ­a de la basÃ­lica de CaacupÃ© y otro grupo lo estÃ¡n haciendo en la ciudad de San Bernardino los fines de semana, los resultados son muy favorable ya que registraron muy buena venta estas Ãºltimas semanas. Cada una de ellas realiza una actividad comercial especÃ­fica que les permite aportar al ingreso familiar. Estas actividades son las siguientes: Beatriz A. - Vivero Elizabeth B. - Despensa Reina A. - Vivero Mirecha C. - Vendedora de ropas Sonia G. - Vivero Estela R. - Despensera Rosita F. Vivero Milca B. - Despensa Ana B. Vivero Jimena A. - Despensa Norma A. Vivero Maria G. - Vivero Leticia H. - Venta de ropas Teodolina E. - Despensa Cynthia A. - Vivero Estela F. - Vivero
Con los prÃ©stamos que le otorgo la FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya las integrantes compraron gran cantidad de semillas, abonos, mangueras, macetas, otras compraron artÃ­culos para la despensa como, azÃºcar, yerba, leche, carne, galleta.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 16 hard-working ladies from the CabaÃ±as de CaacupÃ© company. The majority of them are farmers and own plant nurseries, selling plants for home gardens. They know the neighborhoods well and all of them help each other with product sales. Now the group is in its eighth loan cycle of the Hardworking Women committee, and they would benefit from a loan of gs 540,000 for each member. Mrs. Beatriz is the president of the committee, and she notes that this group of women is finishing a project. They are showing their products around the CaacupÃ© basilica and in the city of San Bernardino on the weekends. The results are very favorable, and the ladies have recorded good sales in recent weeks. Each of them works in a specific field and contributes to her household income. These are: Beatriz A. - Hatchery Elizabeth B. - Grocery Reina A. - Nursery Mirecha C. - Clothing Sales Sonia G. - Nursery Estela R. - Grocery Rosita F. - Nursery Milca B. - Grocery Ana B. - Nursery Jimena A. - Grocery Norma A. - Nursery Maria G. - Nursery Leticia H. - Clothing Sales Teodolina E. - Grocery Cynthia A. - Nursery Estela F. - Nursery With loans from FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya the group members will buy a large quantity of seeds, fertilizer, hoses, and flowerpots. Others will buy supplies for their groceries, such as sugar, tea, milk, meat, and chicken.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy fertilizer, garden plants, and flowerpots. Some ladies will also buy merchandise for their grocery stores, such as sugar, tea, meat, flower, milk, coal, and all types of drinks.

loan.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas se dedica a la crÃ­a de ganado vacuno, cuya producciÃ³n de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). AdemÃ¡s trabaja como agricultor en la producciÃ³n de papa.
Vive. en la comunidad Chojasivi de la Provincia Loa Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado a cuatro horas de la ciudad de La Paz.
Vive junto a su esposa quien le colabora en los quehaceres del ganado y su hogar que constya de 5 hijos.
El crÃ©dito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera y asÃ­ incrementar la producciÃ³n de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
Es el primer crÃ©dito con Impro, la evaluaciÃ³n realizada le califica para otorgarle el prÃ©stamo
texts.en:
Tomas makes a living raising dairy cattle and sells the milk production to PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche). He also works as a farmer growing potatoes. He lives in the community of Chojasivi of the province of Los Andes of the department of La Paz located four hours for the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife who helps with the care of the cattle and his home which includes 5 children. The loan will be used to purchase a dairy cow which will increase the production and therefore increase his income. This is the first loan with Impro. The credit evaluation qualifies him to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of livestock

loan.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania and SELFINA! This is 48-year-old Tatu O M., a widowed mother of six children who is also responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans. Tatu has been running a mama lishe since 2005.
A mama lishe is a local restaurant or cafÃ© in Tanzania that usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long wooden benches. The food is all-local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces.
Working at the business eight hours per day, five days per week, Tatu currently earns about $200 each month. She is now requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase rice, beans, wheat flower, maize flower, soda and drinking water, and in the future plans to expand her business. She thanks you in advance for your support!
ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loan.use: To purchase rice, beans, wheat flower, maize flower, soda and drinking water.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy merchandise such as starch, cooking oil, eggs wood, cheese, etc.

loan.name: Erico

texts.es: El seÃ±or Erico tiene 41 aÃ±os, estÃ¡ casado y tiene 2 hijos, su actividad diaria es la de vender chipas, pan, galletas, pan dulce, etc. en su local propio y en algunas oportunidades en forma ambulante, la elaboraciÃ³n de la misma se encarga su esposa con la ayuda de su hija, quiÃ©n en forma paciente produce una buena cantidad de estos productos . En el oficio esta dedicado desde hace mas de 20 aÃ±os y es muy conocido en la zona porque su calidad de persona y por las delicias de sus chipas y pan caseros. Con los prÃ©stamos que obtuvo de la FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya, lo invirtiÃ³ en la compra de materia prima para la elaboraciÃ³n de chipas y panes, tales como almidÃ³n, queso, aceite vegetal, leÃ±as, harinas, levaduras, entre otros productos, esto le permitiÃ³ tener una buena cantidad de producciÃ³n lo que hace que los costos de producciÃ³n bajen y por ende le genera la posibilidad de bajar el precio de venta de sus producto sin descuidar su utilidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Erico is 41 years old, and is married. He has two children. Erico sells chipas, bread, cookies, sweetbread, etc. from his home and also sometimes as a street vendor. Erico's wife and daughter patiently bake these foods in large quantities. Erico has been working in this business for 20 years, and he's well known in the area for his good character and his delicious chipas and bread. Erico has invested past loans from FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya in prime materials to make chipas and breads, such as starch, cheese, vegetable oil, firewood, flour, and yeast, among others. This has allowed him to produce in large quantities and thereby lower the costs of production. He is then able to lower the price of his products without decreasing his profits.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy merchandise such as cheese, eggs, milk, starch, vegetable oil, flour, yeast, etc.

loan.name: Nelson Franklin

texts.es:
Nelson se dedica a la crÃ­a de ganado vacuno y la producciÃ³n de legumbres, cereales y flores cuya producciÃ³n lo comercializa en uno de los mercados mas populares de la ciudad de La Paz.
Vive. en la comunidad Palomar de la Provincia Murillo del departamento de La Paz ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz.
Vive junto a su madre, la cual posee una carnicerÃ­a en el pueblo con lo que colabora a los ingresos de la familia. Quien por descuido y la falta de atenciÃ³n medica se fue agravando una infecciÃ³n en el ojo, pero con la ayuda de mÃ©dicos cubanos que generalmente hacen su recorrido por las comunidades le hicieron una operaciÃ³n gratuita y ya se encuentra en proceso de recuperaciÃ³n
El crÃ©dito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad y asÃ­ incrementar la producciÃ³n de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
Es el primer crÃ©dito con Impro, la evaluaciÃ³n realizada le califica para otorgarle el prÃ©stamo
texts.en:
Nelson raises dairy cattle and also grows vegetables, grains and flowers which he sells in one of the most popular markets of the city of La Paz. He lives in the Palomar community of the province of Murillo of the department of La Paz, which is located two hours from the city of La Paz. He lives with his mother, who has a meat market in the town which adds to the income of the family. Due to carelessness and lack of medical care, his mother had an eye infection that was getting progressively worse. With the help of Cuban doctors, who travel through the communities, she had a free operation and is in the process of recuperating. The loan will be used for the purchase of a dairy cow of average quality. This will increase the milk production and therefore his income. This is the first loan with Impro. The credit evaluation qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of livestock

loan.name: Evarista

texts.es: Evarista tiene 27 aÃ±os estÃ¡ casada y tiene 1 hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, y zapatos, ademÃ¡s como actividad adicional vende bebidas de todas las marcas. El negocio lo tiene desde hace mÃ¡s de 6 aÃ±os y posee clientela fija a quienes en algunos casos le vende sobre pedido, su proveedor principal de zapatos se encuentra en la zona del mercado 4 en la capital AsunciÃ³n. Comenta Evarista, que hace aproximadamente 3 aÃ±os incorporo a su negocio la venta de bebidas heladas de todas las marcas, esta actividad le permitiÃ³ tener un ingreso adicional muy especialmente los fines de semanas y en temporada de verano, con lo que le permite ayudar a su marido a poder hacer frente a los compromisos de la familia, como asÃ­ tambiÃ©n cubrir los gastos de la educaciÃ³n de sus hijos. Del prÃ©stamo que solicita a la FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya lo invertirÃ¡ una parte en la compra de bebidas, y la otra parte en la compra de ropas y zapatos para la temporada de verano, el capital que recibirÃ¡ le permitirÃ¡ surtir mÃ¡s su negocio y asÃ­ poder evacuar los pedidos de su clientela.
texts.en:
Evarista is 27, married, and has one son. She sells clothing and shoes and in addition she also sells various brands of beverages. She has operated her business for over 6 months and has a steady clientele. She takes orders in some cases. Her principal supplier of shoes is located in the zone of Mercado 4 in the capital Asuncion. Evarista comments that she started up her business selling all types of brands of beverages about three years ago. This allows her some additional income especially on weekends in in the summertime. This allows her to help her husband with family expenses and it also covers her son's education. With the loan she has requested from Fundacion Paraguaya she will invest a portion of it into the purchase of beverages, and the other portion will be used for the purchase of clothing and shoes for the summer season. The capital which she will receive will allow her to keep her business well-stocked so that she can fill the orders of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: For the purchase of merchandise such as clothing for children, ladies, and men, wallets, shoes, and all types of beverages, etc.

loan.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco Antonio vive en la Avenida â€œchacaltaya â€œ de la zona de Achachicala en la ciudad de La Paz.
Vive junto a su hijo y esposa, la cual se dedica al comercio y de esa forma ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
Se dedica transporte urbano como chofer asalariado de taxi en una ruta central de la ciudad.
El crÃ©dito lo destinara en la reparaciÃ³n de la parte electrica del vehiculo que conduce.
Es el primer crÃ©dito con Impro, la evaluaciÃ³n realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crÃ©dito.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio lives in Avenida "Chacaltaya", of the zone of Achachicala in the town of La Paz. He lives with his son and wife who is a merchant and this way helps with the family expenses. He is a taxi driver with the public transportation on one central route of the town. The loan will be spent on repairing the electric part of his vehicle. This is his first loan with Impro, and the evaluation qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Repair a taxi.

loan.name: Gregorio

texts.es: El seÃ±or Gregorio, es propietario de una despensa Ã©l es casado y tiene 2 hijos, su seÃ±ora es modista y tambiÃ©n trabaja en su domicilio, la despensa que poseen esta muy bien surtida y tambiÃ©n lo tienen en su mismo domicilio en la ciudad de San JosÃ©. Comenta el seÃ±or que con los prÃ©stamos que le otorgÃ³ la FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya pudo surtir de gran cantidad de productos de rotaciÃ³n rÃ¡pida, como ser azÃºcar, yerba, carne vacuna, pollo, aceite, fideo, arroz entre otros productos de consumo diario, esto genero mÃ¡s atracciÃ³n a los clientes potenciales por lo bien surtido que esta su negocio. Su objetivo a corto plazo y es la comprar materia prima para la elaboraciÃ³n de chipas y venderlo en su despensa, asÃ­ tambiÃ©n desea incorporar la venta de helados y comidas rÃ¡pidas, ya que en aÃ±os anteriores en Ã©poca de verano ya experimento con estos productos y le fue muy bien, entre las comidas a ofertar son hamburguesas, empanadas, pollo, milanesas, etc.
texts.en:
Gregorio owns a grocery store. He is married with 2 children; his wife is a dressmaker and both work out of their home. Their well-stocked grocery is in their home in the city of San JosÃ©. Gregorio tells us that the loans he has received from FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya have allowed him to buy high turn-over products in bulk, such as sugar, tea, beef, chicken, oil, noodles, rice among other daily foods which made the store more attractive to potential customers given that it is so well stocked. His short-term goal is to buy the raw materials to make chips to sell in his store; he would also like to begin selling ice cream and fast-foods as he has experimented with these in previous Summers and found that they sold well. He plans to offer food as well, such as hamburgers, empanadas, chicken, milanesas (breaded beef), etc.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy merchandise such as sugar, tea, milk, cookies, a variety of drinks, etc.

loan.name: Juan Ernesto

texts.es:
Juan se dedica a la crÃ­a de ganado vacuno y la producciÃ³n de legumbres cuya producciÃ³n lo comercializa en uno de los mercados mas populares de la ciudad de La Paz.
Vive. en la comunidad Palomar de la Provincia Murillo del departamento de La Paz ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz.
Vive junto a su esposa, la cual colabora en los trabajos del hogar .
El crÃ©dito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada y asÃ­ incrementar la producciÃ³n de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
Es el segundo crÃ©dito con Impro, la evaluaciÃ³n realizada le califica para otorgarle el prÃ©stamo
texts.en:
Juan is dedicated to raise cattle and the production of vegetables which he sells at one of the most popular markets of the city of La Paz. He lives in the Palomar community of the Murillo province of the La Paz department. It is located 2 hours from the city of La Paz. Juan lives with his wife who collaborates with the house chores.

The loan will be used to buy a better breed milk cow and in that way increase the milk production as well as his earnings. It is their second loan with Impro. The evaluation made qualifies him for the loan.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying cattle

loan.name: Hery

texts.es: El seÃ±or Hery tiene 28 aÃ±os, estÃ¡ casado y tiene 2 hijos, su negocio estÃ¡ ubicado en una zona de mucha concurrencia al costado de la ruta 2 a la altura del Km. 52, comenta que los conocimientos de como manejar una casa de repuestos lo adquiriÃ³ de su padre y hace mÃ¡s de 6 aÃ±os su padre le cediÃ³ el negocio quedÃ¡ndose como propietario. Al inicio fue difÃ­cil porque los clientes estaban acostumbrados a tratar con su PapÃ¡, pero a medida iban conociÃ©ndole empezaron a tenerles confianza e inclusive les recomendaban a otros clientes para que compren del negocio. Su principal logro dice ser el hecho de haber mantenido su clientela y haber dotado de mÃ¡s repuestos y esto facilitÃ³ evacuar los pedidos de los clientes mas exigentes en tiempo y forma. Con los prÃ©stamos que le otorgÃ³ La FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya pudo comprar repuestos como ser ruedas, faros, cables, casco, bujÃ­as, filtros, aceites, etc.
texts.en:
Hery is 28 years old. He is married and has 2 children. His business is located at a very highly visited area next to route 2, Km. 52. He learned the business of how to manage a spare parts shop from him father. Six years ago, he father left him the shop being Hery the current owner. It was hard at the begining because customers we used to deal with his father, but after meeting him they began to trust him and even to recommend his business to other customers. Its main achievement has been to have been able to maintain the shop's clientele and to expand the business into more spare part items which enabled him to satisfy all this customers' requests in time and form. With these loan granted by the FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya he was able to purchase spare parts, such as wheel, headlights, cables, helmets, filters, oil, pistons, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Para la compra de accesorios tales como faros, casco, aceite, caÃ±o de escape, ruedas, filtros, etc.

loan.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro se dedica a la crÃ­a de ganado vacuno, cuya producciÃ³n de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). AdemÃ¡s trabaja como albaÃ±il en la ciudad de El Alto.
Vive. en la comunidad Chojasivi de la Provincia Loa Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado a cuatro horas de la ciudad de La Paz.
Vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos.
El crÃ©dito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera y asÃ­ incrementar la producciÃ³n de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
Es el primer crÃ©dito con Impro, la evaluaciÃ³n realizada le califica para otorgarle el prÃ©stamo
texts.en:
Pedro is dedicated to raise cattle. His milk production is sold to PIL Andina (Milk Industrialization Plant). He also works as a bricklayer in the city of El Alto. He lives in the Chojasivi community of the Loa Andes province of the La Paz department located 4 hours from the capital city of La Paz. He lives with his wife and four children.

The loan will be used to buy a milk cow and increase the milk production and his earnings as well. It is his first loan with Impro and the evaluation done qualifies him to receive the loan.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying cattle

loan.name: Rudy Alberto

texts.es:
Rudy se dedica a la crÃ­a de ganado vacuno y la siembra de legumbres, cereales y flores cuya producciÃ³n lo comercializa en uno de los mercados mas populares de la ciudad de La Paz.
Vive en la comunidad Palomar de la Provincia Murillo del departamento de La Paz ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz.
Vive junto a su madre, la cual colabora en los trabajos del hogar y la agricultura.
El crÃ©dito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera de de mediana calidad y asÃ­ incrementar la producciÃ³n de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
Es el primer crÃ©dito con Impro, la evaluaciÃ³n realizada le califica para otorgarle el prÃ©stamo
texts.en:
Rudy is dedicated to raise cattle, planting vegetables, cereals, and flowers which are sold in one of the most popular markets of the city of La Paz. He lives in the Paloma r community of the Murillo province of the La Paz department which is located 2 hours from the capital city of La Paz.

He lives with his mom who helps with the household chores and with the agriculture. The loan will be used to buy a milk cow of medium quality and increase the production of milk as well as their earnings. It is their first credit with Impro. The evaluation conducted qualifies him for the loan.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying cattle

loan.name: JosÃ©

texts.es: El seÃ±or JosÃ©, tiene 58 aÃ±os, estÃ¡ casado y tiene 4 hijos, posee una despensa en su domicilio, el negocio lo habilitÃ³ hace mÃ¡s de 25 aÃ±os y es muy conocida su despensa en el barrio, ya que gracias a los prÃ©stamos que le otorgÃ³ la FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya pudo surtir bien su negocio. Tiene pensado para este verano ampliar su despensa ya que nÃ³ estÃ¡ pudiendo exhibir todas las mercaderÃ­as que tiene en stock, por el espacio muy reducido con que cuenta actualmente dentro de la despensa. Don JosÃ©, dice que es un luchador por lo sacrificado que es Ã©ste rubro porque uno trabaja de Lunes a Lunes y no se tiene fin de semana, a parte la atenciÃ³n se inicia desde las 05:00 hs. de la maÃ±ana, pero se siente muy contento porque maneja su propio negocio y con esto mantiene los gastos de su familia y tambiÃ©n le permite dar una buena educaciÃ³n a sus hijos. Sus principales clientes son las personas que trabajan en oficinas de la zona, como asÃ­ tambiÃ©n los chiperos y obreros de la fÃ¡brica de cerÃ¡micas del barrio a quiÃ©nes tambiÃ©n les provee de los servicio de comidas y desayunos.
texts.en:
JosÃ© is 58, married, and has 4 children. He owns a grocery store, which he runs from his home. He opened the business 25 years ago and his store is very well known in the neighbourhood, as he has been able to keep his store well stocked thanks to loans from FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya. He plans to expand his store this summer as he is not able to display all the merchandise he has in stock, given the limited space in the store as it is now. JosÃ© tells us he is a fighter who has sacrificed much working 7 days a week and never having a weekend off. He opens at 5 A.M. but he has very happy to be working for himself and thanks to his business he is able to pay the household expenses as well as give his children a good education. His customers are mostly people who work in local offices, as well as chiperos (street vendors who sell a typical cheese bun) and factory workers from the local ceramics factory to whom he provides meals and breakfast.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy meat, sugar, milk, flour, beer, wine, cheese, eggs, starch, vegetable oil, etc.

loan.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo se dedica a la crÃ­a de ganado vacuno, cuya producciÃ³n de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). AdemÃ¡s trabaja como albaÃ±il en la poblaciÃ³n.
Vive. en la comunidad Chojasivi de la Provincia Loa Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado a cuatro horas de la ciudad de La Paz.
Vive junto a sus ocho hijos de los cuales los dos mayores le ayudan en su trabajo y asÃ­ colaboran con el sustento de la familia.
El crÃ©dito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera, de mediana calidad y asÃ­ incrementar la producciÃ³n de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
Es el primer crÃ©dito con Impro, la evaluaciÃ³n realizada le califica para otorgarle el prÃ©stamo
texts.en:
Eduardo is dedicated to raise cattle. His milk production is sold to PIL Andina (Milk Industrialization Plant). He lives in the Chojasivi community of the Loa Andes province in the La Paz department which is located four hours from the capital city of La Paz.

He lives with his eight children which two of them help him with work and collaborate with sustenance of the family. The loan will be used to buy a milk cow of medium quality and increase the production of milk as well as their earnings. It is their first credit with Impro. The evaluation conducted qualifies him for the loan.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying cattle

loan.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia, es una seÃ±ora joven casada y no tiene hijos aÃºn, ella es propietaria de un negocio que se dedica a la venta de plantas, abonos, macetas, entre otros productos para el jardÃ­n, su negocio esta ubicado en uno de los barrios de CaacupÃ©. Lucia comenta, que aparte de la venta de plantas tambiÃ©n vende ropas, para damas, caballero y niÃ±os, asÃ­ tambiÃ©n ocasionalmente productos de platerÃ­a como cadenillas, pulseras y anillos. Con el prÃ©stamo que le otorgarÃ¡ la FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya pudra comprar gran cantidad de plantas abonos, semillas y accesorios como mangueras, bolsas, maceta, y una parte lo invertirÃ¡ en la compra de joyas de platas entre otros artÃ­culos Sus principales cliente son los visitantes de la villa serrana, y su gran movimiento lo registra los fines de semana, el negocio lo heredÃ³ de sus padres y afirma que se siente muy satisfecha por el hecho de que tiene la responsabilidad de continuar la microempresa que sus padres le dejo. Tiene pensado a corto plazo ampliar su casa y ver la forma de abrir una mercerÃ­a dÃ³nde pueda exponer las ropas a ser ofertada como si tambiÃ©n las joyas de plata y asÃ­ ofrecerle mayor comodidad a sus clientes potenciales.
texts.en:
Lucia is a young married woman who does not yet have children. She owns a business where she sells plants, fertilizer, pots, as well as other gardening products. Her store is in a suburb of CaacupÃ©. Lucia tells us that in addition to selling plants, she also sells clothing for ladies, men, and children as well as silver chains, bracelets, and rings from time to time. With the loan which she will receive from FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya she will be able to buy a large number of plants, fertilizer, seeds and accessories such as hoses and fittings, bags and pots. She will also invest part of the loan in the purchase of silver jewelry among others. Her clients are mainly visitors to the mountain village and her sales peak on weekends. She inherited the business from her parents and is very satisfied that she has been able to continue the business which her parents left her. Her short-term goal is to expand her home and find a way to open a clothing store to display clothing for sale as well as silver jewelry and thus make her potential clients more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase seeds, plants, fertilizers, pots, etc.

loan.name: Luisa

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Luisa tiene 26 aÃ±os, estÃ¡ casada y tiene 2 hijo. Ella posee una pequeÃ±a fabrica de chipas y la misma esta dedicada hace mas de 9 aÃ±os, ademÃ¡s de esta actividad tambiÃ©n vende en su domicilio artÃ­culos de mercerÃ­a, tambiÃ©n ropa especialmente para dama, etc. Con estas actividades consigue generar ingresos, y asÃ­ aportar para cubrir los gastos de la familia, por supuesto se siente muy satisfecho en ayudarle a su marido para hacer frente a los compromisos familiares. Los prÃ©stamos obtenidos de la FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya, lo invirtiÃ³ en la compra de mercaderÃ­as en cantidad como ser almidÃ³n, quesos, leÃ±as, aceites entre otros productos. El objetivo de la seÃ±ora Luisa es la instar frente a su domicilio un puesto de venta de chipas durante esta temporada de festividades de la virgen de CaacupÃ©, ya que en aÃ±os anteriores le fue muy bien y logro registrar muy buena venta de sus productos.
texts.en:
Luisa is 26 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She has owned a small chipa (local cheese cakes) factory for more than 9 years. She also sells notions items and clothes, especially bed sheets, etc. With all these activities she manages to make some income and cover her family expenses. She is very proud of being able to help her husband to fulfill the family obligations. She used the previous loans obtained from the FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya to purchase supplies such as starch, cheese, firewood and oils among other products. Luisaâ€™s purpose this time is to open a shop in front of the home to sell chipa during the festivities for the CaacupÃ© Virgin, as business was very successful on previous years and she managed to sale a large amount of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase supplies such as starch, milk, cheese, eggs, vegetal oil, firewood, etc.

loan.name: Marcos

texts.es: Marcos, tiene 25 aÃ±os, estÃ¡ casado y tiene 1 hijo, en la actividad de venta de materia prima para elaborar chipas se dedica hace mÃ¡s de 5 aÃ±os, y el negocio lo heredo de sus padres y comenta que gracias a Ã©ste trabajo, Ã©l y su seÃ±ora pueden darle una buena educaciÃ³n a sus hijos y con contar con su casa propia. Sus principales clientes son las chaperÃ­as de la zona quiÃ©nes en forma diaria compran los productos que ellos venden como ser almidÃ³n, queso, aceite vegetal, entre otros. El barrio San Francisco de CaacupÃ© es una zona eminentemente productora de chipas, por lo que su movimiento de ventas es muy bueno especialmente en los dÃ­as prÃ³ximos al fin de semana. En los meses de Diciembre fecha de la Virgen de CaacupÃ© el movimiento de producciÃ³n de chipas es incesante, ya que la venta es muy buena en esa Ã©poca y genera un dinamismo en el barrio, casi en todas las casas elaboran chipas para venderlas. Con el prÃ©stamo que obtendrÃ¡ de la FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya podrÃ¡ comprar, almidÃ³n, queso, maÃ­z, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Marcos is 25 years old. He is married and has a son. He has been working selling raw material to make chipa (local cheese cakes) for more than 5 years, business he inherited from his parents, and he says that thanks to this job, him and his wife are able to provide his son with a good education and pay for their own house. Their main clients are the local chipa stores who buy their products every day. They sell starch, cheese, vegetal oil, and others. The San Francisco de CaacupÃ© neighborhood is a mainly chipa producer area, for which sales there are very successful especially at the beginning of the weekend. In December during the CaacupÃ© Vigin festivities, chipa production is nonstop, and sales are very good and the neighborhood receives a lot of visitors, so most homes makes chipa. With the loan obtained from the FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya Marcos will be able to purchase starch, cheese, corn, and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase raw material such as milk, cheese eggs, milk, starch, oil, sugar, sodas, flour, etc.

loan.use: Purchase raw material such as starch, oil, eggs, firewood, cheese, etc.

loan.name: Miguel

texts.es: El seÃ±or Miguel tiene 36 aÃ±os, estÃ¡ casado y tiene 2 hijos, su actividad diaria es la de atender su pequeÃ±o consultorio de masajes terapÃ©utico y rehabilitaciÃ³n, la misma lo tiene en su mismo domicilio, en uno de los barrios mas popular de la ciudad de CaacupÃ©. Se dedica a esta actividad hace ya mÃ¡s de 10 aÃ±os, y gracias a este trabajo puede mantener a su familia y cubrir los gastos propios diarios y la educaciÃ³n de sus hijos. Con este prÃ©stamo el podrÃ¡ adquirir una camilla. Su esposa en algunos casos tambiÃ©n le ayuda debido a que hay dÃ­a dÃ³nde tienen gran cantidad de clientelas quiÃ©nes solicitan turno en forma anticipada, gran porcentaje de sus clientelas son jugadores de futbol y siguen con Ã©l su proceso de recuperaciÃ³n y rehabilitaciÃ³n, otra cantidad importante son los niÃ±os quienes frecuentemente se presenta por algunas dificultades Ã³seas.
texts.en:
Mr. Miguel is 36-years old, married with 2 children, and operates a therapeutic massage clinic out of his house in a well-known neighborhood in CaacupÃ© city. He has owned his business for more than 10 years, and it allows him to cover his familyâ€™s basic needs and pay for his childrenâ€™s schooling. With this loan he will be able to buy a massage table. His wife sometimes works with him on the days he has more clients than he can handle. Most of his clients are soccer players undergoing rehabilitation; he also treats a number of children who suffer from medical conditions affecting their bones.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of massage table for rehabilitation clinic

loan.name: RamÃ³n

texts.es: El seÃ±or RamÃ³n tiene 26 aÃ±os, esta casado y tiene 1 hijo, posee una despensa anexo mercerÃ­a, se inicio en esta actividad hace mas de 7 aÃ±os, como todo inicio fue difÃ­cil ya que empezÃ³ con un pequeÃ±o capital, producto de unos prÃ©stamos que le realizo unos parientes con ese capital se inicio y actualmente su despensa lo tiene en un barrio muy populoso de la ciudad de CaacupÃ©. Los prÃ©stamos que le otorgo la FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya pudo surtir su negocio con la compra de mercaderÃ­as y en esta ocasiÃ³n desea volver a aumentar su stock de mercaderÃ­as ya que la demanda aumenta en las Ã©pocas de fin de aÃ±o. Entre las mercaderÃ­as que desea adquirir estÃ¡n pan, azÃºcar, leche, carne, carbÃ³n, gaseosas, fideos, y tambiÃ©n artÃ­culos de mercerÃ­a como ser ropas, productos de bellezas, Ãºtiles escolares entre otros. Su principal logro dice ser el hecho de sacrificarse y haber perseverado en su objetivo de contar con un negocio propio que le permite ayudar y mantener los gastos de la familia.
texts.en:
RamÃ³n is 26-years old, married with 1 son, and owns a storeroom attached to a general store that he set up more than 7 years ago. Like many small businesses, it was difficult to start. With a little money borrowed from relatives, he began his storeroom in a densely populated neighborhood in CaacupÃ© city. Loans from FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya have enabled RamÃ³n to purchase merchandise for his store. To meet the heightened demand at the end of the year, he would like to restock his inventory with bread, sugar, milk, meat, coal, sodas, pasta, and other items such as clothes, beauty products, and school supplies. His greatest achievement has been persevering and making the sacrifices necessary for his business, which allows him to provide for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of merchandise for store (milk, bread, tea, cheese, eggs, cornstarch, oil, flour, sugar, soda, etc.)

loan.name: Rosalino

texts.es:
El seÃ±or Rosalino tiene 33 aÃ±os, estÃ¡ casado y tiene 2 hijos, el se dedica a la actividad de venta y plantaciÃ³n de flores para jardÃ­n, esta en el oficio hace mas de 17 aÃ±os, Actualmente tiene mucho trabajo porque la ciudad de CaacupÃ© recibe gran cantidad de visitantes y por su puesto se convierte en potenciales clientes, las plantas de mayor movimiento de ventas son las flores de todo tipo, y son las que requieren mayor atenciÃ³n y cuidado, especialmente en su etapa de florecimiento.
Este prÃ©stamo que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de mÃ¡s semillas, plantas, abonos, mangueras, etc. Tiene pensado invertir en la ampliaciÃ³n del negocio y para el efecto ampliara el techo llamado media sombra ya que aun posee un espacio suficiente, de esta forma tendrÃ¡ mas metros cuadrados para cultivar rosas, clavel y otras flores, que son las que requieren de un cuidado muy especial y son las de mayor movimiento de ventas.
texts.en:
Rosalino is 33 years old, married and has two children. He dedicates himself to selling garden plants, an occupation he has carried out for more than 17 years. Currently, he has a great deal of work because the city of CaacupÃ© experiences many visitors, which translates into potential customers. The plants that he sells the most of are all types of flowering varieties, which are the ones that require the most care -- especially when they are in bloom. This loan he requests is to invest into purchasing seeds, plants, fertilizers, hoses, etc. He is thinking about investing in expanding his business, including his shade roof. Even though he has plenty of room, this will allow him more square meters in which to grow his roses, carnations and other flowers, which are the ones that require special care and sell the most.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase seeds, plants, fertilizers, hoses, etc.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy toys and fireworks

loan.name: Karina Virginia

texts.es: La seÃ±orita Karina es socia del Banco Comunal â€œMujeres de Villa del Lago IIâ€ del distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 25 aÃ±os de edad, es soltera sin hijos. Karina con el primer prÃ©stamo de S/ 500 comprÃ³ productos de belleza de unique para vender. Tiene casi 4 aÃ±o trabajando con el banco. Nos cuenta que estudia nutriciÃ³n en la universidad. Con este prÃ©stamo de S/.2500 que pagarÃ¡ en 4 cuotas comprarÃ¡ mayor cantidad de productos de belleza de Unique. Karina desea continuar trabajando para llegar a ser directora de su empresa de productos de belleza y montar un restaurante de comida andina nutritiva.
texts.en:
SeÃ±orita Karina is a member of the community bank â€œWomen from the Village on the Lake IIâ€ from the neighbourhood Puno, in Puno Province, in the Department of Puno. She is 25 years old and is single with no children. With her first loan of S/500, Karina purchased Unique beauty products to sell. She has worked with the bank for almost 4 years. She tells us that she studies nutrition in the university. With this loan of S/.2500 that she would repay in 4 installments, she would buy a larger quantity of Unique beauty products. Karina wants to continue working in order to become a director of her business of beauty products and to start a restaurant of nutritious Andean food.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy beauty products

loan.name: Keyttel Januaria

texts.es:
La microempresaria Keyttel Januaria C. M. tiene 26 aÃ±os de edad, es casada con una hija menor de edad, es originaria de esta ciudad de Bluefields y se dedica desde hace mÃ¡s de 4 aÃ±os a la venta de prendas de oro laminado y con dicho negocio aporta a los gastos del hogar.
La seÃ±ora C. es vendedora ambulante y visita desde oficinas privadas y estatales hasta casas particulares ofreciendo sus productos los cuales los vende con facilidades de pagos de dos y tres cuotas por cada producto.
Es de mencionar que ademÃ¡s de cadenas, pulseras y anillos tambiÃ©n oferta chapas y cosmÃ©ticos tales como perfumes, desodorantes, pinturas de labios entre otros. Sin embargo para poder comprar sus productos y venderlos con facilidades de pago requiere el financiamiento para comprar los siguientes productos:
8 anillos de oro laminado de hombres a US$ 15 dÃ³lares cada uno, 5 cadenas de oro laminado de hombre a US$ 30 dÃ³lares cada una, 3 pulseras de oro laminado de hombres a US$ 25 dÃ³lares cada una, 8 anillos de oro laminado de mujeres a US$ 10 dÃ³lares cada uno y 3 cadenas de oro laminado de mujeres a US$ 25 dÃ³lares cada una.
texts.en:
The microentrepreneur Keyttel Januaria C. M. Is 26 years old, married and with a young daughter who is a minor. She is from the city of Bluefields and she has been dedicated to sell laminated gold jewelry for more than 4 years. With this business, she is able to contribute to the household expenses. Mrs. C. is a street vendor and visits private and state offices as well as particular households offering her products which she sells offering payment installments of two or three installments for each product. It's good to mention also that besides chains, bracelets, and ringsm she also offers badges and cosmetics like perfumes, deodorants, and lipsticks among others. However, to be able to buy her products and sell them with the facility of the payment installments, she requires financing to buy the following products: 8 men laminated gold rings at $15 dollars each 5 men laminated gold chains at $30 dollars each 3 men laminated gold bracelets at $25 dollars each 8 women laminated gold rings at $10 dollars each and 3 women laminated gold chains at $25 dollars each

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying jewelry to sell

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Eveling Scarlet

texts.es:
La SeÃ±ora Evelyn Scarlet G. tiene la edad de 33 aÃ±os, su estado civil es soltera, DoÃ±a Evelyn tiene 2 hijos con las siguientes edades su hijo menor de 12 aÃ±os cursa el 4 grado de primaria y su hijo mayor de 14 aÃ±os cursa el 3 aÃ±o de secundaria, sus propÃ³sitos son de diversificar su negocio para de cualquier forma mantenerlo activo sus sueÃ±os son de tener otros negocios como lo es una pulperÃ­a y una tienda de ropa en general para asÃ­ obtener mas ingresos para su familia en sus deseos esta darle una mejor preparaciÃ³n a sus hijos para darle un mejor futuro y estos no dependan de otras personas y puedan valerse por si mismos.
La actividad econÃ³mica la que se dedica es el alquiler de videos juegos, la ubicaciÃ³n de su negocio es en su casa de habitaciÃ³n, el tiempo que tiene de poseer el negocio es de 4 aÃ±os, al principio inicio con mercaderÃ­a en general por lo que necesitaba sacar adelante a su familia por lo que decide actualmente ha ampliado un poco y decide instalar un negocio de videos juegos y es asÃ­ como se decide salir adelante con este negocio y que tiene que proporcionar la manutenciÃ³n de sus hijos, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que ya que tiene realizar la compras de los diferentes productos como discos.
texts.en:
Evelyn Scarlet G. is 33 years old. She is single and has 2 children, a 12 year old boy who is in 4th grade in primary school and a 14 year old boy that is in 3th year in secondary school. Her goal is to diversify her business to keep it active. Her dream is to open other businesses such as a grocery store or a general clothes store to generate a larger income for her family. She would like to provide her children with a better education and a better future so they don't have to depend on other people and they can be independent. Her main activity is to sell video games at home. She's been on this business for 4 years. At first, she started selling products in general but as she needed to generate more income to support her family she decided to focus on a specific business and so she opened a video game store. She will use this financing for work capital as she needs to purchase different products, such as CDs or disks.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Work capital

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La SeÃ±ora de nombre Maria de los Ãngeles U. SolÃ­s tiene la edad 53 aÃ±os, su estado civil es casada, DoÃ±a Maria tiene 2 hijos de los cuales sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor 33 aÃ±os que cursa el 4 aÃ±o de secundaria y asiste a clases por la noches ya que el trabaja y su hijo menor de 14 aÃ±os y cursa el 5 grado de primaria, su compaÃ±ero de vida labora es comerciante y tiene un negocio propio donde vende los productos de gas butano y licorerÃ­a, sus propÃ³sitos son de sacar adelante a su hijo para que pueda de ser un buen provecho para el dÃ­a de maÃ±ana sus deseos son tener mas vida para terminar la tarea de educar a sus hijos y no sean personas irresponsables y puedan ser provechosas para la sociedad y sus sueÃ±os proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda para que esta permanezca bonita para sus hijos y estos puedan vivir cÃ³modamente y que obtengan las mejores condiciones de vida.
La actividad econÃ³mica a la que se dedica es una pulperÃ­a donde vende los productos como: golosinas, gaseosas, refrescos naturales y pan, la ubicaciÃ³n de su negocio es en su casa de habitaciÃ³n en chichigalpa, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 5 aÃ±os, ella inicia este negocio por la necesidad de obtener un trabajo y decide establecer un pequeÃ±o negocio por lo que necesitaba mantener a su familia y salir adelante y decide invertir en golosinas de lo que recibiÃ³ una excelente repuesta de los clientes que en su mayorÃ­a eran niÃ±os y asÃ­ es como decide empezar un medio de trabajo para lograr que este le genere ganancias a su familia, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra de sus productos y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y seguir proporcionando ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria de los Ãngeles U. SolÃ­s is 53 years old. She is married and has 2 children. The older one is 33 years old and heâ€™s attending his 4th year at night secondary school as he works during the day. She has another boy, a 14 year old attending his 5th year in primary school. Her husband is a business man. He owns a liquor store and he also sells butane gas. Her purpose is to provide his younger son with a good education so he can take advantage of that in the future. Her wish is to have a longer life, to educate his children to be responsible and useful to society. She also wants to make home improvements so their children can have a nice house to live in, a house where they can feel comfortable and to have better living conditions. She owns a grocery shop at home where she sells products such as, candy, sodas, natural beverages and bread. The shop is located in the city of Chichigalpa. She's had this business for 5 years. She opened this business because she needed a job. She stated selling candy in a small shop to support her family. As the business stated to improve and she became popular among her customers, mostly children, she decided to expand the business to generate a better income. Financing will be used for work capital as she needs to purchase more products to satisfy her customer's demand.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Work capital

loan.name: Mrs. Sa Mai Sor Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank group, which consists of seventeen people is located in Phum Thmey village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Sa Mai S. is the group president who has been selected by the members. She is a housewife who cooks delicious foods for her family. Her husband, Mr. Deam Von, is a construction worker who makes a small income that supports the family. They have six children, four of whom are working in a garment factory, while the others attend the local school. Although Mrs. Sa Mai S.â€™s family members work hard, they still live in an old house that is in poor condition. In order to improve these conditions, Mrs. Sa Mai S. decided to ask for a loan which along with her savings, will allow her to build a new house for the family.
Village bank group loans consist mainly of end-of-term loans. Five members have had end-of-term loans and the rest have had monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMKâ€™s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodiaâ€™s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMKâ€™s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: To build a new house for the family.

loan.name: Mrs. Dalin Pich Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people who live in Phum Thmey village in Kampong Chhnang province have formed a village bank group and are requesting a loan for a variety of purposes. Mrs. Dalin P. is the village bank group president. She is a farmer who earns a small rice farming revenue which cannot support the famiL. very well. Her husband, Mr. Hem Sambo, is an immigrant worker in Korea, working in a garment factory. Mrs. Dalin P. is 32 years old and the mother of five children, four are attending the local school while the youngest one is two years old. Although Mrs. Dalin P.'s famiL. members work hard, they still do not have enough money to build a fence for her house. Mrs. Dalin P. decided to ask for a loan to buy wood to build the fence for her house.
This is a village bank group loan consisting of mainL. end-of-term loans. Thirteen members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthL. payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMKâ€™s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodiaâ€™s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financialL. able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMKâ€™s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of onL. 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% at Kiva.

loan.use: To buy wood to build a fence for her house.

loan.name: Pich

texts.en:
Pich D. is a single, 28-year-old resident of Kompong Tom Province. He currently lives with his elderly mother who is a rice farmer. In addition, he lives with two other relatives who work as dealers at a casino; by doing so, they earn approximately $100 per month to help cover some of the family's living expenses.

Pich, meanwhile, is a blacksmith. Specifically, he provides services to his customers by making windows, doors, and other such structures for houses. He notes that he started his business more than eight years ago, and that he has gained a great deal of experience over that time span. To make it easier on his family members for transportation purposes, Pich is now applying for a loan in order to purchase a motorcycle (so that his family members can get where they need to go faster).

loan.use: To help his family members get around town by purchasing a motorcycle

loan.name: Porng

texts.en:
Porng S. is 38 years old and the mother of six children, who are all single and attending school. She has been growing rice since 1995 to earn a living. She produces rice crops twice a year, once during the dry season and once during the rainy season. Her husband is a local fisherman that relies on catching fish in the general area. He currently earns an average of $4 per day. The family lives in Kompong Tom Province.

Porng S. is requesting a loan to buy a cow to help her plow her farmland and provide her family with an additional asset.

loan.use: Buy a cow

loan.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO " LAS ROSAS" ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÃ‘ORA NATALI Y POR 12 MIEMBROS, ENTRE EL GRUPO EXISTE UN PARENTESCO FAMILIAR ENTRE LA SEÃ‘ORA PAULA Y BERNARDA LAS CUALES SON HERMANAS, AMBAS DECLARAN TENER INGRESOS TOTALMENTE INDEPENDIENTES UNA D. LA OTRA. LOS SOCIOS (AS) SE DEDICAN A DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES COMO AL SERVICIO D. LIMPIEZA, MENSAJERÃA, TRABAJOS EN CERÃMICA, AL TRANSPORTE PUBLICO, A LA COMERCIALIZACIÃ“N D. LECHE, COMIDA Y COSMÃ‰TICOS, ACTIVIDADES EN LAS CUALES EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA PERO LOS SOCIOS (AS) TIENEN EXPERIENCIA EN EL TRABAJO Y SABEN COMO SACAR A FLOTE SUS NEGOCIOS Y SUS TRABAJOS CON TRANQUILIDAD. EN GENERAL EL DESTINO DEL CRÃ‰DITO ES PARA EL INCREMENTO D. SUS INSUMOS Y AL MEJORAMIENTO D. SUS FUENTES D. TRABAJO PARA SER MAS EFICIENTES Y AHORRAR TIEMPO PARA DEDICARSE A SU FAMILIA. LOS SOCIOS (AS) TIENE EXPERIENCIA EN GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS POR LO QUE SABEN ADMINISTRAR LOS FONDOS OTORGADOS CON RESPONSABILIDAD Y CON MIRAS A UN OBJETIVO COMÃšN QUE ES EL D. MEJOR SU CALIDAD D. VIDA Y LA D. SUS FAMILIAS.
texts.en:
The Las Rosas group is represented by Natali and 12 other members, two of whom are related: Paula and Bernarda who are sisters. Both say that their incomes are totally independent of one another. The members operate various business such as cleaning services; messaging services; ceramic works; public transportation services; and milk, food and cosmetics sales. All of their businesses face stiff competition but the members are experienced and know how to manage their businesses and work with equanimity. Generally, the loan will be used to buy basic supplies, make the businesses more productive and allow the members to spend the time they save with their families. The members have experience with cooperatives so they know how to responsibly manage the funds allocated to them. Their common objective is to improve their lives and the lives of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Operations.

loan.name: Virgen De UrkupiÃ±a Group

texts.es: LAS SOCIAS DEL BANCO COMUNAL "VIRGEN D. URKUPIÃ‘A" SE ORGANIZARON BAJO LA DIRECCIÃ“N D. SU PRESIDENTA LA SEÃ‘ORA JAHANA VANESSA PARA ACCEDER AL FINANCIAMIENTO QUE LES OTORGA AGROCAPITAL CON LA FINALIDAD D. RESPALDAR EL CRECIMIENTO D. LAS ACTIVIDADES QUE DESARROLLAN DENTRO D. LA COMERCIALIZACIÃ“N D. PRODUCTOS METALÃšRGICAS, COMIDA, COSMÃ‰TICOS Y ALGUNO D. LOS SOCIOS DESEA INDEPENDIZARSE Y EMPEZAR UN NUEVO NEGOCIO SIENDO SU ACTIVIDAD ACTUAL CUIDADOR D. VIÃ‘EDOS Y EMPLEADAS DOMESTICAS TODO CON EL AFÃN D. BUSCAR NUEVAS OPORTUNIDADES D. MEJOR SU CALIDAD D. VIDA Y LA D. SUS FAMILIAS, DENTRO DEL GRUPO EXISTEN SOCIAS QUE NO TIENE EXPERIENCIA EN GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS PERO BAJO LA TUTELA Y RESPONSABILIDAD D. SUS COMPAÃ‘ERAS D. GRUPO QUIENES ESTÃN DISPUESTAS A RESPONDER POR LAS NUEVAS INTEGRANTES.
texts.en:
The Virgen D. Urkupina community bank was organized under the direction of its president, Jahana Vanessa, to gain access to Agrocapital financing with the goal of backing the growth of its members' businesses. The members operate businesses such as metalurgical product sales; food sales; and cosmetics sales. Some of the members who now work tending vineyards or as domestics, want to strike out on their own and start new businesses, all with the hope of looking for new opportunities to improve their lives and the lives of their families. There are some in the group who have never belonged to a cooperative before but they have the support and guidance of their co-members who are willing to answer for them.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Operating capital.

loan.name: Unidas San Geronimo Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "UNIDAS SAN GERNIMO" ESTÃN REPRESENTADAS POR LA SEÃ‘ORA YESICA Y CONFORMADA POR 12 INTEGRANTES D. LOS CUALES EXISTE UN PARENTESCO FAMILIAR ENTRE LA SEÃ‘ORA NELLY QUIEN ES MADRE D. RINA PERO AMBAS TIENEN INGRESOS TOTALMENTE INDEPENDIENTES. LOS SOCIOS (AS) SE DEDICAN A DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES COMO A LA EDUCACIÃ“N URBANA, AL SERVICIO DOMESTICO, ELABORACIÃ“N D. MASITAS, A LA VENTA D. COMIDA, Y JUGOS FRUTALES. EL DESTINO DEL FINANCIAMIENTO ES PARA EL INCREMENTO D. INSUMOS Y MATERIALES D. TRABAJO Y PARA COMENZAR CON UN NEGOCIO PROPIO PARA PODER TENER UNA ALTERNATIVA MAS PARA SUS INGRESOS. LOS SOCIOS (AS) DEL GRUPO CUENTAN CON EXPERIENCIA EN GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS YA QUE CURSAN SU SEGUNDO CICLO DEMOSTRANDO HONESTIDAD Y RESPONSABILIDAD EN SUS ANTERIORES PAGOS.
texts.en:
The Unidas San Geronimo ['San Geronimo Unit"] group is represented by Yesica and is maD. up of 12 members. Two of the members--Nelly and her daughter, Rina--are related but they have totally independent incomes. The members operate various businesses including: urban education; domestic service; and food and drink sales. The loan will be used to buy basic supplies and work materials and to start businesses in order to have extra means to make money. The members of the group have experience with cooperatives because they're starting on their second cycle, having demonstrated honesty and responsibility in repaying a past loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Operating capital.

loan.name: Comadritas Chapacas Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "LAS COMADRITAS CHAPACAS" REPRESENTADOS POR DOÃ‘A MARÃA VIRGINIA SON UN GRUPO BIEN DINÃMICO Y DIVERSIFICADO, ELLAS TIENEN LA ACTIVIDAD D. LA COMERCIALIZACIÃ“N D. PRODUCTOS ALIMENTICIOS COMO EL ARROZ, FIDEO, HARINA TAMBIÃ‰N COMERCIALIZAN LICORES, COSMÃ‰TICOS, COMIDA AL PASO, DULCES Y AL TRANSPORTE PÃšBLICO D. PASAJEROS. EL CRÃ‰DITO ESTA DESTINADO AL CRECIMIENTO COMERCIAL D. LOS MIEMBROS DEL BANCO PARA LOGRAR UN MEJORAMIENTO CONJUNTO CUYOS BENEFICIOS SEAN PARA LOS MISMOS COMPONENTES Y SUS FAMILIAS, ASÃ MISMO EL BANCO CUENTA CON BUENOS ANTECEDENTES CREDITICIOS YA QUE VAN CURSANDO SU SEGUNDO CICLO Y CUENTAN CON LA CONFIANZA D. LA FUNDACIÃ“N AGROCAPITAL DEMOSTRANDO PUNTUALIDAD Y RESPONSABILIDAD EN LA ADMINISTRACIÃ“N D. LOS FONDOS OTORGADOS.
texts.en:
The Las Comadritas Chapacas group, represented by Maria Virginia, is a very dynamic and diverse one. They operate businesses including: sales of food items such as rice, pasta, and flour; liquor sales; cosmetics sales; take-out food sales; sweets; and public transportation services. The loan will be used to support the growth of the members' businesses so that they can improve their incomes and, in turn, their lives and the lives of their families. The bank is building on a good credit history because the members are starting on their second cycle and they've demonstrated to Fundacion Agrocapital that they can repay their loan responsibly and punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Operating capital.

loan.name: Las Kantutas Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "LAS KANTUTAS" ESTA REPRESENTADO POR EL SEÃ‘OR BERNARDINO Y CONSTITUIDOS POR 16 MIEMBROS LOS CUALES SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO D. PRODUCTOS COMO ROPA, TEJIDOS, SANDALIAS, COSMÃ‰TICOS A LA ELABORACIÃ“N D. PAN, AL TRANSPORTE PÃšBLICO Y A LA CONSTRUCCION D. VIVIENDAS. COMO EN TODO RUBRO COMERCIAL SIEMPRE EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA Y LA OFERTA D. PRODUCTOS A BAJO COSTO, POR LO QUE LOS SOCIOS (AS) TIENEN QUE TENER LOS PRODUCTOS D. MAYOR DEMANDA A MENOR PRECIO, UNA D. LAS VENTAJAS DEL GRUPO ES QUE SUS PUESTOS D. VENTA SE ENCUENTRAN ALEJADOS D. LA CIUDAD POR LO QUE TIENEN MAYOR POSIBILIDAD D. VENTA, PERO LA DESVENTAJA D. ELLO ES LA EDUCACIÃ“N RURAL PARA SUS HIJOS POR LO QUE ELLOS TIENE LA ESPERANZA D. ENVIAR A SUS HIJOS A LA CIUDAD EN DOND. RECIBIRÃN UNA MEJOR EDUCACIÃ“N. EL DESTINO DEL CRÃ‰DITO ES PARA EL INCREMENTO D. MERCADERÃA E INSUMOS PARA CUMPLIR CON LAS DEMANDAS DEL MERCADO. LOS SOCIOS VAN CUMPLIENDO SU TERCER CICLO POR LO QUE CONOCEN DEL TRABAJO CON GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS ASÃ COMO LA RESPONSABILIDAD Y HONESTIDAD QUE SE REQUIERE PARA UN FINANCIAMIENTO COMO EL OTORGADO POR LA FUNDACIÃ“N AGROCAPITAL.
texts.en:
The Kantutus group is represented by Bernardino and is maD. up of 16 members who operate various businesses including: clothing sales; fabric sales; footwear sales; cosmetics sales, sales of baked goods; taxi services; and construction services. As in all commercial endeavors, there's competition and offers to sell similar products at lower costs, so the members have to have products for which there's a lot of demand and sell them for less. One advantage for the group is that their businesses are located outsiD. of the city which gives them greater opportunities to sell. The disadvantage of that for them is that their children can only get a rural education. They hope to send their children to the city where they would receive a better education. The loan will be used to buy merchandise and supplies to meet the demands of the market. The members will be completing their third cycle so they know how to work within a cooperative and have demonstrated the responsibility and honesty required to get financing like that provided by Fundacion Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Operating capital.

loan.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen S. is 26 years old and lives in the Kompong Tom Province. She makes a living raising female cows and selling their offspring, as well as growing rice. She started her businesses more than eight years ago and is currently earning approximately $2 a day. S. is married to Sin Sarat, a local fisherman. She now cares for one young child and her old mother. S. hopes to expand her business; thus she is applying for a $500 loan to purchase more cows to raise and use them to help her in her farming. The loan will help to make her family's life a little more comfortable. (S.'s mother is pictured because she was not available that day)

loan.use: To purchase more cows

loan.name: Chamroeurn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chamroeurn Y. is the leader of a group of five people, all of whom live in the village of Kraing Sromor in Kampong Chhnang province. Her husband, Mr. Brok P., helps her on the plantation. She is 45 years old, and she is the mother of five children; three of her children are employed in a garment factory, while the other two children are currently attending the local school.

Mrs. Chamroeurn Y. is a pig breeder who is currently raising one pig. Because her business has been doing rather well, she wants to expand and improve the business. Accordingly, she decided to ask for a loan in order to buy two more piglets for her breeding business.

This group loan primarily consists of what are referred to as "end-of-term" ("EoT") loans. Indeed, three members are seeking such EoT loans, while the other group members are seeking monthly payment loans. More specifically, with the EoT loans, the borrowers are not required to repay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan's term (i.e., the maturity date), whereas the monthly payment loans require the borrowers to make regular monthly payments. EoT loans are AMKâ€™s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodiaâ€™s poor people; in particular, such loans allow the borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Interestingly, most clients start to make principal payments on EoT loans many months before the end of the loan's term. Further, almost all of AMKâ€™s clients make their payments on time: AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

One group member, Mrs. Sovann Y., is not seeking a loan, but her husband is applying for a loan; as a result, he is captured in the picture rather than her.

loan.use: To expand and improve her pig breeding business by purchasing two more piglets

loan.name: Mrs. Yet Tol Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank group consists of fifteen people who live in the village of Spean Pau in Kampong Chhnang province. The group is collectively seeking a loan, but all of the members will use the loan proceeds for different purposes, depending on their individual business needs.

Mrs. Yet T. is the village bank president. She owns a small restaurant where she sells Khmer noodles to both residents of and visitors to her local village. Her husband, Mr. Prak Noeurn, is a carpenter who makes beds, chairs, and other such wood products. Mrs. Yet T. is 39 years old, and she is the mother of two children, both of whom help their parents with their current businesses. Although she and her husband (and their children, for that matter) work extremely hard, they still do not earn sufficient income to properly support the family. As a matter of fact, they do not have enough money to purchase rice to keep in stock to feed the family. Thus, Mrs. Yet T. decided to ask for a loan in order to purchase rice.

One group member, Mr. Chandara H., is not seeking a loan, but his wife is; so, his wife is captured in the picture rather than him.

loan.use: To purchase rice in order to continue to feed her family

loan.name: Mrs. Sok Len Phan Village Bank Group

texts.en: Sixteen people who live in Spean Pau village in Kampong Chhnang province have formed a village bank loan group. Mrs. S.
