Len P. is the village bank loan group president who has been selected by the members. She owns a small store where she sells grocery products in the local market. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory. Her husband, Mr. C. Reth, is a fisherman who catches fish locally. Mrs. S. Len P. is 30 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is five years old and too young to work or study. Mrs. Sarom C. husband is shown in the picture instead of her.

loan.use: Buy additional grocery products for inventory.

loan.name: Prak

texts.en: Prak C. is a 34-year-old resident of the Kompong Tom Province. She earns a living by sewing clothes as a local tailor. She is running her business very well and a lot of clients recognize her good service. She started her work in 2005, and currently earns a profit of $5 a day. C. is a mother of three children, all of whom are single and are employed. Her son is a construction worker; her two daughters assist with her farm business, and her husband is also a construction worker. C. now requests a $250 loan to buy oxen to raise. Oxen is a main source of raising income for renting by farmers. (C.'s husband appears in the picture because she was not available)

loan.use: To buy oxen to raise

loan.name: Mr. Chen Bou Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eight people who live in Andoung Chros village, in Kampong Chhnang province, have formed a village bank loan group. Mr. C. B. is the village bank loan group president who has been selected by the members. He is a farmer who owns a small plot of land and cultivates rice to earn for living. His wife, Mrs. Khum Lay, works in a garment factory and contributes a small salary to the support of the family. Although they work hard, they still cannot support the family well. In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. C. B. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. Mr. C. B. is 29 years old and the father of two children who attend the local school. Mr. C. B.'s wife is shown in the picture.
Two members in this village bank loan are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMKâ€™s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodiaâ€™s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMKâ€™s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: To buy a cow and start a breeding business.

loan.name: Mrs. Sine Keo Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of nine people, located in Andoung Chros village in Kampong Chhnang province. Each of the members in this group will use this loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sine K. is the village bank loan group president. She owns a small restaurant where she sells rice soup to villagers and passerbys in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Leang Pinh, is a rice wine maker in the local village. Aside from this business, he is a breeder and raises fourteen pigs. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it, so Mrs. Sine K. decided to ask for a loan to buy three more piglets for breeding. Mrs. Sine K. is 27 years old and the mother of five children. Three are attending the local school while the others stay at home as they are too young to work or study.
Two members in this village bank group loan are end-of-term loans and the rest are monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMKâ€™s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodiaâ€™s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMKâ€™s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: To buy three more piglets for breeding.

loan.name: Maryam Abdul Sattar Group

texts.en:
Maryam baji is a 45 year old married lady who lives in Kot Radha Kishan, which is 24km away from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She lived there for the past 30 years. She is an uneducated lady because of her fatherâ€™s lack of financial resources. Her husband's name is A. S., and he is an electrician by profession. He has 20 years of experience in this business. Most people call on him to repair fans and other electrical items. She is the mother of four kids: three daughters and one son. Her son and her elder daughter read in 10th standard. Her next daughter is in 8th standard, and her younger daughter is in 5th standard. Maryam baji has a milk selling business which she handles independently. She does this work to improve the financial situation of her family and pay the school fees for her kids. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her milk selling business.
She is a group leader of some more women. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Seema baji wants a loan to repair her vehicle named â€œShahzoreâ€. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Salma baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loan.use: To buy another buffalo for milk selling business

loan.name: Samon

texts.en: Mrs. Samon N. was born in 1981 and lives in Khsom village in Kandal province. She is employed at a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Sing Rith, is a pig breeder. Even though they try to work hard, they can't earn enough income to provide a better life for their family, or for the family members who also live in their old house. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Samon N. decided to request a loan to repair the house for her family. Her husband is presented on the right in the picture.

loan.use: To repair the house for her family.

loan.name: Bushra Subah Sadiq Group

texts.en:
Bushra baji is a 34 year old widow who lives in a place named Kot Radha Kishan, which is 24km away from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house, where she has lived for the past 20 years. She has spent 10 years of her life as a widow. Her husband died of a heart attack. He left behind three kids: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son is a milkman and has been selling milk for the past 5 years. Her younger son works in a factory. Her daughter is 10 years old and reads in 5th standard. Bushra baji did lots of hard work to raise her children. She sews clothes day and night to earn an income. Her children give her a lot of respect a lot and call her the worldâ€™s greatest mother. She is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her sonâ€™s milk selling business.
She is joined in her loan group by some other women. Sugran, Parveena, and Nursrat baji each want a loan to buy buffalo for their milk selling businesses. Sajida baji wants a loan to buy clothes to resell.
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loan.use: To buy another buffalo for milk selling business

loan.name: Ghalam Nabie

texts.en:
Ghalam Nabie is the son of S. A., and lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. Ghalam, 54, lives near the Afghan Hotel and is married with five children. He has a small restaurant in the city and has good experience in this field and would like to expand his business to support his family.
He is requesting an individual loan of 50,000 Afghans ($1050) for a term of 18 months to enlarge his business and to buy a new desk and table and other necessary things for his shop in order to further his business with more success.
Ghalam is very happy to be involved in this loan process and is especially grateful for the help of the AFSG and Kiva. He thanks all lenders around the world.

loan.use: Enlarge his business and purchase furniture and items for it

loan.name: Yoeurn

texts.en: Yoeum S. is 25 years old and lives in the Kompong Tom Province where she makes a living by collecting chickens to store and then sells them from village to village in her community for profit. She also sells wood carvings. S. currently earns a profit of $4 a day. She is married with one young child, and her husband, aged 23, raises pigs from home. The young couple hopes to earn additional income to help provide the family with food and enlarge their businesses; thus they both need to request a loan of $500 to buy more chickens to sell and piglets to raise. (S.'s husband with her child are pictured because she was not available)

loan.use: To buy more chickens & piglets to raise then sell

loan.name: Kosar M. Jamil Group

texts.en:
Kosar baji is a 39 year old married lady who lives in a place named Kot Radha Kishan, which is 24km away from the city of Kasur in Pakistan. She has lived there for the past 15 years. Her husband's name is M. J., whose profession is selling milk, which he has done for the past 10 years. She is the mother of five daughters. All of her daughters are attend the local school near their house. Kosar baji is a very hardworking housewife. First she gets up early in the morning and helps her husband get milk from the buffalo, then transfers the milk into milk pots. Then she prepares the breakfast for her family, gets her daughters ready for school, and then cleans the whole house. She performs her duties without taking any breaks. Her family is very happy with her. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her husbandâ€™s business.
She is joined in her loan group by some more women. Barkat baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for a milk selling business. Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy artificial jewelry to resell.
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loan.use: To buy another buffalo for milk selling business

loan.name: Sarikakeo

texts.en: Mrs. Sarikakeo P. is a villager in Damnak Sangke village in Kandal province. She is a wedding chef who has been hired by the villagers to cook at wedding ceremonies, parties, and so on. She is a 26 year old widow with a child who is attending the local school. She now wants to purchase a motorbike to go to work; unfortunately, she does not have enough money. In order to deal this problem, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

loan.use: To purchase a motorbike to go to work.

loan.name: Songambele Group

texts.en:
Juma S., 32, is married with four children ages 12, 9, 6, and 2. He owns a general store where he sells various items. He has been in this business for five years now and works daily from 6am until 10pm. He is able to earn a monthly profit of about US$ 114.

This will be Jumaâ€™s sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous five loans to increase the inventory of his shop, and he bought some land. He has paid the loans back successfully. He now hopes for a new loan to start developing his land.

Juma will share this loan with subgroup A of the Songambele group. The subgroup has 6 members who run shops, a video library, sell soap, and sell fish. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Juma is the 1st on the right.

loan.use: To develop his land by starting building a house

loan.name: Srey Pao

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Pao S. is 29 years old and she now lives in Chek village in Kandal province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Thon Phat, is farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. In the plantation, he faces some problems because he does not have enough rice seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to support his field. Additionally, he does not have enough money to purchase fuel for the pump in order to water or to hire laborers to work on the field. Thus, Mrs. Srey Pao S. decided to ask for a loan for her husband's purposes. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

loan.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides

loan.name: Houn

texts.en: Mrs. Houn S. is 57 years old and a widow with two children, one of whom is a laborer while the other is attending the local school. She lives in Chrouy Dang village in Kandal province. She is a clothes seller who owns a small stall in the market. Since she has a lot of customers who want new fashions, she decided to request a loan to buy more fashionable clothes for her customers. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan.

loan.use: to buy more fashionable clothes for her customers

loan.name: Hos

texts.en: Mrs. Hos N. is 51 years old and a widow with two children who are employed in garment factory. She is a farmer in Angk village in Kandal province. She owns a 1-hectare field where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil which has a bad effect on her crop. In order to solve this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer; she plans to use the rest of the money to hire laborers to work on the field.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizer and hire laborers to work on the field

loan.name: Srieng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Srieng T. is the group leader for five people who all live in Sram Angkam village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. S. Phorn, are farmers who own a small piece of land where they cultivate rice. In the plantation, they can earn only a little rice revenue, not enough to support the family. In order to improve their living standard, Mrs. Srieng T. decided to ask for a loan to purchase some piglets to start a pig-breeding business.

Mrs. Srieng T. is the mother of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is a construction worker. Two of her children are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Mrs. Srieng T. did not come to take her loan but her husband did, so he is in the picture instead of his wife.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans' term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMKâ€™s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodiaâ€™s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMKâ€™s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: to purchase some piglets to start breeding pigs

loan.name: Domingos Xavier

texts.pt:
Domingos Xavier T. Ã© natural da Matola um dos distritos da provÃ­ncia do Maputo, tem 75 anos de idade, Ã© casado e pai de 25 filhos, com 37 netos.
Domingos estudou atÃ© 4Âªclasse e parou quando foi escolhido para ir tirar o curso BÃ­blico pela igreja qual teve que interromper quando a sua mÃ£e ficou gravemente doente, dai que comeÃ§ou a trabalhar nos Caminhos de Ferros de MoÃ§ambique com segundo oficial e mais tarde foi a Portugal como jogador tendo permanecido por trÃªs anos e volta a MoÃ§ambique e continuou a trabalhar nos C.F.M tendo reformado em 1990.
Domingos depois da reforma iniciou um negÃ³cio que consistiu na compra e venda de produtos da primeira necessidade actividade que desenvolve atÃ© data hoje. Com um estabelecimento comercial e trabalha durante 12 horas por dia e conta com ajuda de um dos seus filhos. Desta consegue um rendimento mensal lÃ­quido de 7000,00mt. NÃ£o faz poupanÃ§a.
texts.en:
Domingos Xavier T. is a native of Matola, one of the districts of the province of Maputo. He is 75 years old, married, and the father of 25 children. He has 37 grandchildren. Domingos studied until the 4th grade and stopped when he was chosen to take a bible course through the church which he had to interrupt when his mother became gravely ill. From there he started working on the railways of Mozambique as a second official. Later he went to Portugal as a soccer player for three years then returned to Mozambique and continued to work the railways. He retired in 1990. Domingos, after retiring, began a business that consisted in the purchase and sale of staple products, an activity that he continues to develop today. He has a commercial establishment and works 12 hours per day with the help of one of his children. He is able to earn a liquid monthly income of 7,000MT. He does not have any savings.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase and sale of staple products

loan.name: Hanifan M. Ramzan Group

texts.en:
Hanifan baji is a 43 year old married lady who lives in Kot Radha Kishan, which is 24km away from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house, where she has lived with her family for the past 30 years. Her husband's name is M. R., and he runs a grocery shop in the community. He has 20 years of experience in this business. Hanifan baji has five kids: three sons and two daughters. Her elder son works with his father. The next to him is a welder. The other kids attend school near their house. Hanifan baji spends her time knitting clothes for her neighbors. She is saving her income and plans to renovate the house. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy groceries to diversify her husbandâ€™s grocery shop into a store.
She is a group leader of some more women. Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy products (cooking oil, lentils and spices) for her food selling business. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell.
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loan.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop.

loan.name: Mrs. Chantha Tuy Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twenty-one people from the village of Kandal Kraom in Kandal Province formed a group to apply for a village bank loan. They will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Chantha T. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. However, she does not have enough rice seeds to grow on her land. So she decided to request a loan for this purpose, and will use the rest of the loan to purchase fertilizer to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. PH. Phally, sells icecream in the local village. Mrs. Chantha T. is 42 years old and the mother of four childR., one of whom helps with the father's business while another is employed in a garment factory and the others attend the local school.

loan.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer.

loan.name: Ruqaiya M.yunas Group

texts.en:
Ruqaiya baji is a 39 year old married lady who lives in Kot Radha Kishan, which is 24km away from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She has lived there for the past 20 years. Her husband's name is M., and he sells dried fruit. He has 15 years of experience in this business. She is the mother of six kids: four sons and two daughters. Her elder son runs a store in a school. The next to him has a food selling business. Another son is a fruit seller. Her youngest son is in 9th standard. Her daughters do household work and take care of the family. Ruqaiya baji is a seamstress and completes the orders with the help of her daughters. She takes orders from her neighbors, and gets lots of orders on occasions such as the Muslim Eid Day. She is saving her income and plans to marry off her eldest daughter when she has saved enough. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy products (biscuits, chips) for her sonâ€™s canteen.
She is a group leader of some more women. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy products (tea and sugar) for her tea stall. Khursheed baji wants a loan to buy wheat to resell. Siddiqan baji wants a loan to rent land to grow seasonal vegetables. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business.
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loan.use: To buy biscuits and chips for her son's canteen.

loan.name: Mrs. Koen Meas Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of fifteen people located in Kandal Kraom Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Koen M. is the village bank president and was selected by the group members. She sells clothes in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fashion clothes to resell. She hopes to increase her income and improve their living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Noeun Socheat, is a goldsmith in the local market. Mrs. Koen M. is 30 years old and the mother of a young child.

loan.use: To buy more fashion clothes to resell.

loan.name: Shapoor

texts.en:
Shapoor K. is 33 years old. He is married and lives with his family, in Ningarhar province . Shapoor has 2 children, who go to school. His brother works with him on the agricultural lands that they own. They share a single house. After his father died, Shapoor became the responsible person for the household.
Besides farming, Shapoor is a teacher . He teaches in a public school in the morning, and in the afternoon he works as a farmer in his village. He grows different kinds of vegetables and sells them in the bazaar. Along with the farming, he has livestock. His small son brings grass for the animals.
Shapoor is a hardworking man, but there are 14 members in his family and supporting that many people with only 500 Afghanis ($10) a day income is almost impossible. He therefore has to expand his business. He thinks that if he buys more livestock and seed for his land, he can increase his income. He has requested AFSG for a 50000(AF) ($1,075) loan. He has decided to buy a cow and with the remaining loan, purchase seed and pesticide.
Shapoor K. dreams of the day that he solves all his economic problems and can concentrate on teaching.

loan.use: Purchase livestock of seed

loan.name: JoÃ£o

texts.pt:
JoÃ£o B. Ã© natural de Maputo e tem 42 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos ainda estudantes, para alem dos filhos sustenta uma prima que vive com ela.
JoÃ£o estudou atÃ© 10Âªclasse e parou quando perdeu o seu pai e nÃ£o tinha alguÃ©m para o custear os estudos, assim viu se obrigado a procurar emprego para o seu sustenta e mais tarde tirou o curso de professor primÃ¡rio e neste momento dÃ¡ aulas. FuncionÃ¡rio do estado e tem um salÃ¡rio mensal de 4600,00mt.
Para JoÃ£o este Ã© o terceiro emprÃ©stimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva com qual pretende continuar com a construÃ§Ã£o da sua obra. Desta maneira diz que vai procurar pagar antes do tempo para voltar solicitar outro emprÃ©stimo de forma a concluir mais rÃ¡pido a sua casa.
texts.en:
JoÃ£o B. is a native of Maputo. He is 42 years old, married, and the father of 2 children who are both still students. Besides his children he also supports a cousin who lives with them. JoÃ£o studied until the 10th grade and stopped when he lost his father and had no one to pay for the costs of his schooling. As such he was obliged to search for work to sustain himself. Later he took a course to teach elementary school, and now he teaches classes. He is an employee of the state, and he earns a monthly salary of 4,600MT. This is JoÃ£o's third loan through Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. He intends to use the proceeds to continue with the construction on his home. In this way he says he will try to pay off the loan before the term so he can return and borrow another loan with the hopes of finishing his home more quickly.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase construction materials

loan.name: Chhun

texts.en: Mrs. Chhun Y., 60, is sells groceries from her house in Siem Reap Province. She sells a variety of products such as oil and other foods items. She is widowed with one daughter, who is married. Her business is doing well and she has many clients. She would to increase her business to provide her with more income. Therefore, Chhun Y. would like to request a loan to purchase more groceries to sell.

loan.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loan.name: Mrs. Phalla Choung Village Bank Group

texts.en: Ten people living in Anlong Romeit Choeng Village in Kandal Province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. For example, Mrs. Phalla C., the 44-year-old village bank president, owns a small grocery store in the local village. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery goods, hoping to increase income and improve family living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Touch Sokea, is a wedding chef who has been hired by villagers to cook for wedding ceremonies, parties, etc. They have three children, two of whom are attending the local school.

loan.use: To purchase more grocery goods for her business.

loan.name: Vannak's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Vannak C., the 37-year-old group leader of four people who live in Anlong Romeit Choeng Village in Kandal Province, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land upon which she cultivates rice. She is requesting a loan to hire laborers to harvest rice. Her husband, Mr. Preap Sareoun, is a policeman. They have four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the others are attending the local school.

loan.use: To hire laborers to harvest rice.

loan.name: Mrs. Nara Den Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan is granted to sixteen people located in Anlong Romeit Choeng Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Nara D. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a grocer who does not earn enough income to support her household. Since she has a lot of customers who need many varied items, she wants to expand her grocery store. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more grocery goods for her inventory. Her husband, Mr. Suos Vanna, is a construction worker. Mrs. Nara D. is 43 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loan.use: to purchase more grocery goods for her inventory

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to purchase grocery inventory for sale

loan.name: Sen's Group

texts.en:
This small loan request is being made by five borrowers, all residents of Siem Reap Province. Mr. Sen S. is 32 years old and the leader. He makes a living by selling carving wood out of his home. He can earn a profit of approximately US$ 2 per day to cover his family's living expenses. He is married to Nor Chaom, 22, a grocery seller. She runs a store from their house selling various kinds of groceries to neighbors, which allows her to earn about US$ 2 a day. Besides this, she is a good housewife who takes time to care for her one young child. Mr. S. has humbly requested a loan for his wife to purchase various grocery items for sale.

The four other borrowers are

Bon S., 26 years old, a carving wood seller. He is seeking a loan to buy piglets to raise.

Te Toeun is 50 years old and is a wine distiller. He requests a loan to purchase poultry for breeding.

Khon P., 24, sells carving wood out of his home and he is asking for a loan to buy piglets to raise.

Dib C. is age 45 and makes a living distilling wine for sale. She would like to ask for a loan to purchase piglets to raise. (C.'s husband is pictured, because she was not available.)

loan.use: To purchase grocery items for sale

loan.name: Mr. Den Mao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
FourteE. people who live in Anlong Romeit Choeng Village in Kandal Province make up this village bank and they will use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mr. DE. M. is the village bank president. He is a village chief who makes only a small salaR. to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Say Soth, is a farmer who owns 0.2-hectare where she cultivates rice. Although they cultivate rice, they still make only a little rice revenue which cannot support the family. In order to support them, Mr. DE. M. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice to eat. He is a 59-year-old and the father of two childrE., one of whom is employed in a garment factoR. while the other is staying at home to do housework.

Two members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those who have EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the veR. end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMKâ€™s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodiaâ€™s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMKâ€™s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: to buy rice to eat

loan.name: Meth

texts.en: Mr. Meth L. lives in Kaung Kang Tie Muoy village in Kampong Cham province. He sells ice-cream. In this business, he faces an obstacle because he does not have a motorbike to transport the ice cream to sell door-to-door. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings to buy a motorbike for his business. He hopes to increase his income and improve the living conditions of his family with this loan. His wife, Mrs. Mouk Meth, is a housewife. Mr. Meth L. is 55 years old and the father of ten children, two of whom are farmers while another is employed in a garment factory. One of his children is a laborer while the others are attending the local school. Mr. Meth L. is not in the picture because he was busy with his work so his wife is shown instead in the picture.

loan.use: to add to his savings to buy a motorbike to transport ice cream to sell door-to-door

loan.name: Nader

texts.en:
Nader K. is a 52 year old man. He is married and the father of four children. The household has lived in Ningarhar province for a long time. Nander has worked as a farmer for the last several years in his village. His children go to school and he is the sole breadwinner for his family.
Nader grows different kinds of vegetables on his land and sells them in the central market of the city. However, his current $8 a day income is not sufficient to support the family; he needs at least $20. Besides their schooling, his sons help him on the farm but Nader doesnâ€™t allow them spend to much time working the farm, as he wants them to do well in school and pursue a bright future.
Nader K. has been thinking about how to solve his problems for a while now. He finally decided to purchase a water pump and increase his livestock. He knows that this business is quite profitable in his area. There are a lot of grasslands in his village and he would be able to provide sufficient food for the stock. He believes that with the purchase of a water pump he could sell water to other farmers in his village. With this plan in mind, he has applied for 50,000 Afghanis loan to be repaid over 27 months.
Nader K. wants to expand his business, buying more livestock and start a livestock selling business in future. He thanks the lenders for their assistance.

loan.use: Pruchase a water pamp for his farm

loan.name: Rosa Cacilda

texts.pt:
Rosa Cacilda D. Ã© natural da provÃ­ncia do Maputo e tem 51 anos de idade, mÃ£e de cinco filhos onde apenas um que vai para escola, outros jÃ¡ sÃ£o maiores de idade e jÃ¡ formaram suas famÃ­lias. Ã‰ separada a treze anos.
Rosa estudou atÃ© segunda classe diz que na altura era difÃ­cil ir a escola primeiro na sua zona uma mulher ia a escola com dez anos e aos 17 anos era obrigada a ir ao lar, desta forma ela nÃ£o conseguiu estudar.
Rosa pois a separaÃ§Ã£o teve que iniciar com o negocio para o sustento dos filhos negocio que consiste na compra e venda de produtos da primeira necessidade, actividade que desenvolve atÃ© data hoje com ajuda de um empregado, tem um rendimento mensal de 9800.00mt e consegue poupar algum periodicamente.
Este Ã© o terceiro emprÃ©stimo da Rosa no Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, outros tambÃ©m aplicou na compra de mercadoria e pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro afim de fazer arranjos na sua casa.
texts.en:
Rosa Cacilda D. is a native of the province of Maputo. She is 51 years old, the mother of 5 children only one of which goes to school. The others are already adults and have formed their own families. She has been separated for 13 years. Rosa studied until the 2nd grade and says that at the time it was difficult to go to school in her area because a girl would go to school as a 10 year old and at 17 she would be obligated to be at home. In this way she was not able to study. Rosa, after her separation, had to begin a business to sustain her children. The business consists of purchasing and selling staple products, an activity she continues today. She has one employee, a monthly income of 9,800MT, and is able to save some money periodically. This is her third loan through Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. The others also were applied to the purchase of merchandise, and she intends to pay this loan off before the maturity so she can solicit another loan to make arrangements in her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase and sale of staple products

loan.name: Noeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Noeurn C., 48, lives in Ta Sen Village in Kampong Cham Province where she sells Khmer noodles door-to-door. Her husband, Mr. Vong Ny, is a construction foreman lacking sufficient funds to buy construction equipment to support his career, so Noeurn is requesting a loan for that purpose. They are the parents of three children, one of whom is a construction worker while the others are enrolled in local school.

loan.use: To buy construction equipment for her husband's business.

loan.name: Hom

texts.en: Mr. Hom U., 57, is a construction foreman living in Ta Sen Village in Kampong Cham Province. Because he needs more construction equipment, he is requesting a loan to make the necessary purchases. His wife, Mrs. Chork Im, is a housewife, and they have two children, one a driver and the other a fruit seller.

loan.use: To buy construction equipment.

loan.name: Sokha

texts.en: Mrs. Sokha N. is 21 years old and lives in Ta Sen village, in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Yoeun Kimyan, are fish breeders. They do not earn sufficient income with their business, to support their household. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Sokha N. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike so that her husband could start a business as a motorbike taxi driver. They hope to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. Sokha is 21 years old and the mother of one child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loan.use: To buy a motorbike.

loan.name: Srey Aonn

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Aonn R. lives in Ta Sen village in Kampong Cham province. She is a fruit seller. Her husband, Mr. Thy Ra, is a motorbike taxi driver. The couple does not earn enough income to support their household. To improve their living conditions, Mrs. Srey Aonn R. decided to ask for a loan to buy some piglets and start a business breeding pigs. She would use the rest of money to purchase pig feed. She is 25 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is with her on the right of the photo.

loan.use: To buy some piglets to start a business, breeding pigs..

loan.name: Bieng

texts.en:
Mr. Bieng B. is a farmer in Krodass Kor village in Kampong Cham province. He owns a plot of land and cultivates rice to earn a living. On this plot of land, he must deal with the problems that his land is infertile and that he does not have enough money to buy fuel for a pump, to water his field. He has requested a loan to solve these problems.
Mr. Bieng B. is a 47-year-old widower with five children, one is a laboror in the Thailand and another is a fisherman. One child is a farmer and helps his father out while the others attend the local school.

loan.use: To buy fuel for a pump to water his field.

loan.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
Fernando C. Ã© natural de Boane um dos distritos da provÃ­ncia do Maputo, tem 35 anos de idade, Ã© casado e pai de trÃªs filhos com idade entre o primeiro com 12 anos e o segundo com trÃªs e ultimo com um ano de idade respectivamente.
Fernando estudou atÃ© segunda classe e nÃ£o continuou por falta de condiÃ§Ãµes financeiras da famÃ­lia, muito novo teve que desenvolver actividade comercial para poder se sustentar teve como seu primeiro negocio a venda de pÃ£o e mais tarde investiu num pequeno estabelecimento comercial e comeÃ§ou a vender produtos da primeira necessidade. Hoje tem um estabelecimento maior tipo mercearia. Tem um rendimento mensal aproximadamente 24000,00mt e consegue poupar 2000,00mt.
Para Fernando este Ã© o segundo emprÃ©stimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, o primeiro foi de 8000,00mt e aplicou na compra de mercadoria, este tambÃ©m pretende fazer o mesmo. Futuramente pretende solicitar outro emprÃ©stimo para permitir mais poupanÃ§a para mais tarde comprar uma viatura afim de ajudar nas compras de mercadorias.
texts.en:
Fernando C. is from Boane, one of the districts in the province of Maputo. He is 35 years old, married, and father of 3 children aged twelve, three, and one respectively. Fernando studied until the second grade, after which he had to stop because his family lacked the financial resources. From a young age Fernando had to work to support himself. His first business was selling bread, and later he invested in a small commercial establishment and started selling basic goods. Today he has a larger, general store type of establishment. His monthly income is approximately 24,000.00 MT and he is able to save 2,000.00 MT. This is Fernandoâ€™s second loan through Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. His first was for 8,000.00 MT, which he used to buy supplies. He intends to do the same with this loan. In the future he would like to request another loan that would permit him to save more money so that he can later buy a vehicle to help in purchasing supplies.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying and selling basic goods

loan.name: Mrs. Boeurn Krouch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan, which consists of sixteen people, is located in Chrey Bak village in Kampong Chhnang province, and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Boeurn K. is the village bank president. She and her husband, Mr. Nith Veasna, are farmers who own a plot of land for cultivating rice. It is now harvest season, and Mrs. Boeurn K. does not have enough money to hire laborers to harvest the rice.Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She is 56 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, two help their parents on the plantation, and the youngest one is attending the local school. Mr. Saret R. did not come to take a loan but his wife did, so she is presented in the picture instead of him.
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Four members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMKâ€™s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodiaâ€™s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMKâ€™s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: To hire laborers to harvest the rice

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: for a purchasing motorcycle to use for her business and family

loan.name: NatÃ©rcia Da ConceiÃ§Ã£o

texts.pt:
NatÃ©rcia da ConceiÃ§Ã£o T. Ã© natural de Maxixe um dos distritos da provÃ­ncia de Inhamabene, tem 37 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mÃ£e de trÃªs filhos, com idade entre o primeiro 16, 8 e 3 anos respectivamente. Para alem dos filhos sustenta 4 pessoas sendo trÃªs irmÃ£o e sua mÃ£e enviando valor mensalmente.
NatÃ©rcia estudou atÃ© 8Âªclasse e nÃ£o continuou por falta de condiÃ§Ãµes financeiras na famÃ­lia. NatÃ©rcia mudou se da provÃ­ncia de Inhambane na companhia da famÃ­lia em 1978. para NatÃ©rcia este Ã© o terceiro emprÃ©stimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva os dois primeiros tambÃ©m aplicou na compra de material de construÃ§Ã£o nos seguintes valores o primeiro 8000,00mt e o segundo 10800,00mt. Para sustentar o reembolso Ã© feita na base de negocio que consiste em venda de Bolos e doces diversos quais vende por encomenda principalmente para as festa onde tem tido um rendimento mensal liquido de 3600,00mt.
NatÃ©rcia futuramente pretende solicitar um emprÃ©stimo para abrir um salÃ£o de cabeleireiro.
texts.en:
NatÃ©rcia da ConceiÃ§Ã£o T. was born in Maxixe, one of the districts in the province of Inhamabene. She is 37 years old, married, and mother of 3 children aged 16, 8, and 3 respectively. Besides her children, she supports her 3 brothers and her mother by sending monthly allowances. NatÃ©rcia studied until the 8th grade and then couldnâ€™t continue because her family didnâ€™t have sufficient financial resources. She and her family moved from Inhambane province in 1978. This is NatÃ©rciaâ€™s third loan through Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. The first two loans of 8,000.00 MT and 10,800.00 MT were used to purchase construction materials. She reimburses her loans by selling various cakes and sweets that are ordered mostly for parties. Her monthly liquid income is 3,600.00 MT. In the future NatÃ©ricia intends to request a loan so that she can open a hair salon.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase construction material

loan.name: Mrs. Sameth Muth Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people who live in Chrey Bak village in Kampong Chhnang province formed the village bank loan, and they will use the loan that they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Sameth M. is a village bank president. She is a farmer who owns one hectare to cultivate rice to eA. a living. She is a 50-year-old widow with three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the youngest one is attending the local school. Although Mrs. Sameth M. and her children work hard, they still live in an old house in poor conditions. In order to improve these conditions, Mrs. Sameth M. decided to ask for a loan to add to build a new house for her family.
One member in this village bank loan is an end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. This client is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMKâ€™s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodiaâ€™s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMKâ€™s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: to build a new house for her family

loan.name: Lang

texts.en: Lang O. is 30 years old and a resident of Kandal Province, where she earns a living by selling Khmer fritters to her neighbors, since 1988. She can earn around of $5 each day to support her family's expenses. She is married and has six children, five of whom are single, and one is married. Three of her daughters are employed as garment workers, and they currently get a salary of $240 a month to help meet the family's needs, while her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver. Lang O. needs for her son to have a job, thus she would like to apply for a loan to purchase fishing tools such as nets, traps, and a fish boat for her son to begin a new business as a fisherman.

loan.use: To purchase fishing tools

loan.name: Sas' Group

texts.en: The group leader of this group is Mrs. Sas R., and they all live in Phum Lor village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Sas R. owns a small store where she sells drinks to the villagers and passengers. Since this business is going well she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more drinks to resell. Her husband, Mr. Sos Math, is a beef seller in the local market. Mrs. Sas R. is 36 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local school.

loan.use: to buy more drinks to resell.

loan.name: SÃ¡bado Samuel

texts.pt:
SÃ¡bado Samuel M. Ã© natural da provÃ­ncia de Gaza, tem 39 anos de idade, pai de 8 filhos onde todos vÃ£o a escola. Para alem dos filhos sustenta os seus avos paternos enviando gÃ©neros alimentÃ­cios.
SÃ¡bado estudou atÃ© 4Âªclasse e nÃ£o continuou por que os pais nÃ£o deixaram dado que na zona o nÃ­vel ia atÃ© 4Âª e para continuar era preciso sair da zona assim proibiram para que ficasse a cuidar do gado.
Mudou se da provÃ­ncia de Gaza para Maputo quando ficou muito doente onde ficou numa casa da irmÃ£ e quando ficou bem conseguiu emprego nos caminhos de ferros de MoÃ§ambique, emprego que veio a terminar quando a empresa decidiu reduzir o pessoal e ele foi abrangido e pago indemnizaÃ§Ã£o e com este valor comprou talhÃ£o e construiu a sua casa e uma parte iniciou negÃ³cios, sendo um de criaÃ§Ã£o de frangos e outro de venda de produtos da primeira necessidade este que com o emprÃ©stimo pretende aumentar a sua mercadoria. Consegue um rendimento mensal de 15000,00mt e ainda nÃ£o faz poupanÃ§as.
SÃ¡bado solicita emprÃ©stimo pela terceira vez na Hluvuku e primeira no Kiva, onde sonha ampliar o seu negocio e futuramente pretende abrir outro estabelecimento numa zona vizinha.
texts.en:
SÃ¡bado Samuel M. was born in the province of Gaza. He is 39 years old and the father of 8 children, who are all in school. Besides his children, he also supports his paternal grandparents by sending them food supplies. SÃ¡bado studied until the 4th grade and then his parents made him stop because their zone only went until the 4th grade and to continue meant to leave the zone. So they prohibited him from continuing so that he would stay and take care of the cattle. SÃ¡bado moved from Gaza province to Maputo when he got very sick and went to stay at a sisterâ€™s house. When he got better he was able to get a job with Mozambique railways, which ended when the company decided to reduce the number of employees. He was given severance pay and with that money he purchased a plot of land where he built his house and a small business raising chickens and selling basic goods. With this loan he intends to increase his stock. SÃ¡bado is able to earn a monthly income of 15,000.00 MT, but is still not able to save any money. This is SÃ¡badoâ€™s third loan through Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. His dream is to increase his business so that in the future he can open another establishment in a neighboring zone.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying and selling basic goods

loan.name: Math's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan group with five members that has selected Mrs. P. as leader.

Mrs. P. is a 43-year-old fish seller who delivers her catch to customers' homes. She has been in this line of work since 2000 and can earn around $3.20 per day. Her husband, Mr. Sorn Sek, 42, is oxen trader. Mrs. P. and her husband work every day as well as care for four children, all of whom are young and live at home. Because her business is her family's main source income, P. would like expand her operations with a loan to buy more fish to sell.

The other four members of her group are: Mrs. Ma D., 35, sells perfume and wants a loan to buy more items to sell. Mrs. Math M., 63, sells roasted chickens and needs a loan to buy more poultry to buy and cook. Mrs. Rim RohiM., 29, sells used clothes and needs to buy more items to sell. Mrs. No S., 51, sells rice cakes and would like to start a new business selling home products.

loan.use: to buy more fish to sell

loan.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea V. is 49 years old who lives in Kandal Province, where she owns and runs a medium-sized shop that makes Khmer Noodles. She has one employee who helps her meet customer demand. Her company is doing very well, with many regular customers, and she earns about $20 a day. She has been in this line of work since 2003, and her income helps support her six children, four of whom are single and two of whom are married. Two of her children are employed; one sells groceries, and the other helps with this business. V. has applied for a loan to expand her business by buying more rice that she can use to make noodles.

loan.use: To buy more rice to make noodle for sale

loan.name: Eid_E_Qurban Group

texts.en:
Parwyen is the group leader of the Eid-e-Qurban group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to use the loan for his/her own business.
Seyweta and Latefa want to take out a loan for their tailoring business . Parwyen wants to use the loan for her husband and Salaha wants the loan for her bakery shop, which she has in her house. They all want to expand and progress in their businesses and earn more money to support their families.
With this loan they can increase the size of their business and support their families. They are very happy to have this loan process in their country.

loan.use: To increase and strengthen their businesses

loan.name: Sao's Group

texts.en: This is a small group of three members. Mrs. P. is selected to be the group leader. Mrs. Sao P., 51, is a hairdresser and provides laundry services. Her business is located in Battambang Province. She is widowed with three children, one of whom is married and two who are single. Her son, Mr. Sao Sony, 19, works a lathe and can earn money to support the family's expenses. To increase her son business, P. needs a loan for her son to purchase a lathe for his own business. Other two members are: Mrs. Kim C. T., 48, on staff at a local NGO, who needs a loan to run a new business of a decorating business, and Mrs. Chim B., who is selling noodle soups. She needs a loan to expand her business by purchasing ingredients.

loan.use: to purchase lathe for her son's business

loan.name: Roki Group

texts.en:
Zelikha is the group leader of the Roki group. All the group members live in Kabul, Afghanistan and each of the group members wants to take a loan for his/her own business.
Zelikha wants to take out a loan for her beauty parlor business. Roki would like the loan to buy fabric and Afghani cloths. Ghulam Mustafa requests it to stock up his mobile shop. Parween would like the loan to assist his brother's business, and Sediqa who lives in 5th district, wants to take out a loan for for her seamstress business..
They all expect to expand their businesses through the loan, support their families and earn a good income.. Finally, they all would like to thank Kiva lenders that assist the entrepreneurs with starting and to sustaining businesses.

loan.use: To increase business activity

loan.name: Chhom's Group

texts.en:
There are three members that jointed this small loan, and Mrs. Chhom M. is the group leader. She is 39 years old and earns a living by selling different kinds of fruit in the local market. She started her business more than ten years ago and is currently earning around $4 a day. She has five children, all of whom are single; three are students and two are employed, while her husband is a local chef for wedding parties and ceremonies. M. plans to expand her business, thus now she decided to apply for a loan to purchase additional fruits to resell.
The other two borrowers are: Phon R. is 40 years old and is selling fruits for a profit. She needs a loan to buy more kinds of fruit for sale. Sar S. is 29 years old and is selling electronic materials. She requests a loan to purchase piglets to raise.
They all live in Odombang Commune in Battambang Province.

loan.use: To purchase additional fruits for sale

loan.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Bourj el Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with her husband and their four children. She has been doing handicrafts for twenty-two years. She does crochet and some woolen projects. Salma requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise. Salma has been a microcredit client for three years now and has always paid on time.
The loan had a good influence on her and her family's lifestyle. Salam is special for her work because her business is rare. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She decided to do this business in order to help support her family.

loan.use: Salma needs the loan to purchase materials

loan.name: Vong's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan that has five people . Mrs. K. is one of the group and is selected to be the group leader. Mrs. K., 56, sells vegetables in the market, while her husband, Mr. Heu Sok, grows vegetables to sell. They both work hard everyday and can earn around $2 per day. K. has four children; one is married and three are single, working as construction workers and helping to support the family's living conditions.
To improve vegetable growing and increase their income, K. would like to ask for a loan to purchase a pump machine (for irrigation). Other members: Mrs. Vong D., 38, who sells souvenirs. She needs a loan purchase more products to sell. Mr. Srun O., 45, sells chinese cakes. She needs a loan run a new business of groceries. Seun C. sells groceries. She needs a loan purchase more groceries to sell. Mrs. Bun S., 27, sells vegetables that she grows. She needs a loan to buy a pump machine. Mrs. K. was not available for photographing and her husband was instead.

loan.use: purchase a pump machine for water to irrigate

loan.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
This small loan request is being made by three borrowers, all residents of Kandal Province. The group leader, Mrs. S. K., is 45 years old and a widow. She runs a small restaurant and sells boiled eggs and roasted sausages to neighbors. She can earn average of $3 per day, and has been doing this since 2005. She is responsible for five children, all of whom are single. To help provide more for the family, one daughter is working as a garment worker. K. is applying for a loan to buy furniture to use in the family home.
The another two borrowers are: Pheng C. is age 22 and is single. She is a garment worker who is requesting a loan for her sister to use as capital to expand her business. Bou S. A. is 56 years old and makes a living selling rice and foods. She requests a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her family to ride.

loan.use: To buy furniture to use in family home

loan.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady N., 55 ans, mariÃ©e, 08 enfants et 03 autres en charge est membre du banc villageois de Khodoba depuis 5 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de cola, de petit cola et de gÃ¢teaux. Khady participe Ã la dÃ©pense quotidienne de sa famille Elle sollicite un prÃªt qui sera remboursÃ© au bout de six mois en une seule Ã©chÃ©ance.
texts.en:
55-year-old Khady N. is married and has three children in her care in addition to her own eight. She has been a member of the Khodoba village bank for five and a half years. Khady wants to bolster her trade in kola nuts, petit kola nuts and cakes. She shares in the daily expenditures for her family, and is asking for a loan that will be repaid in a lump sum payment at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase and sale of kola nuts, petit kola nuts and cakes

loan.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa N., 53 ans, mariÃ©e, 09 enfants et 01autre en charge est membre du banc villageois de Khodoba depuis 4 ans. Elle veut renforcer son petit commerce de fruits locaux et saisonniers (orange, clÃ©mentine, mandarine).Ses revenus lui permettent de participer Ã lâ€™amÃ©lioration des conditions de vie de sa famille Elle sollicite un prÃªt qui sera remboursÃ© au bout de six mois en une seule Ã©chÃ©ance.
texts.en:
53-year-old Awa N. is married and cares for one child in addition to nine children of her own. She has been a member of the Khodoba village bank for four years. Awa wants to bolster her small business in local and seasonal fruit (oranges, tangerines and mandarin oranges). The income permits her to share in improving her familyâ€™s standard of living. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid in a lump sum at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase and resale of local and seasonal fruit

loan.name: Seynabou Ablaye

texts.fr: Seynabou Ablaye, 45 ans, mariÃ©e, 08 enfants et 02 autres en charge est membre du banc villageois de Khodoba depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son petit commerce de fruits locaux et saisonniers (orange, clÃ©mentine, mandarine).Ses revenus lui permettent de participer Ã lâ€™amÃ©lioration des conditions de vie de sa famille Elle sollicite un prÃªt qui sera remboursÃ© au bout de six mois en une seule Ã©chÃ©ance.
texts.en:
Seynabou Ablaye, age 45, is married and has eight children, plus two others in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of Khodoba for seven years. She wants to bolster her small-scale scale business in local and seasonal fruit (oranges, clementines, mandarin oranges). Her income helps her improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To sell local seasonal fruit

loan.name: Fatou Adama

texts.fr: Fatou Adama C., 44 ans, mariÃ©e, 07 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Mbirdiam depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son activitÃ© de vente de fruits (orange, mandarine, pastÃ¨que) et lÃ©gumes. Ses revenus lui permettent dâ€™aider Ã la prise en charge des Ã©tudes de ses enfants des conditions de vie de sa famille Elle sollicite un prÃªt qui sera remboursÃ© au bout de six mois en une seule Ã©chÃ©ance.
texts.en:
Fatou Adama C., age 44, is married and has seven children to look after. She has been a member of the village loan group of Mbirdiam for seven and a half years. She wants to bolster her business selling fruit (oranges, mandarin oranges, watermelon) and vegetables. Her income helps her to address the school fees for her children and her family's living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To sell fruit and vegetables

loan.name: Maty

texts.fr: Maty F. est membre du banc villageois de Mbirdiam depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son activitÃ© de vente de fruits saisonniers (orange, mandarine, pastÃ¨que). Ses revenus lui permettent de participer Ã lâ€™amÃ©lioration des conditions de vie de sa famille Elle sollicite un prÃªt qui sera remboursÃ© au bout de six mois en une seule Ã©chÃ©ance.
texts.en:
Maty F. has been a member of the village association of Mbirdiam for seven and a half years. She wants to bolster her business selling seasonal fruit (oranges, mandarin oranges, watermelon). Her income helps her to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To sell seasonal fruit

loan.name: Yacine

texts.fr: Yacine D., 49 ans, mariÃ©e est membre du banc villageois de Mbirdiam depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter et revendre des fruits saisonniers (orange, mandarine, pastÃ¨que). Ses revenus lui permettent de participer Ã lâ€™amÃ©lioration des conditions de vie de sa famille Elle sollicite un prÃªt qui sera remboursÃ© au bout de six mois en une seule Ã©chÃ©ance.
texts.en:
Yacine D. is 49 years old, married, and has been a member of the Mbirdiam village bank for 7 and a half years. She wants to buy and sell seasonal fruits (oranges, mandarins, watermelons). The money she makes helps to improve the living conditions of her family. She is requesting a loan to be repaid in one lump sum at the end of 6 months.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy seasonal fruit for resale: oranges, mandarins, and watermelons

loan.name: Martha Cristina

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Martha Cristina T. B. tiene la edad de 38 aÃ±os, su estado civil es soltera, DoÃ±a Martha tiene 1 hija de la edad de 15 aÃ±os que cursa recientemente el 3 aÃ±o de secundaria, sus propÃ³sitos son de mantener activo su negocio por lo que necesita sacar adelante su familia sus deseos son de hacer crecer su empresa de tortillas para tener cada dÃ­a mas ingresos para darle mejor mantenimiento a su negocio y en su casa de habitaciÃ³n y proporcionarle a su hija un porvenir lleno de estudios para que el dÃ­a de maÃ±ana sea una profesional y pueda salir adelante en la vida ante cualquier situaciÃ³n sus sueÃ±os son de viajar al extranjero para darle a conocer la calidad del producto que ella produce como lo son las tortillas y mostrarle a las personas que se encarga de brindar la ayuda para los respectivos financiamiento.
La actividad econÃ³mica es la venta y elaboraciÃ³n de tortillas, la ubicaciÃ³n es el mercado central y en su casa de habitaciÃ³n, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 20 aÃ±os, sus inicios del negocio se dan por su Mama quien era la pionera en este negocio pero debido a la edad de ella decide dejar el negocio en las manos de su hija y es asÃ­ como obtiene quedarse con el negocio y los vecinos ivan en busca del producto por lo que tambiÃ©n se quedo con los clientes de su Mama y ahora trata rebuscar el fondo suficiente para mantener este negocio y no perderlo ya que este le proporciona los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia y los compromisos contraÃ­dos con la FundaciÃ³n LeÃ³n 2000, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que realiza las compras de su materia prima como lo es maÃ­z, leÃ±a y cal por lo que tiene que recurrir a los diferentes lugares para buscar toda la materia prima necesaria
texts.en:
Martha Cristina T. B. is 38 years old and single. Martha has a 15-year old daughter who is in her 3rd year of high school. She wants to keep her business going because she needs to improve her family's situation. She wants to expand her tortilla business in order to make more money every day so that she can make improvements to her business and to her home as well as to ensure that her daughter can continue her studies, that she may one day have a career and make a good future for herself. She dreams of travelling abroad to show others the quality of her tortillas, especially to those who have supported her by lending to her. She prepares and sells tortillas in the main market and in her home. She has been doing so for 20 years. Her mother started the business but due to her age she decided to leave the business in her daughter's hands and this is how Martha ended up in the business. She sells to her neighbours and to her mother's customers and is now trying to get working capital to keep the business and not lose it as it is the business which provides the income necessary to support her family and to repay the commitments she has made to FundaciÃ³n LeÃ³n 2000. The loan is for working capital so that she can purchase raw materials such as corn, wood, and lime as she has to source the materials from a number of different places.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Erika Lissette

texts.es:
La Joven Erika Lissete Manzanares R. tiene la edad de 27 aÃ±os, su estado civil es acompaÃ±ada ella tiene 2 hijos de las edades de 7 aÃ±os su hijo mayor y cursa el 2 grado de primaria y su hija de 3 aÃ±os que recientemente no estudia, su compaÃ±ero de vida labora como taxista, sus propÃ³sitos son de prosperar en su negocio para que este en un futuro pueda ampliarse mas en sus deseos esta predominar en su negocio a pesar de la competencia que existe y acumular a un sin numero de clientes y sus sueÃ±os son de proporcionarle a sus hijos una casa propia donde puedan vivir con las condiciones adecuadas y no sufran necesidades para el dÃ­a de maÃ±ana.
Su actividad econÃ³mica es el destace de cerdo, la ubicaciÃ³n de su negocio es en el reparto Rigoberto LÃ³pez PÃ©rez capilla santa Ana Â½ al sur, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 4 aÃ±os, ella inicia este negocio por que en su familia ya existÃ­a este oficio ya que su tÃ­o fue el que se encargo para que aprendiera este oficio y a la edad de de 25 aÃ±os decide independizarse y establecer su propio negocio y al principio no le resulto muy fÃ¡cil por lo que tenia que realizarlo ella sola pero mas tarde consigue adaptarse a este negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que realizarÃ­a las compras de mas cerdos ya que tiene que buscar donde le oferten de forma mas favorable para escoger a los cedos.
texts.en:
Erika Lissete Manzanares R. is 27 years old and in a relationship. She has 2 children: a son age 7 who is in grade 2 and a 3-year old daughter who does not attend school yet. Her partner is a taxi driver. Her goal is to have a successful business in order to expand it in the future. She wants to dominate in business despite stiff competition and have a large customer base. Her dream is to provide her children with their own home where they can have good living conditions and not lack for basic necessities in the future. She has been in business selling pork for 4 years in "Rigoberto LÃ³pez PÃ©rez capilla santa Ana Â½ al sur". She started the business as her family worked in this business which her uncle taught her. She decided to open her own business at the age of 25, which was not easy in the beginning as she had to do everything on her own but got used to it in time. The loan is for working capital so that she can buy more pork as she is looking for a less expensive supplier.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital

loan.name: Rokhaya

Su actividad econÃ³mica es la venta de desayunos y almuerzo: huevos enteros, tacos, gallo pinto, bistec, arroz, frijoles y maduro, la ubicaciÃ³n de su negocio es en el mercado Santos Barcenas, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 8 aÃ±os, su negocio inicio por cuenta propia y decide realizar la venta de comida en el mercado y comienza instalando una vitrina cocinando cosas sencillas como huevo y gallo pinto y al ver que tuvo la repuesta de los clientes decide invertir mas en su negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita invertir en la compra de arroz, gaseosa y carne para ofrecer una variedad de comidas.
texts.en:
Carla Mariela RÃ­os C. is 31 years old. She has a partner and a 14 years old daughter that is attending her 3 year in secondary school. Her partner works a driver. Her dream is to open a better place to server her food, so she can make a better impression on her customers. She would like to keep her business active so she can continue making a good income. She also wants to provide a good education for her daughter so she can become a professional in the future. She sells breakfast and lunch packs: boiled eggs, tacos, beans and rice, steak, and others. Her business is located at the Santos Barcenas market. Sheâ€™s owned this business for 8 years. She decided to start this business on her own installing a small counter at the market where she used to cook simple meals such as eggs and beans and rice, but as the business stated to grow she decided to invest more money on it. Financing will be used for work capital as she needs to invest the money to purchase rice, sodas and offer a larger variety of food.

Myra Lorena GÃ³mez Torrez is 40 years old. She is married and has two children, a 13 year old girl attending her 3rd year in secondary school and a boy of 5 attending his 1st grade in primary school. Myraâ€™s husband has an agency in the city of Guasaule. Her goal is to increase her sales to keep her business active so she can continue helping her dependent children. She wants to provide them with a better education so they can become professionals in the future so they donâ€™t have to face great problems. Sheâ€™s owned a bookstore and video store for 5 years. Her shop is located at ENITEL, 2 blocks west half block south. She stated this business on her own as she needed a job and she requested for a loan to keep it active. De joven el Sr Demecio trabajÃ³ por mucho tiempo en una entidad publica ,mÃ¡s adelante viajo a la Argentina en busca de trabajo ya que en nuestro paÃ­s eran muy pocas las posibilidades y allÃ­ conociÃ³ a la Sr. a Celsa su actual esposa trabajaron arduamente y lograron reunir un poco de capital y volvieron al Paraguay , mandaron a construir una pequeÃ±a casita y dieron inicio a una pequeÃ±a curtiembre donde hacÃ­an compra de cuero vacuno y equino crudo que los procesa y lo vuelven a vender, Gracias a este trabajo y al esfuerzo de los dos pudieron comprar varias maquinarias para el trabajo y tambiÃ©n una camioneta para transportar su producto. Solicita el crÃ©dito para compra de mÃ¡s cuero.
texts.en:
Demecio Alfredo is 52 years old, a native of the city of Carapegua, and has been married to Celsa EspÃ­nola, age 58, for more than 24 years. They have 2 children: one is 24 years old and a professional, the other is still in high school and also helps his father in the tannery. When Demecio was a young man, he worked for a long time for an organization. He later traveled to Argentina in search of work as there were very few job opportunities in our country. There, he met Celsa, his wife, and they worked very hard and were able to save a little money to return to Paraguay where they had a small house built and opened a small tannery. They buy cattle and horse leather and process it to sell. Thanks to their hard work they have been able to buy machinery for their business as well as a van to transport their product. They are asking for a loan to purchase more leather.

loan.name: Gladys

SeÃ±ora Gladys C. de Dure is 40 years old and is married to SeÃ±or Alberto Dure Almada. The couple has three children, two of whom are school aged, while the third is now an adult.

Gladys says that thanks to the sacrifices she has made, she has been able to achieve many of her goals.

In addition to traveling to sell her wares on the weekends, Gladys has additional income from a small store she runs from her home. Gladys's whole family works hard so that they can get ahead in life.

Lina worked as a domestic employee and Francisco worked as a bricklayer. They worked tirelessly and successfully gathered important capital necessary to allow them to return to their country. Upon their return they searched for business to invest in and with the income be able to survive. They were give an opportunity with a small general store that sustains their family to this day.
