La seÃ±ora Lucila es propietaria de una Despensa con CarnicerÃ­a que posee en su domicilio desde hace varios aÃ±os, y es atendida por ella misma. Esta actividad a ella le permite criar y educar a sus hijos, cubrir todos los gastos que se presentan en el hogar y mediante esto llevar una vida digna y sin preocupaciones, ya que desde que su esposo ha fallecido ella ha tenido que luchar sola para poder salir adelante. Su madre, quien vive en el mismo lugar, es una docente jubilada que tambiÃ©n le apoya en todo momento.
Esta seÃ±ora actualmente esta solicitando el crÃ©dito para surtir mÃ¡s su negocio con mercaderÃ­as para la temporada de fin de aÃ±o, ya que en la zona tiene mucha clientela que constantemente esta acudiendo a su comercio para realizar sus compras.
texts.en:
Lucila L. is a widow. She is 30 years old and lives in a house with her parents in the city of General Artigas. She has 2 young children who live with her and are dependent upon her. Lucila owns a grocery store/butcher shop which she opened in her home a number of years ago, and which she takes care of herself. This business allows her to raise and educate her children, pay the household expenses and thus live a respectable life without worries as since her husband's death she has had to fight alone to better her life. Her mother, who lives in the same house, is a retired teacher who supports her in all things. She is requesting this loan in order to stock her business with seasonal New Year's merchandise as she has many clients in the neighbourhood who come to her store to make their purchases.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy a variety of merchandise such as canned items, fresh bread, cider, wine, soda, candy masses, Christmas arrangements, and others.

loan.name: Wilma

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Wilma C. es soltera, tiene 37 aÃ±os y vive en su casa propia en el Barrio San Miguel Cambyreta.
La seÃ±ora Wilma es propietaria de una Despensa que posee en su domicilio desde hace varios aÃ±os y que es atendida por ella misma. Mediante este trabajo ella siempre ha podido salir adelante, cubrir los gastos de hogar y ha ampliado su despensa que cuando inicio era mÃ¡s pequeÃ±a. Sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y trabajan de manera independiente.
Esta seÃ±ora es cliente de la FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya desde hace unos aÃ±os y mediante los crÃ©ditos obtenidos ella ha ido ampliando su capital operativo.
Hoy dÃ­a ella esta solicitando el crÃ©dito para la compra de mÃ¡s mercaderÃ­as por el hecho de que se acerca fin de aÃ±o y necesita surtir mas su comercio, ya que tiene clientes que continuamente se acercan a adquirir sus productos.
texts.en:
Wilma C. is single. She is 37 years old and lives in her own house in the San Miguel Cambyreta neighborhood. Wilma is the owner of a small corner store that she has run herself out of her household for many years. By means of this business, she has always been able to come out ahead, cover the household expenses and expand the store, which was much smaller when she began. Her adult children work independently. She has been a client of FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya for many years and with these loans, she has increased her working capital. Today she is taking out a loan to purchase more merchandise since the end of the year is approaching and she needs to better stock her store, as her clients are constantly purchasing her products.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase various types of merchandise: Christmas items, fruit cakes, pudding, cider, sparkling wines and other products.

loan.name: Valerio

texts.es:
El Sr. Valerio RolÃ³n es comerciante, tiene 54 aÃ±os, es casado, su seÃ±ora se llama Tomasa Villalba quien tiene 46 aÃ±os , tienen 3 hijos.
Valerio decidiÃ³ abrir con la ayuda de su esposa una despensa hace mÃ¡s de 20 aÃ±os en el mercado de la ciudad. Actualmente posee una cantidad importante de clientes y buenos precios en sus mercaderÃ­as ya que los suele adquirir al por mayor.
Valerio pretende utilizar el crÃ©dito para la compra de verduras, aceites, gaseosas, harina, azÃºcar, etc. en gran cantidad y asÃ­ poder ayudar a sus hijos que van a la universidad y precisan del apoyo financiero para poder pagar los costosos estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Mr. Valerio RolÃ³n is a businessman, 54 years old, and married to Tomasa Villalba who is 46 years old. They have 3 children. About 20 years ago, Valerio, with the help of his wife, decided to open a store in the city market. He actually has an significant clientele and great prices on his merchandise since he usually acquires them in bulk. Valerio proposes to use the loan to purchase vegetables, cooking oil, sodas, flour, sugar, etc. in large quantities and thus be able to help his children who attend university and need financial support to be able to pay for their costly university studies.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of vegetables, flour, breads, cooking oil, sodas, etc.

loan.name: Viviana

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Viviana BenÃ­tez es peluquera, tiene 23 aÃ±os, es separada, tiene 1 hijo de 6 aÃ±os de edad, vive con su madre.
Viviana abriÃ³ su propia peluquerÃ­a hace mÃ¡s de dos aÃ±os, luego de mucho sacrificio. Precisa del crÃ©dito para la compra de productos para peluquerÃ­a tales como cremas para el cabello, agua oxigenada , tinturas y asÃ­ poder tener completa su peluquerÃ­a, ya que sus clientes piden a diario mayores atenciones.
texts.en:
Viviana BenÃ­tez is a hairdresser. She is 23 years old, separated, and has a 6-year old son. She lives with her mother. Viviana opened her own hair salon over 2 years ago, after much sacrifice. She says the loan will be used to buy products for her salon such as hair creams, hydrogen peroxide, and dyes so that her hair salon will be well stocked, as her customers are more exacting every day.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy dyes, hydrogen peroxide, and hair creams.

loan.name: Andres

texts.es: AndrÃ©s tiene 44 aÃ±os de edad, estÃ¡ casado con Delci GonzÃ¡lez, quien le ayuda en el negocio, en la venta de productos del hogar casa por casa, viven en casa propia, tienen un hijo de 10 aÃ±os quien estÃ¡ en la escuela. AndrÃ©s estuvo trabajando desde muy joven como vendedor ambulante de su padre, y despuÃ©s varios aÃ±os se compro para su motocicleta, y asÃ­ se independizÃ³ de su padre. AndrÃ©s comienza su trabajo todos los dÃ­as a las 5:00 am recorriendo varios kilÃ³metros en su motocicleta realizando las ventas casa por casa. Actualmente trabaja con Ã©l dos sobrinos a quien les remunera por los servicios realizados y cuenta con clientela formada. Necesita el crÃ©dito para la compra de una motocicleta.
texts.en:
AndrÃ©s is 44 years old and married to Delci GonzÃ¡lez who helps him in his business, selling household products door to door. They live in their own house and have a 10-year old son who attends school. AndrÃ©s has been working as a street vendor since he was very young, working with his father, and after several years he bought a motorcycle and became independent. AndrÃ©s starts work each day at 5:00 A.M. travelling many kilometres on his motorcycle in order to sell door to door. His 2 nephews are currently working for him, for which they get paid a commission for their sales and for new clients. He needs the loan in order to buy a motorcycle.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy a motorcycle to continue working.

loan.name: Andres

texts.es: Andres tiene 55 aÃ±os de edad, estÃ¡ casado con Soriana Cabral, quien le ayuda en los quehaceres domesticos, tienen 5 cinco hijos, dos de los cuales ya son profesionales, y los otros trabajan con Ã©l. AndrÃ©s se dedica a la producciÃ³n y comercializaciÃ³n del carbÃ³n. Andres heredÃ³ la profesiÃ³n de su padre con quien estuvo trabajando desde muy joven. Empieza a las 5:00 am repartiendo sus productos en una motocicleta en las principales despensas de su comunidad. Necesita el crÃ©dito para la compra de materia prima (leÃ±as).
texts.en:
Andres is 55 years old and married to Soriana Cabral who helps with the household chores. They have 5 children, 2 of whom have careers and the others work with him. AndrÃ©s makes and sells charcoal. AndrÃ©s inherited the business from his father with whom he worked from a very young age. He starts work at 5:00 A.M. delivering his products by motorcycle to the main grocery stores of his community. He needs the loan in order to buy raw materials (wood).

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy raw materials (wood) to make charcoal.

loan.name: Antonia

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Delia Antonia GonzÃ¡lez ,es una persona trabajadora, con esfuerzo y dedicaciÃ³n criÃ³ sola 2 hijos, ademÃ¡s cuenta con casa propia. Generalmente, busca lugares estratÃ©gicos para abrir su micro empresa y asÃ­ obtener muchas ventas, estos lugares generalmente son cercas de colegios o talleres de autos y son visitados por ellas, una vez que obtiene clientela lo transporta en forma de viandas a sus clientes sus productos y trata de hacer algÃºn agregado mas , para que no sea solamente comidas, es como un menÃº o un combo y asÃ­ ganarse mas clientela y a mantener tambiÃ©n.
texts.en:
Delia Antonia GonzÃ¡lez is a hard-working person who with effort and dedication has raised her 2 children on her own, as well as owning her own home. She generally searches for strategic locations to open her small business and in this manner makes many sales. Her locations are usually near schools or car workshops which generate many clients. Once she has customers buying her food, she tries to partner the food so that she is not selling by item but rather a meal or combo and thereby attracting more customer and keeping the customers she already has.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy an assortment of drinks and raw materials such as meat, flour, oil, etc.

loan.name: Enrique

texts.es: Enrique Javier A. es un muchacho joven ,tiene apenas 20 aÃ±os, emprendedor con la ayuda de sus padres tiene su propia micro empresa,y 12 personas trabajando en la misma, su sueÃ±o mas grande es comprarse el local donde tiene su negocio, que queda cerca de un mercado municipal mas grande de Asuncion. Esta estudiando en la universidad,y se hizo una promesa a si mismo de que llegarÃ­a muy alto, para lo cual debe ser organizado, disciplinado y responsable.
texts.en:
Enrique Javier A. is a young man barely 20 years old. With his parents' help, this entrepreneur has his own small business employing 12 people. His greatest dream is to buy the building where he has his business as it is near the largest municipal market in Asuncion. He is studying at university and has promised himself that he will go far in life, for which he needs to be organized, disciplined, and responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy graphic equipment, 1 machine.

loan.name: Marcia

texts.es: Marcia tiene 43 aÃ±os, es madre de una hija quien cursa estudios universitarios y vive junto a su esposo quien le ayuda en lo posible. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, en las instalaciones de su vivienda, esta labor la viene realizando desde hace 2 aÃ±os atrÃ¡s, y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es conocer mucha gente, con quienes trata sobre diferentes temas. Este negocio le es rentable porque ella no paga alquiler de local, ademÃ¡s, cuenta con una clientela selecta y fiel a su bodega. Este es su 4to prÃ©stamo con MFP, demostrando responsabilidad en sus pagos en los crÃ©ditos anteriores. Con el dinero que solicita ampliarÃ¡ su tienda y comprarÃ¡ mÃ¡s productos para surtir mejor sus estantes.
texts.en:
Marcia is 43 years old and has a daughter studing in university. She lives with her husband who helps her as much as he can. She sells groceries and staple products from her home. She has been in business for 2 years and she enjoys meeting all the people with whom she can speak about all sorts of topics. The business is profitable because she does not have to pay rent for the premises, in addition she has a good customer base who are faithful to her store. This is her 4th loan with MFP; she has shown that she is responsible with her previous loans. She will use this loan to expand her store and purchase more products in order to better stock the shelves.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To increase the products of her store.

loan.name: Aurora

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Aurora tiene 46 aÃ±os, es madre de 7 hijos, siendo 4 de ellos independientes, viviendo en la actualidad con 3 de ellos que estudian, trabajan y la apoyan mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para niÃ±os, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 5 aÃ±os atrÃ¡s. Le gusta su trabajo porque conoce muchas personas y diferentes lugares. AdemÃ¡s, le es rentable, porque sus prendas de vestir las lleva a vender por diferentes lugares y le genera regulares ingresos, le va bien. Este es su 7mo prÃ©stamo con MFP, y hasta el momento ha sido puntual con sus cuotas. Con el dinero solicitado quiere comprar mÃ¡s ropa, y complementar su negocio con la venta de zapatos, ya que sus clientes lo solicitan.
texts.en:
Aurora is 46 years old and is the mother of 7 children, 4 of whom are independent and 3 who currently live with her, attend school, work and help her very much. She has been selling children's clothing for 5 years. She enjoys her work because she meets many people and goes to many places. In addition, her business is profitable because she brings her clothes to different places to sell and it gives her a regular income. Business is good. This is her 7th loan with MFP, and up to now she has been punctual with her payments. She will buy more clothing with this loan, and add to her business by selling shoes because this is what her customers have requested.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy more clothing for resale, as well as shoes.

loan.name: Darwin

texts.es: Darwin tiene 32 aÃ±os, vive con su conviviente y sus tres hijos quienes son su mayor inspiraciÃ³n de seguir trabajando arduamente. Se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace 10 aÃ±os, y gracias a su buena administraciÃ³n del dinero ahora es propietario de un motocarro, el cual le ayuda a fortalecer la economÃ­a de su hogar. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es el trato directo que tiene con sus pasajeros, ademÃ¡s le es rentable porque Ã©l mismo es el chofer y no tiene que pagar un sueldo adicional. Este es su 3er prÃ©stamo con MFP, demostrando ser un cliente puntual en sus cuotas de pago. Con el dinero solicitado comprarÃ¡ repuestos para mandar a reparar su motocarro.
texts.en:
Darwin is 32 years old, lives with his common-law partner and his 3 children who are his main inspiration to continue working hard. He has been transporting passengers for 10 years and due to his sound money management he now owns a motocar which helps to increase his household income. What he enjoys most about his work is the direct contact he has with his passengers. His business is profitable because he himself is the driver and there is no need to pay an additional salary. This is his 3rd loan with MFP. He has proven himself to be punctual in his loan repayments. He will use the loan to buy spare parts to repair his motocar.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy spare parts for his motocar

loan.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther tiene 44 aÃ±os, es madre de dos hijos en edad escolar, vive con su esposo quien la apoya en sus metas trazadas. Ella se dedica a vender gaseosas y cervezas, esto lo viene realizando desde hace ya 3 aÃ±os atrÃ¡s, para lo cual le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atenciÃ³n a sus clientes. AdemÃ¡s le es rentable por encontrarse ubicada en una buena zona, lo difÃ­cil para ella es no contar con un local adecuado para la atenciÃ³n a sus clientes, ya que lo hace a las afueras de su vivienda. Este es su 4to prÃ©stamo con MFP, siendo puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita mandarÃ¡ a construir un local adecuado para la venta de sus bebidas, y ambientarlo adecuadamente para la atenciÃ³n a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Esther is 44 years old and the mother of 2 school-aged children. She lives with her husband who supports her in her goals. She has been selling soft drinks and beer for 3 years and business is very good. She very much enjoys taking good care of her customers. The business is profitable because it is located in a good spot. She says that her greatest difficulty lies in not having an adequate locale to server her clients as the business is not based in her house. This is her 4th loan with MFP; she has been punctual with her payments. She will use the loan to build an approprate locale for the sale of her refreshments and to create an appropriate environment for the care of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To build a dedicated locale for her business

loan.name: Hildebrando

texts.es: Hildebrando es padre soltero, vive con sus dos hijos quienes estudian y lo apoyan mucho. Su dedicaciÃ³n constante en el cultivo de yuca, plÃ¡tano, maÃ­z, arroz y otras variedades, la viene realizando desde hace mÃ¡s de 15 aÃ±os. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es tener en buenas condiciones sus productos para luego llevarlos a vender a un buen precio. Le es rentable porque cuenta con clientes quienes estÃ¡n al pendiente de sus productos para comprarlos, por lo que le va muy bien. Este es su 5to prÃ©stamo con MFP, y durante este tiempo ha demostrado ser puntual y responsable en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprarÃ¡ mÃ¡s granos para sembrar, ademÃ¡s, quiere mandar a cercar una parte de sus parcelas para que estÃ©n protegidos sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Hildebrando is a single father who lives with his 2 children who are in school and are of great support. For more than 15 years, he has been cultivating cassava, banana, maize, rice and other varieties. What he likes about his work is to have good produce in order to sell them for a good price. His business is profitable because he has customers who are waiting to buy his products, and so it is doing very well. This is his 5th loan with MFP and he has shown himself to be punctual and responsible in his payments. With the loan money, he will purchase more grain to sow as well as fence part of his plots of land so that his crops will be protected.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy more seed to sow

loan.name: Humberto

texts.es: Humberto tiene 40 aÃ±os de edad, vive con su conviviente y sus dos hijos, quienes lo motivan dÃ­a a dÃ­a a seguir trabajando duro. El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte pÃºblico desde hace 8 aÃ±os atrÃ¡s, Humberto trabaja durante todo el dÃ­a, a razÃ³n de sacar adelante a sus hijos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares y trata con personas que le enseÃ±an tÃ©cnicas y estrategias de trabajo. AdemÃ¡s le es rentable, ya que Ã©l mismo maneja su motocarro. Las dificultades se presentan cuando su vehÃ­culo sufre desperfectos. Este es su 6to prÃ©stamo con MFP, siendo una persona responsable en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado quiere mandar a reparar su herramienta de trabajo y comprar algunos repuestos para trabajar tranquilo y sin preocupaciones.
texts.en:
Humberto is 40 years old and lives with his wife and their two children, who motivate him day after day to continue working hard. He is dedicated to offering public transportation service and has been since eight years ago. Humberto works all day, for the sake of his children. The thing he likes about his work is that he knows a lot of places and he works with people who teach him techniques and strategies for his job. Furthermore, it is profitable for him since he is the one who drives his motocart. He has difficulties when his vehicle gets damaged. This is his sixth loan with MFP and he is a responsible person in his payments. With the money requested, he wants to send his vehicle for repairs and buy some spare parts so he can work peacefully and without worries.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Repair his motocart.

loan.name: Blanca

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Blanca CalderÃ³n tiene 37 aÃ±os, es soltera, pero vive en pareja con quien tiene dos hijas menores de edad y se encuentra viviendo en alquiler desde hace mÃ¡s de 5 aÃ±os en el mismo lugar, el marido tambiÃ©n le ayuda en el negocio que es un bar-copetin , posee una amplia clientela porque la zona en la que se encuentra es muy poblada y concurrida que es el Mercado Municipal NÂº 4, donde ofrece sus servicios de comida tambien en mayor cantidad a sus paisanos que viven por la zona. Desea invertir en la compra de mÃ¡s insumos para comestibles como pollos, carnes, harinas, aceites y bebidas en general. Una de sus aspiraciones es poder ampliar prÃ³ximamente su negocio en lo que se refiere al equipamiento y mobiliario y poder ofrecer un ambiente mÃ¡s cÃ³modo y ameno a sus clientes.
texts.en:
SeÃ±ora Blanca CalderÃ³n is 37 years old and single, but she lives with her partner with whom she has two young daughters. They live in a rental property and have been at the same place for five years. Her partner also helps her in the business, which is an aperitif bar. She has a large clientele because the area in which she is located is very crowded and busy. It is in the Town Market NÂº 4, where she offers her food services as well to the residents that live in the area. She wants to invest in purchasing the ingredients for foods, like chicken, meat, wheat, oil, and drinks. One of her aspirations is to be able to soon make her business larger with respect to her work equipment and its furniture, so that she can provide a more comfortable and pleasant environment.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy chicken, meat, oils, wheat, and drinks.

loan.name: Isis

texts.es: Isis tiene 30 aÃ±os, vive con sus 4 hijos y su conviviente quien le ayuda en lo posible. Su dedicaciÃ³n a la venta de comida logrÃ³ que implementara en su propio domicilio un espacio para su negocio, por la misma razÃ³n que sus clientes le exigieron que ampliara, y ella por su buena atenciÃ³n y sazÃ³n, se ganÃ³ el cariÃ±o y respeto de sus comensales, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace un aÃ±o, y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar bien para que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos. AdemÃ¡s, le es rentable, ya que se encuentra ubicada en un buen lugar. Este es su 3er prÃ©stamo con MFP, y ha sido puntual en sus crÃ©ditos anteriores. Con el dinero que solicita quiere comprar mesas y sillas, para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Isis is 30 years old and lives with her four children and her husband, who helps her wherever possible. She is dedicated to selling food, which she does in her own home in a space made for her business. This is the reason why her clients demanded her to increase the space. Through her good attention and flavor, she won the affection and respect of her guests. She has been doing this activity since a year ago, and the thing she likes about her work is cooking so well that her clients feel satisfied. Furthermore, it is profitable for her since she is located in a good place. This is her third loan with MFP, and she has been punctual in her previous loans. With the money that she requests, she wants to buy tables and seats in order to give a better reception to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy seats and tables for her food sales business.

loan.name: Jabier

texts.es: Jabier tiene 33 aÃ±os, vive junto a su esposa y a sus 3 hijos en edad escolar y son su razÃ³n de salir al frente laboralmente. El se dedica a la compra y venta de yuca, producto que consigue durante las madrugadas en el puerto fluvial de su regiÃ³n. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 6 aÃ±os atrÃ¡s. Lo que le gusta de este trabajo es que le genera muchos ingresos, tambiÃ©n le agrada dar una buena atenciÃ³n y convencer a sus clientes para que le compren. Para poder vender sus yucas se encuentra ubicado en una buena zona del mercado, le va muy bien. Es la primera vez que solicita un prÃ©stamo con MFP. Y con el dinero requerido construirÃ¡ un almacÃ©n para tener sus productos en un lugar seguro y cÃ³modo.
texts.en:
Jabier is 33 years old and lives with his wife and 3 school-aged children who are his motivation to go to work. He buys and sells cassava which he gets in the morning in the river port of his region. He has been doing this for 6 years. He likes that this work pays well and enjoys taking care of his customers and convincing them to buy his cassava. He is well situated in the marketplace to sell his cassava, and business is good. This is his first loan with MFP. He will use the loan money to build a warehouse in order to keep his products safe and handy.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To build a warehouse for his produce.

loan.name: Inocencia

texts.es: La seÃ±orita Inocencia OtazÃº tiene 24 aÃ±os, es soltera, pero vive en pareja con quien tiene 1 hijo menor de edad y posee casa propia que heredÃ³ de sus padres, se iniciÃ³ en su actividad desde muy joven a partir de los 16 aÃ±os, que es la compra-venta de artÃ­culos de mercerÃ­a como zapatos para damas, blusas, bijouteries varios y otros artÃ­culos de temporada, su capital incial fue de Gs. 500.000.- que fue ampliando con el correr de los aÃ±os y fue progresando gracias a la buena administraciÃ³n en sus negocios, ahora posee buen capital de giro y sigue creciendo por la gran demanda de sus clientes de varios aÃ±os, desea invertir siempre para la compra de mÃ¡s prendas de temporada. Inocencia OtazÃº desea invertir en el futuro para la refacciÃ³n de su vivienda y ofrecer mÃ¡s comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Inocencia OtazÃº is 24 years old, single but living with a partner with whom she has a young child. She owns her own home, inherited from her parents. She has been working since she was quite young, from the time she was 16, buying and selling clothing and shoes for ladies, blouses, costume jewelry and other seasonal articles. Her initial investment in the business was Gs. 500.000 - which has appreciated with the passing years and continues to improve thanks to her good management. She now has good working capital and continues to expand due to high demand from clients of all ages. She wishes to invest in the purchase of more seasonal clothing. Innocence OtazÃº wants to invest in the future by renovating her home and providing more convenience to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy ladies' shoes, blouses, shorts, costume jewelry.

loan.name: Joel

texts.es: Joel tiene 33 aÃ±os de edad, es padre de tres hijos y vive junto a su conviviente quien lo ayuda mucho, sobre todo en su chacra. Se dedica al cultivo de maÃ­z y arroz, como tambiÃ©n crÃ­a ganado, este arduo trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace 3aÃ±os y lo que le gusta es cuidar bien sus cultivos y a sus animales, para que por su buena apariencia sean comprados a un buen precio. Y como sus productos, una vez en el mercado, son muy requeridos por sus clientes, le va bien. Es la segunda vez que tiene un crÃ©dito con MFP, habiendo sido responsable en sus pagos anteriormente. Con el dinero solicitado comprarÃ¡ mÃ¡s granos para sembrar y abonos (guano y urea) para que sus productos crezcan fuertes.
texts.en:
Joel is 33 years old and the father of three children. He lives with his partner who is hugely helpful to him, above all on their farm. Joel grows maize and rice and raises livestock. He's been doing this difficult work since he was 3 years old. The thing that pleases him most is taking good care of his crops and animals since a good appearance might fetch a better price. And since his products, once in the market, are in much demand by his customers, he's right to take care. This is Joel's second MFP loan, having been responsible in repaying the first loan. He will use the funds to buy seeds and fertilizers (guano and urea) so that his products grow strongly.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy seeds and fertilizers for farming business.

loan.name: Juanita

texts.es: Juanita tiene 24 aÃ±os, es soltera, vive con sus padres quienes se sienten muy orgullosos de tener una hija muy trabajadora. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas regionales en la afueras de su vivienda, esto lo viene realizando desde hace 5 aÃ±os atrÃ¡s y le gusta estar en contacto directo con sus clientes para darles una buena atenciÃ³n. Este negocio le es rentable, ya que se encuentra ubicada en una zona muy transitada, y sus principales consumidores son los chÃ³feres de los camiones de carga que tienen sus paraderos muy cerca. Este es su primer crÃ©dito con MFP, y estÃ¡ comprometido con sus cuotas de pago. Con el dinero que solicita incrementarÃ¡ la cantidad de fruta que vende, ademÃ¡s de iniciar un nuevo negocio de venta de comida.
texts.en:
Juanita is 24 years old, single, and lives with her parents who are very proud of their hard-working daughter. She sells regional fruit in the area outside their home, which she has done for the past five years. She enjoys being in direct contact with her clients to provide the best customer service. Her business is profitable since she is located in a high transit area and her main clients are the truck drivers whose stops are nearby. This is her first loan with MFP and she has committed to making the payments. With the loan money she will increase the amount of fruit she has for sale as well as start a new food selling business.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela CarreÃ³n, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Increase the amount of fruit for sale

loan.name: Leonardo

texts.es: El seÃ±or Leonardo E. tiene 29 aÃ±os, es soltero, vive en pareja con quien tiene 2 hijos y posee casa propia, se iniciÃ³ en su actividad desde muy joven a partir de los 20 aÃ±os, que es la reparaciÃ³n de motos y automÃ³viles, su capital incial fue de Gs. 1.000.000.- que fue ampliando con el correr de los aÃ±os y fue progresando gracias a la buena administraciÃ³n en sus negocios, ahora posee buen capital de giro y sigue creciendo por la gran demanda de sus clientes de varios aÃ±os, desea invertir siempre para la compra de mÃ¡s repuestos, ademÃ¡s de mÃ¡s motos usados y automÃ³viles. El seÃ±or Leonardo E. desea para mÃ¡s adelante invertir en la compra de mÃ¡s automÃ³viles y abrir su propia playa de autos, por la gran demanda de medios de transportes propios a bajo costo.
texts.en:
Mr. Leonardo E. is 29 years old, single, and lives, with his partner with whom he has two children, in his own home. He started his business at the young age of 20, repairing motorcycles and cars, with an initial capital of 1,000,000 guaranÃ­s, which he grew over the years and progressed thanks to his adept business administration. Now he has a good cash flow and continues to grow thanks to the demand of his clients over the years. He wishes to invest in a stock of parts and more used motorcycles and cars. In the future, Leonardo wishes to buy more cars and open his own dealership due to high demand for independent low-cost transportation.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela CarreÃ³n, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy motorcycle parts

loan.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia de 49 aÃ±os de edad, es madre de 3 hijos y vive con su conviviente, quien estÃ¡ de acuerdo con sus propÃ³sitos de negocio. Su dedicaciÃ³n a la venta de abarrotes la viene haciendo desde hace 2 aÃ±os atrÃ¡s, en un pequeÃ±o espacio de su casa. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es tener el trato directo con sus clientes, y darles una buena atenciÃ³n es lo mÃ¡s importante, nos menciona. Este negocio le es muy rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona y le genera buenos ingresos, lo que quiere decir que le va muy bien. Este es su 4to prÃ©stamo con MFP, siendo puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado quiere mandar a ampliar su negocio, y posteriormente llegar a tener su minimarket.
texts.en:
Julia is a 49-year-old mother of three, living with her partner who supports her in her business endeavors. She has been selling groceries and provisions for the past two years from a small space in her home. She enjoys the direct contact with her customers and providing the best customer service is very important to her. She makes a good profit because she is located in a good zone that provides steady business and it is going well. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she has always been prompt with her payments. With the requested funds she will expand her business and later hopes to open her own mini-market.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela CarreÃ³n, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To increase store merchadise

loan.name: Ketly

texts.es: Ketly tiene 22 aÃ±os, es soltero, vive junto a sus padres y hermanos quienes le apoyan en todo. Es propietario de un motocarro, con el que se dedica al transporte de pasajeros por las distintas zonas de su ciudad desde hace un aÃ±o atrÃ¡s. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es entablar relaciÃ³n y darles un buen trato a sus pasajeros, le es muy rentable este trabajo, ya que Ã©l mismo administra sus ganancias diarias y no cuenta con muchas responsabilidades econÃ³micas por el momento; por lo que le va bien laboral y personalmente. Es su primer prÃ©stamo con MFP, y se ha comprometido con su banco comunal para ser puntual con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita repararÃ¡ su moto, tambiÃ©n comprarÃ¡ piezas para armar otro motocarro.
texts.en:
Ketly is 22 years old, single, and lives with his parents and siblings who support him in his endeavors. He owns a motorcar, which for the past year he has used to transport passengers to various corners of the city. He enjoys the personal rapport he establishes with his clients and has earned a good profit with his business. He administers his own daily earnings and does not have much economic overhead right now so he is doing well at work and personally. This is first loan with MFP and he has committed to his communal bank to make the payments timely. With the requested funds he will repair his motorcar and buy spare parts to build up a second one.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela CarreÃ³n, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To repair the motorcar

loan.name: Leonor

texts.es: Leonor tiene 42 aÃ±os, es madre de 3 hijos en edad escolar y vive junto a su esposo quien la ayuda mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y otros accesorios desde hace un aÃ±o atrÃ¡s en forma ambulatoria, su esposo, quien es trabajador independiente la apoya mucho en su negocio. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es levantarse muy temprano a preparar toda su mercaderÃ­a para luego llevarla a vender por los diferentes lugares de su zona, ademÃ¡s, le es rentable porque ya cuenta con una clientela selecta que le compran sus prendas constantemente. Este es su 3er crÃ©dito con MFP, por lo que se compromete nuevamente a ser responsable con sus cuotas de pago. Con el dinero que solicita comprarÃ¡ mÃ¡s prendas, posteriormente le gustarÃ­a acondicionar en su propia casa su tienda de ropa y pasamanerÃ­a, ya que se encuentra ubicada en una zona adecuada para el comercio.
texts.en:
Leonor is a 42-year-old mother of three school aged children and lives with her husband who helps her out quite a bit. For the past year her business has been selling clothing, shoes, and accessories door-to-door. Her husband, who works independently, helps her in her business. She enjoys getting up early to prepare her merchandise to take to various points in her area, which is profitable because she now has a dedicated client base who consistently purchase her wares. This is her third loan with MFP and she has committed to make the payments. With the requested funds she will buy more items and later she would like to build her clothing and lace-work shop in her own home, since she is well-situated for a business locale.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela CarreÃ³n, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To increase the amount of items for sale

loan.name: Sindulfo

texts.es: El seÃ±or Sindulfo S. tiene 44 aÃ±os, es soltero, vive en pareja con quien tiene 2 hijos y posee casa propia, se iniciÃ³ en su actividad desde muy joven a partir de los 15 aÃ±os, que es la compra-venta de lubricantes y aceites para todo tipo de automÃ³viles, su capital incial fue de Gs. 100.000.- que fue ampliando con el correr de los aÃ±os y fue progresando gracias a la buena administraciÃ³n en sus negocios, ahora posee buen capital de giro y sigue creciendo gracias a la gran demanda de sus clientes de varios aÃ±os, desea invertir siempre para la compra de mÃ¡s insumos como lubricantes y aceites, ademÃ¡s de mÃ¡s accesorios para automÃ³viles y motos. El seÃ±or Sindulfo S. desea para mÃ¡s adelante construir otra fosa que le servirÃ¡ para el mantenimiento de los automÃ³viles.
texts.en:
Mr. Sindulfo S. is 44 years old, single, and lives with his partner with whom he has two children and owns his own home. He started his business at the young age of 15, buying and selling lubricants and oils for all types of cars. His initial capital was 100,000 guaranÃ­s, and grew over the years and progressed thanks to his adept business administration. Now he has a good cash flow and continues to grow thanks to the demand of his clients over the years. He plans to invest in the purchase of products such as lubricants and oils as well as spare parts for cars and motorcycles. Mr. S. hopes in the future to build a second shop from which to provide car maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela CarreÃ³n, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy car lubricants, oils and spare parts

loan.name: Lizbeth

texts.es: Lizbeth tiene 35 aÃ±os, es madre de 3 hijos en edad escolar, ademÃ¡s, vive con su conviviente quien estÃ¡ de acuerdo con sus objetivos. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida en las afueras de su casa por las noches, lo viene haciendo desde hace 3 aÃ±os, negocio con el cual estÃ¡ sacando adelante a sus hijos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es preparar bien su comida y que estÃ© al gusto de sus clientes para que los mismos se sientas satisfechos. Le es rentable, ya que cuenta con muchos clientes fieles, ademÃ¡s se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona. Es su 6to prÃ©stamo con MFP, y es una clienta puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita mandarÃ¡ a construir su kiosco para dar una mejor atenciÃ³n a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lizbeth is a 35-year-old mother of three school aged children who lives with her partner, who supports her in her endeavors. Her business is selling food in the evenings from outside of her home, which she has been doing for the past three years and has been helping to support her children. She enjoys preparing the food to her clients' tastes so they come away satisfied. She makes a good profit as she has a loyal client following and she is well-situated. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she has a punctual payment history. With the requested funds she will have a kiosk built from which to better serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela CarreÃ³n, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To build a food-selling kiosk

loan.name: MarÃ­a

texts.es: MarÃ­a es madre soltera, vive con sus tres hijos que son solteros, trabajan y la apoyan mucho. Ella se dedicaba a la crianza de pollos, a razÃ³n de no ser una actividad muy productiva, y tambiÃ©n decidiÃ³ vender bebidas (cervezas y gaseosas), actividad que viene realizando recientemente (2 meses atrÃ¡s), lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atenciÃ³n a sus clientes y mantener amistad con ellos, ademÃ¡s, su nuevo negocio de bebidas es muy rentable, ya que son productos que tiene mucha demanda. Por lo general, le va bien. Con este, suman 10 crÃ©ditos con MFP, y desde que iniciÃ³ su trabajo con su banco comunal, ha demostrado ser responsable y puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita esta vez mandarÃ¡ a construir un local adecuado para la venta de sus bebidas.
texts.en:
Maria is a single mother. She lives with her three single children, who work and help her a lot. She was raising chickens, but because this wasn't very productive, she also decided to sell beverages (sodas and beers), something she started doing just two months ago. The thing she likes about her work is giving her customers good service and maintaining a friendship with them. Besides, her new business of selling drinks is very profitable, as her products are in high demand. In general, it's going well for her. This loan will be her 10th loan from Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma, and since she began working with her communal bank, she has shown herself to be responsible and timely in making payments. With the money she is requesting this time, she will begin construction on a location for her drink sales.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Construction on her place of business

loan.name: Susana

texts.es: La seÃ±orita Susana OtazÃº tiene 23 aÃ±os, es soltera, actualmente no tiene pareja y posee casa propia que adquiriÃ³ con la ayuda de sus padres, se iniciÃ³ en su actividad desde muy joven a partir de los 15 aÃ±os, que es la compra-venta de artÃ­culos de mercerÃ­a como pantalones y jeans para damas, blusas, remeras y otros artÃ­culos de temporada, su capital incial fue de Gs. 800.000.- que fue ampliando con el correr de los aÃ±os y fue progresando gracias a la buena administraciÃ³n en sus negocios, ahora posee buen capital de giro y sigue creciendo por la gran demanda de sus clientes de varios aÃ±os, ella distribuye sus pedidos en su propio medio de transporte que es una moto, desea invertir siempre para la compra de mÃ¡s prendas de temporada. Susana OtazÃº desea invertir en el futuro para la refacciÃ³n de su vivienda, construir un salÃ³n comercial y ofrecer mÃ¡s comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Susana O. is 23 years old, single, has no boyfriend, and has her own home that she bought with the help of her parents. She started her business when she was very young, at the age of 15. She buys and sells merchandise such as slacks and jeans for women, blouses, t-shirts, and other seasonal items. Her initial capital was Gs. 800,000, which has grown over the years and has continued to grow thanks to the good administration of her business. Now she has money going in and out of her business, and it keeps growing because of her customers' demands over the years. Susana delivers her customers' orders with her own form of transportation - a scooter. She always wants to invest in her business to buy more seasonal clothing. Susana O. wants to invest in the future to refurbish her home, build a sales room, and offer her customers more comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy slacks and jeans for women, blouses, t-shirts, and other seasonal items

loan.name: Elvira

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Elvira W. es cliente de la FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya hace 3 aÃ±os, destacÃ¡ndose por su pago excelente, es madre soltera por lo que sus esfuerzos se redoblan por tener el papel de jefa de hogar y no tener otro ingreso para sustentar los gastos de la casa. Se iniciÃ³ en el negocio de compra y venta hace 10 aÃ±os , vendiendo ropa de ocasiÃ³n casa por casa hasta lograr un pequeÃ±o capital para establecerse en su local propio hasta hoy dÃ­a , contando con un amplio stock de mercaderÃ­as varias lo cual le permite mirar con optimismo el periodo de fin de aÃ±o donde hay mas expectativas de ventas.
texts.en:
Elvira W. has been a client of Kiva partner Fundacion Paraguaya for three years, standing out by making her payments well. She is a single mother, which is why she works doubly hard as the head of household. She has no other income to pay for her home's expenses. She began her business of buying and selling 10 years ago, selling, door to door, clothes for various occasions until she earned a little bit of money to set herself up in her own location, where she has been until now, relying on a wide stock of merchandise. This allows her to be optimistic about the end of the year, when there are more expected sales.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase a variety of shoes and items imported from Bolivia for end-of-year sales

loan.name: Rosa

texts.es: La seÃ±orita Rosa P. es soltera , y tiene 30 aÃ±os de edad . El negocio lo tiene muy bien ubicado, zona altamente comercial y su boutique es uno de los comercios mÃ¡s conocidos, se iniciÃ³ con un capital de Gs. 5.000.000.- son $ 1000.- aproximadamente, que fue ampliando con el correr de los aÃ±os ya que cuenta con una amplia clientela, pues la zona en la que se encuentran es muy poblada y muy concurrida. La seÃ±orita Rosa P., retira el prÃ©stamo para la compra de varias mercaderÃ­as como ser: prendas de vestir para damas principalmente, y para la temporada primavera - verano. Una de sus aspiraciones es poder ampliar prÃ³ximamente su negocio, en lo que se refiere al equipamiento o mobiliario para poder ofrecer un ambiente mÃ¡s cÃ³modo y ameno a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Miss Rosa P. is 30-years-old and single. Her boutique has a great location in a very commercial area and is one of the best-known shops. She started out with about 5,000,000 guaranÃ­ ($1000) in capital. Her business has grown over the years and she now enjoys a healthy clientele, since her area is highly populated and bustling. Miss P. will use her loan to purchase merchandise, primarily womenâ€™s clothing, and spring and summer attire. One of her short-term goals is to be able to grow her business by buying equipment and furnishings so she can offer her customers a more pleasant and comfortable atmosphere.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase lingerie, T-shirts, pants, footwear, etc.

loan.name: Jan Mohammad

texts.en:
Jan M. lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has four children, and he runs his general store .He has been involved in this business for more than 6 years and he wants to make his business larger. He needs more money for his business capital to become strong and help his family better.
He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghans for a term of 15 months. He wants to expand and move his business forward, buying the necessity materials and completing his stock for his shop so he can start working even harder.
So Jan M. is very happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan and wants to thank those involved, especially Kiva and all lenders around the world.

loan.use: to expand and make his business progress

loan.name: Fatana Group

texts.en:
Nabela is the group leader of the Fatana group. There are three members in this group. Each of them would like to receive a loan for her own business. Zabida and Zakara want to take a loan for the business of tailoring. Nabela wants to take a loan for her bead business. They all want to see progress in their businesses and to earn more money to support their families better in future.

They want to say that they appreciate these loans people in Afghanistan can use to further their businesses and make larger businesses. They want to thank those involved in the Kiva process to support poor people.

loan.use: to help their businesses progress

loan.name: Khalid

texts.en: Khalid A. is a Tanzania business man. He runs a workshop, making furniture and selling it to customers. He employs three professional carpenters and in total, his business has four employees. The business is located in the Buguruni wood market center and he has been in the business for seven years. He is requesting a loan of TZH 1,400,000 to buy a specialized circular saw to expand his business.

loan.use: To buy new circular saw

loan.name: Jastine

texts.en: Jastine A. is a married Tanzanian man. He runs a business of providing transport services around Dar es Salaam. He has got two mini-buses. The daily business sales for the two mini-buses are Tshs 100,000/=, which amounts to Tshs 3 million per month. From this business income generation he managed to build a residential house. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to keep up his business.

loan.use: To expand his business

loan.name: Salehe

texts.en: Salehe R. is a Tanzanian businessman. He runs a cafÃ© in the Vingunguti area outside Dar es Salaam city shopping center. He has been in the business for more than four years now. He requests a loan of Tshs 1,200,000/= to expand the business so as to meet customer demand.

loan.use: to boost his business

loan.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma Uliza is a Tanzanian micro-businesswoman. She sells clothing in a traditional clothes shop (Kanga and Vitenge) at Buguruni trading center. She purchases her inventory from Mnazi Mmoja wholesale shops and makes other clothes purchases from Kariakoo business center. She derives her income to support her family from the business. She has been in the business for five years now. She requests a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to boost her business.

loan.use: To expand her business

loan.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina S. M. is a Tanzanian woman entrepreneur. She is forty-five years old. She runs a cafÃ© at Ilala in Dar es Salaam city center. Her business is six years old. Income derived from the business is used to feed her family and some for capitalization of her business. She needs a loan of 1,000,000/= to expand her business.

loan.use: To expand her business

loan.name: Hen

texts.en: Hen K. is a widowed 52-year-old living in the Pursat Province. She earns a living by selling Khmer noodles and raising poultry. K. is also a local rice farmer. She earns approximately $10 a day to support her family's living expenses from the businesses she developed beginning in 1979. She has six children, two of whom are single and four of whom are married. To further help meet the family's needs, two of her children are employed as electricians for a company. K. requested a loan of $800 with the goal of purchasing more poultry, including ducks and chickens to raise, as well as a motorcycle to make transportation for the family a bit easier.

loan.use: To purchase more poultry to raise and a motorcycle

loan.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea E. is 54 years old and a resident of the Kompong Tom Province. She makes a living raising pigs which she sells for slaughter in four months time after raising. She has been raising pigs for about a year and is currently earning around $3 a day. E. is married with eight children, four of whom are single and the other four are married. Two of her children are employed as company staff. Her husband is Kan Moeun, aged 51. He is a local rice trader that purchases rice from farmers to sell by using his truck. E. is applying a loan of $1,000 as capital to allow her to save financially in helping her husband to purchase more rice to store and sell and to repair his truck. (E.'s husband appears in the photograph because she was not available)

loan.use: To purchase rice to store and sell and to repair a truck

loan.name: Kum

texts.en: Kum Y. is 32 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province. She is a rice farmer as well as raising pigs at her home to provide income for her family's needs. She currently earns approximately US$ 2 per day and has been running her businesses for more than three years. She takes care of two young children; both of them are single and attend school. Her husband is a construction supervisor who has employees to provide his services. Y. hopes to expand her business and ease the hard physical labor necessary for her farming, thus she needs a loan to buy more piglets to raise and a cow to use for plowing her field.

loan.use: To buy more piglets to raise and a cow for plowing

loan.name: Kalanzi B- Eva Group

texts.en:
Eva A., 35, is a single mother of three and a hairdresser by profession. After attaining a certificate in hairdressing eight years back, she raised some capital and opened up Evaâ€™s Beauty Salon in Kibuli. She is a specialist in plaiting, weaving, treatment, retouching and curling kit. On her price list, plaiting and weaving rank highest at 15,000 Ugandan shillings (about $USD7.50) per head. In the good seasons, like the months of November, December, January, May and August, she makes an average of 200,000 Ugandan shillings per day - a little over $USD100; in lean seasons, she makes UGX20,000.

Eva will use this loan to replenish her stock of cosmetics - hair relaxers, hair treatment, deodorants, perfumes, foundation powders and nail varnishes - and hair additions - afro kinky, hi yaki, babe cut, Abuja braids, pony braids and human hair. Eva wins over her customers by ensuring good services. She works hard to ensure she provides for her family. Her dream is expanding her salon into a modern fully equipped one, hoping that it will yield more income to enable her family to live a good life.

Eva will share this loan with the four other members of her group.

loan.use: To buy additional cosmetics and hair additions for her salon.

loan.name: Kalanzi B-Prescade Group

texts.en:
Just like her other group members, Prescade N., 48, runs a restaurant in Kalanzi zone. With five years' experience in the business, she has gained popularity for her affordable but delicious and mouth-watering dishes. Her menu comprises matooke, katogo, chapatti, posho, rice, lumonde, cassava, vegetables, beef, chicken and fish among others. A plate of food goes for 1,000 Ugandan shillings (about 50 US cents) from which she earns a profit of 300 shillings.

Prescade is using the proceeds of this loan to purchase rice, green bananas for preparing matooke and maize flour for posho. She buys her supplies from Kikubamutwe market. The growth of her business is mainly attributed to good customer relationships and hygiene. She has employed two jovial, young ladies as waitresses.

Prescade is a single mother of six. She dreams of supplying green bananas to the market vendors to supplement her restaurant income. With a stable source of income, her desire will be to see her family prosper in all aspects of life.

Prescade will share this loan with the four other members of her group.

loan.use: To buy rice, green bananas and maize flour.

loan.name: Kalanzi B-Revocate Group

texts.en:
Revocate B. is 30 years old. She is a hardworking and popular fishmonger in Kalanzi zone. Every morning, she travels 15 kilometers to Ggaba â€“ a landing site on the shores of Lake Victoria â€“ to purchase various types of fish such as tilapia, nile perch, mukeene and kolongo. When she gets back to her stall she dries and smokes some of the tilapia and also slices some of the nile perch into small, affordable pieces of various sizes which she later deep fries in the evening from 5pm-9pm, her peak business hours. This is aimed at meeting the diverse tastes and preferences of her customers.

From fish worth 100,000 Ugandan shillings (about USD$50), Revocate gets a profit of 50,000 shillings. At the moment, she is using the loan proceeds to purchase more fish hoping for increased sales and increased profits. She is a married mother of four and she also takes care of her parents. Her ambition is to become a supplier of both fish and green bananas to the market vendors. She hopes that when her dream comes true she will build a modern residence for her family.

Revocate will share this loan with the four other members of her group.

loan.use: To purchase more fish.

loan.name: Kalanzi B-Specioza Group

texts.en:
Specioza N. is a tailor by profession. She is 27 years old, married with two children and a loving guardian to four of her orphaned nephews. She has five years' experience in making ladies garments like gomeses, bitenges and vikoi, including school uniforms for both girls and boys. In most cases, she purchases yards of materials from which she makes various designs of clothes and sells them to the immediate customers. To boost her business, Specioza is using the loan funds to purchase more materials especially silk, cotton and linen to enable her to make many clothes and meet the demands of her customers.

From sales of 60,000 Ugandan shillings (about USD$30) Specioza gets a profit of approximately 20,000 shillings. She plans well for her income and ensures she meets the basic needs of her family alongside her husbandâ€™s contribution. She aspires to open up a boutique selling imported designer wear, hoping that it will yield enough income for her to send her children and nephews to good schools.

Specioza will share this loan with the other members of her group.

loan.use: To purchase more materials especially silk, cotton and linen.

loan.name: Centarl B2- Babra Group

texts.en:
Babra N. runs a restaurant in Kabalagala, a city suburb. She has three years' experience in preparing local dishes like luwombo, matooke, groundnut sauce, smoked fish and beef among others. When she sells food worth 80,000 Ugandan shillings (about USD$40) she gets a profit of approximately 30,000. Babra will use the loan proceeds to purchase rice, flour and cooking oil.

Babra underwent a catering course in Kampala after which her husband raised some capital for her to set up the restaurant. She is a mother of three and also looks after her late sisterâ€™s daughter. Her husband is a supplier of green bananas to market vendors. Her ambition is to venture into selling secondhand shoes imported from abroad. She also desires to send all her children to boarding schools.

Babra will share this loan with the other three members of her group.

loan.use: To purchase rice, flour and cooking oil.

loan.name: Central B2- Safina Group

texts.en:
Safina N., 40, sells vegetables (cabbages, spinach, lettuce, etc.) and fruits (passion fruit, oranges, avocadoes, mangoes, etc.) in Kabalagala market. She purchases her supplies from Owino and Nakasero markets. From sales worth Ush 100,000, she earns a profit of Ush 30,000. Safina is using the loan to purchase Irish potatoes and tomatoes to add to her stock.

She is a hard-working single lady, devoted to her family of 3 children, 2 nephews, and 2 nieces. Her ambition is to source fruits, vegetables, and cereals from upcountry farmers and sell them to retailers in Kampala. She hopes that when the business does well, she will be able to educate her children. Her desire is to see her family prosper.

loan.use: purchasing Irish potatoes and tomatoes

loan.name: Central B2- Sarifa Ahmed Group

texts.en: Sarifa A. is 27 years old, married with 4 children. She has a boutique in kabalagala where she sells both new and 2nd hand clothes for ladies. She purchases her stock from owino market and the numerous shopping arcades in town. From clothes worth Ush 600,000 she earns a profit of Ush 150,000. Sarifa is using the loan to purchase more skirts, blouses, dresses, and suits to meet the rising demands due to her increased customer base. Her prices are fair ands she is so friendly and welcoming to her customers. Her greatest ambition is to purchase her stock directly from Dubai or United Kingdom. She desires to see her children graduate from institutions of higher learning someday.

loan.use: Purchase more skirts, blouses, dresses, and suits.

loan.name: Central B1- Nalugo Victor Group

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Victor N. is a banana vendor in Kabalagala market. She sells two types of bananas, namely bogoya and ndizi. Before she started this business, she used to have a restaurant in the same locality from which she accumulated the capital to start this business. She attracts her customers by ensuring good services, attractive display, healthy fruits and a hygienic environment.

Victor is using this loan to purchase bogoya and ndizi to add to her stock. She purchases the fruits from the Masaka suppliers. When she sells bananas worth 400,000 Ugandan shillings (about USD$200), she earns an average of 100,000 shillings profit. Her ambition is to remain in the same business but as a supplier. Being a single mother of four and a guardian to one orphan, she hopes that when she fulfills her ambition, she will be in a position to educate the five children and offer them a decent home and life.

Victor will share this loan with the other members of her group.

loan.use: To purchase bogoya and ndizi.

loan.name: Central B1-Baluka Betty Group

texts.en:
Betty B. is 45 years of age. She is a widow and a devoted mother of seven children. She is also a caring guardian to two orphans, a niece and a nephew. Betty sells bogoya (ripe bananas) in Kabalagala market. She purchases her stock twice a week from suppliers who source the fruit from Masaka. From stock worth 800,000 (about USD $450) Betty expects a profit of 150,000 shillings.

Based on her 10 years' experience in the business, she attracts and retains customers by being friendly, charming, selling fresh healthy fruits and also by maintaining high standards of cleanliness. She will use this loan to add to her stock of bogoya to increase her income.

Betty has a great ambition: she aspires to be an exporter of fresh fruits to developed countries. Her desire is a peaceful and prosperous family.

Betty will share this loan the other four members of her group.

loan.use: To purchase bogoya ( ripe bananas).

loan.name: Ahmadiyya Secondary School Group

texts.en:
The members of this loan group are all teachers at the Ahmadiyya Secondary School in Makeni. The school was founded in 1984 by the Ahmadiyya Mission. Today, it has a total of 364 pupils with a staff of 10 teachers. The school carries a lot of pride for its ability to resurrect itself from the ruins of the civil war to become one of the most enviable schools in town.
This is the second time teachers from Ahmadiyya have received a loan from SMT. The previous loan was a great success to the first borrowers, hence three more staff have decided to join their colleagues this time around to borrow from SMT. Hawanatu S., for example, was able to start a small business using the previous loan. Today, her business serves as a supplementary source of income to her. Pa L. invested his money in agriculture and this has also served as an additional source of income to him outside of the classroom.
Fifty-one year old Naziru C. (on the left in the photo) is the principal at the school. He was born in Taiama, in the Moyamba district in southern Sierra Leone. He is married with five children. Two of the children are in junior secondary school, two are in senior secondary school and one is in college. His wife is also currently studying at the university. Naziru will use his loan to purchase house building materials, specifically cement for bricks and iron rods. Heâ€™ll also hire four or five laborers to do the work. He wants to build an apartment adjacent to his home consisting of two rooms and a parlor. Naziru travels to Freetown every weekend where his family resides. Heâ€™ll purchase the building materials there where the prices are lower relative to Makeni. A bag of cement, for example, will cost him 35,000 Leones (about USD$11.50) versus 45,000 to 50,000 in Makeni.
Government salaries are usually quite small for teachers, thus making teaching an unattractive profession for many whose primary motivation is money. Many choose other jobs over teaching because of the small salary, thus starving the field of qualified personnel to teach the children. The few who remain in the classroom have to find other ways of making ends meet. The vast majority of them engage in either business or agriculture or they provide extra tutorial classes for the children (although this is a practice the government is trying to stop). Needless to say, loans from SMT are a great help to the teachers in order to boost their businesses or invest in something productive. Many want to do more schooling, but cannot afford the cost. Some want to buy pieces of furniture, but their monthly salary is not enough to let them do so. With a loan, they will be able to meet some of these needs. And with their monthly salaries, they can easily repay the loan via a payroll deduction type of system.
In 2003, after the rebel forces left the town, Ahmadiyya school could only boast of having five teachers, thus making the schoolâ€™s performance on national exams very poor. But with the intervention of the new principal, Naziru C., Ahmadiyya today has a total of 10 staff. In last yearâ€™s national exams (also known as BECE â€“ Basic Education Certification Examination) the school had two pupils who obtained some of the highest marks on the exams. This was a clear statement to bigger schools whose pupils could not score such high grades.
In the sporting arena, Ahamdiyya Secondary School is the current holder of the soccer competition trophy organized by the Ministry of Education, Youths and Sports for Junior Secondary Schools. They defeated the AL-Harrkan Secondary School. Because of all their hard work and dedication to both academics and extra-curricular activities, the school was upgraded to a senior secondary school by the Ministry of Education last academic year.

loan.use: To buy building materials such as cements and rods and to pay laborers.

loan.name: Yihya

texts.en:
Yihya is a 42-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Yihya has been installing aluminum for 15 years. He works with all kinds of aluminum including for kitchens, windows and doors. Yihya has requested a loan of USD$600 from A. Majmoua in order to purchase household expenses. Yihya has been a microcredit client for seven years now and has always paid on time.

The loans have influenced his life in a good way. Yihya is speciA. in his work because he has competitive prices and his clients are his friends. He decided on doing this business because of his knowledge and his experience in this work. When he first started, he faced a lot of competition. In the future, he hopes to improve his family's income.

loan.use: Yihya needs the loan for household expenses.
